description:
Good. You're here. We've got duties to attend to.
I've been looking into the Blackwood Company. Heard some disturbing things. We know they're a danger to us. And we know they're good at what they do.
I've heard stories, but nothing I can prove is true. Maybe they've got a mage working with them. Maybe they're just well trained. All I know for sure is that they'll accept any contract, and they'll do anything to complete it. And they don't care who gets in the way.
We were contracted by a wizard, Argoth, to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart, a ruthless bandit leader. I went in there with twenty men. I left with five. Vitellus Donton wasn't one of them. He died covering our retreat. I snooped around. Apparently, the Blackwood Company completed that contract for us. I went in there with twenty good men. I can't believe that bunch finished the job. There's more. Argoth -- he's dead, the artifact gone. Sounds like a set-up. Maybe they made a deal with Blackheart. I don't know. But I'll find out.
Now we find out what really happened. And we let it be known. I want to show the people who the Blackwood Company really are. I can't order you do this with me. It's dangerous, and Vilena Donton isn't going to know about it. It's your choice.
If you accept this mission, we leave as soon as you're ready. I want to investigate Blackheart's stronghold at Arpenia. Meet me at the Leyawiin guild hall. We'll go from there.

description:
You have my, Sir Ralvas', tribute, sir knight. In three hundred years, none have passed the gauntlet. In three hundred years, we have never known hope. But for the first time, it seems that someone may succeed where we have failed. I see in you the chance to redeem our souls and restore the order. And now, I must ask you to press forward where I could not. I must ask you to face the challenge of Zenithar.
I was arrogant and foolhardy. I sought personal glory. I placed my own will and my own lust for fame over the will of the Nine. In facing the challenge of Zenithar, I failed. I tried dozens -- no, hundreds of times to reach the Mace. I fell each time. And each time I awoke in the chapel, I leaped again. I tried to enlist the help of the other knights, but none would come to my aid. The inscription says to "walk in the faith" but even now, I do not know what this means.
Below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin there is a shrine to the great craftsman, Saint Kaladas. Those seeking the Mace must pray before the shrine. When you bow, you will receive a vision -- or perhaps not. It is unclear. The priests saw that my body never moved, but it felt so real. You will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from you by a great chasm. The chasm represents your doubt. Your faith must be your guide across it.
This is what I know. As I said, my faith was weak. I did not understand the test and I fell from the platform each time I tried to cross. I have told you all that I know. All that is left is for you to prove yourself more worthy than I. If you seek the Mace, travel to Leyawiin's chapel, kneel at the shrine in the undercroft, and let your faith in the Nine be the salvation of us all.

description:
Dead Drop Orders #3
by Lucien Lachance

Are you ready to get your hands dirty, Silencer?
Your next target is a Khajiit nobleman by the name of J'Ghasta, who can be found at his home in the city of Bruma. J'Ghasta was recently offered the hand of a prominent Cyrodiil noble's daughter, but turned down the offer when he learned of the girl's rather negligible dowry. The girl's family is outraged, of course, and has hired the Dark Brotherhood to make J'Ghasta pay for his insolence.
Go to J'Ghasta's house in Bruma and end his miserable life. But be warned! The Khajiit is rich and bored, and spends most of his time honing his skills in unarmed combat. Any opponent who can kill with merely his hands is not to be trifled with, so tread carefully. Even worse, J'Ghasta is aware someone may be trying to kill him, and has bribed the guards not to interfere if a fight should spill out into the city streets.
When the target has been eliminated, you will find your next dead drop in a rotten box under the Old Bridge, just south of the Imperial City. The box will contain your reward for killing J'Ghasta, as well as information regarding your next contract.

description:
I, Sir Casimir, know where you may find the Gauntlets of the Crusader, for I was the one who lost them when I was still alive. Though many know where they are, they are still lost. I believe there is something you must do in order to retrieve them.
When the Order fractured, I followed Sir Berich into war, taking the Gauntlets with me. When it was over, I returned to this land. I attempted to return to the service of the Nine, but the war had changed me. I no longer had sympathy for the weak, or pity for the suffering. In the brief time I was there, I did more to hurt the Chapel of Stendarr than help it. It was there that I was cursed.
A beggar who came to the Chapel each day for help tried my patience one too many times. I lost my temper, and struck him. My blow landed harder than I had intended, and he fell to the floor, dead. Killed in the very Chapel of the God of Mercy. I left the Chapel at once, of course, but the damage was done. I was weak, constantly weary, and lacked the energy to do almost anything.
As proof of the deed, when I struck the poor man the Gauntlets slipped right off my hands and fell to the floor. Heavy as stone, they would not move. None could lift them. I suspect they lie there still, in Chorrol's Chapel. You must prove to Stendarr you are worthy to lift the Gauntlets once more. Seek out the priests of Stendarr in Chorrol. Perhaps they can help you.

Dead Drop Orders #2
by Lucien Lachance

The Necromancer Celedaen is dead, and you are not. That is quite an accomplishment. But your work as a Silencer has just begun.
Your next assignment requires you to eliminate not just one target, but five. An entire family, in fact. The unlucky kin are Perennia Draconis, Matthias Draconis, Andreas Draconis, Sibylla Draconis and Caelia Draconis. When every member of the Draconis family lies dead, journey to the city of Skingrad. In the castle courtyard you will find a well containing your reward for the Draconis contract, as well any further assignment I might have.

description:
Dead Drop Orders #5
by Lucien Lachance

If you're reading this note, Shaleez is dead. You've done the world a great service, Silencer. It's time to continue the good work.
Your next target is a traveling Dark Elf merchant by the name of Alval Uvani, who is currently renting a house in the city of Leyawiin. Uvani is a well-respected tradesman back in his native Morrowind, but his business often takes him very far from home. Therein lies the problem. Alval Uvani's wife has become disillusioned with her husband's repeated, extended absences and wishes to dissolve their marriage, and has sought the Dark Brotherhood's assistance. Lucky for us Cyrodiil is a bit beyond the reach of Morrowind's Morag Tong.
Alval Uvani is currently traveling around Cyrodiil, and is never in one place for more than a couple of days. In this dead drop you will also find a schedule detailing the Dark Elf's whereabouts; use it to locate him and plan your elimination. Be aware, however, that because he is forced to travel alone to the farthest reaches of the Empire, Uvani has learned to defend himself. He is a master of the Destruction school of Magicka, and is no stranger to killing.
When Alval Uvani lies rotting, journey to the Market District of the Imperial City. There you will find a shop called Stonewall Shields. Your dead drop is located behind that building, in a hollowed-out tree stump. As usual, you will find your reward for the previous contract, as well as information on your next.
Ah yes, I must mention one last detail. Apparently Alval Uvani suffers from a rare Dark Elf condition, a serious allergy to honey. If you could somehow get Uvani to drink the honey-based mead, perhaps by replacing his food, he would suffer from complete paralyzation. This would certainly make the Dark Elf a bit easier to deal with.

description:
You sleep rather soundly for a murderer. That's good. You'll need a clear conscience for what I'm about to propose.
I am Lucien Lachance, a Speaker for the Dark Brotherhood. And you, you are a killer. A taker of life. A harvester of souls. Your work, your deathcraft, pleases the Night Mother. And so, I come to you with an offering. An opportunity... to join our rather unique family.
On the Green Road to the north of Bravil lies the Inn of Ill Omen. There you will find a man named Rufio. Kill him, and your initiation into the Dark Brotherhood will be complete. Know that Rufio is old and weak, and sleeps his days away. You could kill him before he even has a chance to wake. If you so choose. Do this, and the next time you sleep in a location I deem secure, I will reveal myself once more, bearing the love of your new family.
Please accept this token from the Dark Brotherhood. It is a virgin blade, and thirsts for blood. May it serve you well, as does your silence.

description:
Welcome to Xedilian, I'm the dungeon caretaker, Kiliban Nyrandil.
Xedilian would normally have sent you back to the entrance when you stepped on the pad in the Resonator Chamber. Since you're up here, I can only surmise that adventurers are already entering the dungeon as we speak.
I'm afraid until the adventurers are dealt with, Xedilian will keep you here. Even I can't will its doors to open. To put it bluntly, you're stuck here for the moment. No disrespect intended.
The only thing we can do is let the adventurers complete a cycle through here. I'll be glad to help. I assume Sheogorath gave you the Manual. You can consult it for more information, or I can provide instructions.

The people of Bravil aren't talking, but you might try asking around, butter them up a bit.
Get to it.

My family and I are still trying to figure out what to do. We spent everything we had to buy the land and supplies, so we can hardly go back.

Take care, friend. Don't get yourself killed on our account.

description:
Hear me, and hear me well. Mannimarco will have what he seeks, but it will be his undoing at your hands.
With this gem in your possession, you will be impervious to his attempt to enthrall you. When he fails, that is when you shall strike. When we are done speaking, you will take this gem, you will then seek out Mannimarco, and destroy him. Get to him anyway you can. It is your only hope for defeating him. I have full confidence in you, and so I leave the guild in your care.
When I am gone, you will be recognized as Arch-Mage and leader of the Guild. Lead your fellow mages, and lead them well. The future rests on your shoulders.
Farewell, my friend.

description:
I've deciphered part of the ritual needed to open a portal to Camoran's Paradise.
The Mysterium Xarxes mentions four items needed for the ritual, but so far I have only deciphered one of them: the 'blood of a Daedra Lord'. In fact, Daedric artifacts are known to be formed from the essence of a Daedric Lord, from whence they derive their great power. Not an easy thing to come by, obviously, but we will need a Daedric artifact.
The only way to obtain a Daedric artifact is through the cults devoted to each of the Daedric Lords. The book "Modern Heretics" is the best introduction to Daedric cults. The library here has a copy if you need it.
Bring the artifact to me when you have acquired one. Remember, the Mysterium Xarxes ritual will consume the physical form of the artifact in order to release its Daedric power.

If you can make J'skar re-appear, you'll have your recommendation.

description:
Do you like parties? Because you've been invited to one. Of course you'll be killing all the other guests. Each guest, at some point in the past, wronged their mysterious host. Now he's hired us to exact his revenge. Are you ready to attend?
You need to go to the city of Skingrad, to the large house known as Summitmist Manor. There you will meet up with five very unlucky guests. In order to receive your bonus, you must kill each guest secretly, one by one. If anyone sees you committing murder, the bonus is forfeit. The guests believe there is a chest of gold hidden in the house, and have agreed to be locked inside until one of them finds it. In fact, the guests believe the key to the manor is inside the chest, and only by satisfying their greed will they be allowed to leave. Poor fools. There is, of course, no chest of gold. The guests will find no key. After you arrive, the doors will be locked behind you, as everyone expects. When all the guests lie dead, you will be free to leave.
Now go, see the doorman at Summitmist Manor. He will explain the rest. Have fun.

name: Go Fish

reward.description: Aelwin Merowald makes it worth the player's time

description:
You know, stranger, there comes a time in every man's life when he has to admit that he's lost the fight.
Well, I've fought and I've lost. Who did I lose to? Who is my great enemy? Well, don't laugh... it's a bunch of damn fish.
I'm a fisherman. Or at least, I was. Until one of those slaughterfish damn near took my leg off. I was collecting their scales, see. I had a contract with this young alchemist. You wouldn't believe what he was paying for those scales! Then last month, one of the bastards got ahold of my leg. Took me right out of the business. But this alchemist, he needs the scales right away. The alchemist was paying so much for the scales that I'm close to having enough saved so that I can retire. But now, I can't get out there to Lake Rumare -- not with this leg. I only needed twelve more scales! Can you believe it? I was so close!
I've picked up a few things in my travels. If you head out there and bring me back the twelve scales that I need, I can make it worth your time. Help an old fisherman out, won't you?

Prove to me that you deserve my favor. In Anga, my Forgotten have lived in peace for many years. They worship me from the dark, basking in their misery and filth. Now, though, some would seek to bring light to their darkness.
Priests of Arkay have intruded upon their squalor. I want you to help my Forgotten kill these priests of the Light. Cast this spell upon the priests. Allow my beloved Forgotten to kill the interlopers. When this is done, I shall reward you for your efforts.

J'Ghasta is dead! Well done! I was right about you, Silencer. You are a useful tool indeed. Let's see if you can continue to impress me.
You must journey now to the Flooded Mine. There you will find Shaleez, an Argonian hunter who was banished from her village near the Black Marsh/Morrowind border for the brutal murder of a Dark Elven family. I'm Sheogorath, the Daedric Prince of Madness. I've been waiting for you, or someone like you, or someone other than you, for some time.
Now? You run an errand for me. An important one. Of course, anything I tell you to do is important. My Realm, my rules. You're going to Xedilian, one of my favorite spots in the Shivering Isles. It's a little place I use to take care of unwanted visitors. And some are more unwanted than others.
There are those that have other ways into my Realm, and they're on the move. We don't want them here. Trust me. So, you're going to get Xedilian up and running. Here's a little book to tell you how, and the Attenuator of Judgement. You'll need that, too. Of course, you can always get more details from Haskill. He's a detail-oriented type of person. A big help. And a snappy dresser.
Now, get going. Before I change my mind. Or my mind changes me.

description:
Hail knight! I am Pelinal Whitestrake, whose Relics you seek with a worthy heart!
Your prayers have woken me from my endless dream. Or perhaps you have entered my dream, and I still sleep. I think others have sometimes spoken to me, others like you, but my memory is doubtful. Perhaps the others came after you. Your need must be great for the gods to allow us to speak. Has Umaril the Accursed found a way back? The foulest of a foul race. A thousand curses upon his unholy name!
I thought I'd won. But I should have known. The Slavemasters are a cunning breed. Umaril found a way to cheat death, as I could not. If you would seek for my Relics, I know little that can help you. All that has passed since my death is like mist that my mind cannot take hold of. My friends built a shrine upon the site of my death, Vanua, where the Ayleid Elves tormented me in a final act of revenge. I can show you where it once stood. Perhaps it is there still.
Fare thee well, sir knight. May the gods grant you to destroy Umaril utterly, as I failed to do.

description:
About two days ago, Count Indarys's son, Farwil, entered the Oblivion Gate with six other men. We haven't heard from them since then. The Count fears the worst, and has posted guards here so we can watch and see if anyone comes back out. So far, nothing.
At this point, Count Indarys is offering a reward for the recovery of his son from inside the gate... or confirmed news of his demise. If you find him or the rest of the Knights of the Thorn, get them out of there. I'm sure that the Count would also be pleased if the gate was closed.
The Knights of the Thorn are a bunch of rabble who fancy themselves true knights. Farwil formed the group around two years ago. They make grand boasts, and talk a good talk, but that's all they are. The real work goes to us, the City Guard. I hate to speak ill of them, as something horrible may have happened, but their own bravado got them into this mess.

Skingrad is an unusual place
description:
I, Raminus Polus, have a new task for you.
The Council is investigating what happened at Wellspring Cave. Many of our resources are devoted to the task, leaving our ranks spread thin. There is a related book that needs to be recovered. It was recently loaned to Janus Hassildor, the Count of Skingrad. I'd like you to retrieve it.
I understand this may not seem the most important of tasks, but still... it needs doing, and you are one of the few available to do it. A note of caution: Skingrad is an... unusual place. Be prepared for the unexpected.
The city of Skingrad lies southwest of the Imperial City. You should have no trouble finding it.
You have your task. Perform it as well as you would any other.

name: The Helpless Army
objective: free Brellach from Order
first_tasks: talk to the messenger

groups.name: Order
groups.description: Sheogorath's enemies who are not good at subterfuge

a messenger told Sheogorath that Order has attacked Brellach and routed his soldiers
description:
There's a perfect job for you, my newest and only Noble in the realm!
A messenger told me that Order has attacked my army's stronghold at Brellach and routed my soldiers! If Order has truly entered my army's stronghold, things have taken a disturbing turn. It means Order has tried subterfuge... not its strong suit. Amazing! Perhaps things aren't going as poorly as I'd imagined.
You'll want to get all the details from the messenger. Unless you already have. You haven't, have you?

if the player fails the Tournament of Ten Bloods, the player's soul belongs to Boethia
description:
Why do you summon Boethia? You are not one of my faithful.
Do you hope to be counted among my Chosen? Then prove yourself to me, mortal. I shall open a portal for you to one of my realms in Oblivion. Go, and take your place in my Tournament of Ten Bloods.
Survive, and you will be rewarded with my glorious sword Goldbrand. Fail, and your soul belongs to me.

name: Azura's Unfortunate Followers
objective: perform a service to Azura
first_tasks: kill 5 followers of Azura

quest_giver.name: Azura
quest_giver.description: the queen of dawn and dusk, one of the Daedric Princes

characters.name: Dratik
characters.description: a dead vampire

description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Azura, known as the Queen of Dawn and Dusk.
I have seen your name, traveler, and heard it whispered in twilight. I ask a service, which holds promise of fame and reward.
Many years ago, five followers of mine slew the vampire Dratik and its kin, but all were infected by the foul creature. Knowing their fate, they sealed themselves up in the vampire's lair. Their suffering weighs heavily on me. Five bright candles shall burn forever in memory of their sacrifice.
Travel to the Gutted Mine. The door will open to you. Bring the peace of death to my followers, and you shall earn my gratitude. For your service, you shall have my Star, that your deeds might be entered in the Book of Fate.

name: Trolls of Forsaken Mine
objective: find out what happened at Forsaken Mine and report back to Modryn Oreyn
first_tasks: find Viranus Donton and other Fighters Guild members who went missing

quest_giver.name: Modryn Oreyn

description:
I have got another job for you. It's a sensitive one. I need you to find Viranus Donton.
I sent him on a mission to Forsaken Mine. He and some others were supposed to clear the place of trolls. Haven't heard back from them in days. I want you to go check it out. I don't need to tell you how sensitive a matter this is.
We'd been contracted to clear the place of trolls. It was a tough job, but I felt the men I sent were up to it. I want to know what happened.
Get moving, and report back to me as soon as possible.

name: The Museum of Oddities
objective: bring anything unusual, bizarre, strange, or disturbing to Una Armina

quest_giver.name: Una Armina
quest_giver.description: the owner of the Museum of Oddities

description:
Hello, I'm Una Armina. Perhaps you've heard of my Museum of Oddities? There you can view all the finest Oddities of the Realm.
I'm always looking for new exhibits, so be sure to think of me when you see anything Odd! I'm always looking for new Oddities to add to my collection. Anything unusual, bizarre, strange, or disturbing -- bring it to me! I do pay a nominal finder's fee, but of course the real reward is your contribution to posterity.
Do you have anything that you'd like to contribute to the Museum?

name: Separated at Birth
objective: investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
first_tasks: find the person whose impersonating Reynald Jemane and tell him to stop

quest_giver.name: Reynald Jemane
quest_giver.description: an annoyed man, drinking his sorrows away

description:
If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times. I've NEVER been to Cheydinhal! I... oh, hang on. You're someone else. Apologies, my good friend, I mistook you for someone else. Always being asked about it, I am. 'Didn't I see you in Cheydinhal?', they say. Well I'm sick of it. Sick and tired, tired and sick. And perhaps a little drunk. But never mind. You look like the honest sort, so I've a job for you.
You're going to travel to Cheydinhal, and find out what sort of impostor is trying to besmirch my good name. And you're going to tell him... *hic*... You're going to tell him I am quite capable of besmirching my good name on my own. He should cease and desist immediately. There's fifty gold pieces in it for you, friend...

name: The Purification
objective: perform the ancient rite known as Purification by killing everyone at the Cheydinhal Sanctuary, and return to Lucien Lachance
first_tasks: assassinate Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava

quest_giver.name: Lucien Lachance
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar, Teinaava
characters.description: fellow members of the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Sithis
characters.description: the dark god of the Dark Brotherhood

groups.name: Black Hand
groups.description: the governing body of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: the player is an assassin of the Dark Brotherhood: Lucien Lachance has not spoken to the player in a while
the Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated: the player is not suspected, because they joined the Dark Brotherhood after the traitor became active
from this point forward, the player is no longer bound by the Five Tenets: Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as the player serves the Black Hand
Lucien Lachance gives the player a poisoned apple and a unique scroll of summoning
description:
I have been waiting for you, assassin. We have not spoken in some time, but I am well aware of your accomplishments within the Dark Brotherhood. That is why I have sent for you. I'm afraid there is a... situation.
The time has come to test both your skill and your loyalty to Sithis. The Black Hand has learned that the Dark Brotherhood has been infiltrated. By whom, and for what purpose, we do not yet know. What we do know is that there is some link between the traitor and the Cheydinhal Sanctuary. The traitor has tainted that place beyond repair. It was learned that the traitor has been active for quite some time, since before you joined the Brotherhood. That absolves you of any suspicion.
The Black Hand has chosen you to perform the ancient rite known as Purification. Everyone inside the Sanctuary must die! You must break one of the Tenets you have sworn to uphold. I know this is an unexpected turn of events, but drastic measures must be taken. Ocheeva, Vicente Valtieri, Antoinetta Marie, Gogron gro-Bolmog, Telaendril, M'raaj-Dar and Teinaava. All of these family members must die! From this point forward, you are no longer bound by the Five Tenets! Sithis will forgive any murder, any theft, so long as you serve the Black Hand!
When the rite of Purification has been completed, return to me here at Fort Farragut, and we will discuss your future. Now, take these special gifts. They will help you greatly. One is a poisoned apple. The other, a unique scroll of summoning. Good luck... assassin.

Summon a Faded Wraith right here, before me. When I have seen it with my own eyes, you shall be worthy of my teachings.

quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood, giving quest via "Dead Drop Orders #7"

characters.description: a horrible man

description:
Dead Drop Orders #7
by Lucien Lachance

My compliments on another job well done! Havilstein Hoar-Blood was more swine than man, and deserved to die quivering like an animal! You must not stop! You must kill again!
Your next target is a Wood Elf named Ungolim, who resides in the city of Bravil. Bravil is also home to an ancient statue known as the Lucky Old Lady. It is seen as a symbol of good luck and prosperity, and the fools of Bravil often speak to the statue and wish for good tidings. Every night, poor lovestruck Ungolim visits the statue and pleads desperately for the heart of a young maiden. This maiden is married, and her husband has learned of Ungolim's affection for his bride. He fears the competition, it would seem, and has commissioned the Dark Brotherhood to help in the matter.
You must go to Bravil, locate Ungolim, and kill him. The Wood Elf owns a house in the city, but he spends his days securely locked inside. I recommend you lie in wait at the Lucky Old Lady statue, and then eliminate Ungolim when he arrives for his nightly visit. He's generally there between the hours of 6:00 PM and 1:00 AM.
By all accounts, Ungolim is a deadly archer and a fearless opponent. I also have reason to believe he is expecting trouble, so if Ungolim senses danger, he may attack you on sight. Be vigilant, and bring the Wood Elf down! You must not fail!
When Ungolim's body lies broken at the foot of his dear statue, you must journey to the city of Anvil. Your dead drop is in a barrel located behind the statue in the pond. As is standard, your reward and next contract will be waiting.

objective: help Francois Motierre fake his death to escape his debts

Francois Motierre's debtors have sent an enforcer to kill him

Vicente Valtieri will give the player a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after the player successfully stages his death
description:
I, Vicente Valtieri, have a special contract that needs fulfillment. In truth. I don't wish to offer it to any other guild member. I've come to rely on your abilities.
We're usually called upon to take a life, but not this time. This contract requires us to stage the assassination of a marked man.
You must go to the city of Chorrol and break into the house of Francois Motierre. Inside you will find Motierre waiting for you. Do not kill him! You see, Francois Motierre is a marked man. He owes a considerable sum to the wrong kind of people. So, they have sent an enforcer to kill him. This is an unusual contract, Motierre had to make a special arrangement with us before it was approved. I trust in your professionalism.
Here, take this knife. The blade has been coated with a rare poison called Languorwine. One drop in a normal human bloodstream will mimic the effects of death immediately. I will provide you with a vial of antidote, which will be used to revive Francois Motierre after you successfully stage his death. You should also know that there's only enough Languorwine on the blade for this one contract. After Motierre is sliced, the knife will be useless.
As payment, I'll be pleased to award you this amulet, Cruelty's Heart.

I am Mirili Ulven, a botanist.
You're offering to help me with my research? Well... I suppose I could find a use for you, despite your lack of training. Collect some plants for me, will you?
Here's the list of things I need. Get me everything on it. Try to remember where you found it so you can tell me. It's important.
I will pay you 10 gold coins for each sample.

You'll find Baurus at Luther Broad's Boarding House in the Elven Gardens district of the Imperial City.

quest_giver.description: the tormentor of men, one of the Daedric Princes

description:
Another mortal come to do my bidding. I, Molag Bal, only wish suffering and death. You will bring me both. I want to see a man brought to the edge. And pushed.
Near Brindle Home you will find Melus Petilius. A good man. An honorable man. He disgusts me. He has sworn an oath: never to raise a weapon against another man again. I want him to break that oath, and damn himself forever.
You will let him kill you with this: the Cursed Mace. As you are doing this for me, I'll save your miserable life. Probably. Get out of my sight.

name: Scheduled for Execution
objective: assassinate Valen Dreth in the Imperial Prison
first_tasks: infiltrate the Imperial Prison via a set of secret tunnels

quest_giver.name: Vicente Valtieri
quest_giver.description: the player's superior at the guild of assassins

tools: just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers: it has recently been tightly locked, but Vicente Valtieri will provide a key
description:
Back for more? It just so happens I have another contract available, one that requires an expert in infiltration.
Ever broken out of jail? How do you feel about breaking into one? The Imperial Prison, to be exact. We need a prisoner... silenced. Can you do it?
Your target is a Dark Elf named Valen Dreth. He thinks he's safe in prison. He is tragically mistaken. A prisoner recently escaped from the prison, using a set of secret tunnels connecting to the Imperial City's sewer system. It's a perfect way inside. Just outside of the Imperial Prison is a grating that leads to the sewers. It has recently been tightly locked, but I will provide a key. It should be easy enough to locate Dreth in his small cell. Besides, I think you know the way, hmmm. He he he he he.
Valen Dreth has been imprisoned for many years. His tongue is sharp, but his body is limp and frail. He will prove an easy, pleasurable kill. You will receive a bonus if you fulfill the contract without killing any of the prison guards. Now go, and may the Night Mother go with you.

description:
Back for more work, are you? Good. Some of our boys are causing trouble in Leyawiin. Looks bad for the guild.
Some of your brothers have been getting rowdy at the local tavern. I've got no problem with cutting loose, but I don't like it when we all look bad. You're looking for Rellian, Vantus Prelius, and Dubok gro-Shagk. I haven't had any trouble with them before, so find out what's going on.
I'll be waiting.

description:
Hail, friend. I don't believe I've ever seen you down here in the Bloodworks before. Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Agronak gro-Malog.
I grew up here in the Imperial City, but I was born elsewhere. My mother was a servant in the employ of Lord Lovidicus, and resided at his fortress. Lady Lovidicus was a shrew of a woman. The Lord and my mother grew close, and ultimately fell in love. I was the result of their union. When the Lady learned of my birth she was furious, and threatened to kill both my mother and me. So we fled, leaving my claim to nobility behind.
My mother died recently. Before she passed, she gave me this key, and told me it would "unlock the truth," at the place of my birth, Crowhaven. Crowhaven is a ruined fort far to the west of here. I'd go myself, but my training regiment doesn't allow for the luxury of such an excursion.
My friend, you must travel to Crowhaven and use the key to unlock whatever it is that holds the proof of my birthright! Find this proof and return it to me, and I'll share with you some of my finest combat techniques. Trust me, you can't learn these moves in a book!

name: The Forgotten Chests of Pale Pass
objective: find the magical ring that G.S. hid inside some old barrels
first_tasks: use a key to open a chest to find another key for an another chest until you find the ring

first_task_locations.name: Pale Pass
first_task_locations.description: a valley in the Jeralls with some ruins

quest_giver.name: G.S.
quest_giver.description: a long-dead thief, giving quest via "Crumpled Note"

tools: "Crumpled Note" is addressed to an old friend of G.S.
G.S. recounts how he stole a magical ring from a wizard and escaped from the owner of the ring until he ended up into Pale Pass
description:
Crumpled Note
by G.S.

I guess you found the message I told you about, old friend. We've traveled together for so long, and you're the only one I trust with the ring and my story.
I knew climbing into the window of that wizard's house was a mistake, but the bounty on the ring was just too enticing to pass up. They said it was worth thousands of drakes... enough to keep me comfortable for a while as I lay low. They also said the owner of the ring was out of town at some meeting of wizards or some such.
They were wrong on both counts. You'd think I'd be used to this by now, dealing with the unpredictable in our line of work. But after trying to fence the ring all over the realm, no one would touch it. Worse still, the wizard was pursuing me the entire time. I had to call in many favors to stay one step ahead of him.
I decided to strike north and make for the neighboring land. As I was crossing the Jeralls, he finally caught up to me. Two fireballs later, I found myself tumbling down a steep snowy slope into a valley. Don't know where I am, but there are ruins of some old fort here. Luckily, that fetcher didn't follow me down; I assume he gave me up for dead.
I think I'm going to stash the ring in this valley, cross the border north, and return later when I feel it's safe. I've used some old chests I found in the ruins to make sure nobody stumbles across the ring by mistake; you know, the old key to a key thing like we used to do. If I don't make it back here, and you're reading this message, then the ring is all yours, my friend. Use it well and remember me.
G.S.

name: Whom Gods Annoy
objective: make the scamps go away from Rosentia Gallenus' home
first_tasks: dispose of the Daedric Staff

quest_giver.name: Rosentia Gallenus
quest_giver.description: a collector of arcane artifacts, who carries a Daedric Staff

groups.name: scamps
groups.description: little, beastly, nasty, smelly and noisy Daedra

tools: Rosentia Gallenus bought a cheap Daedric Staff: four scamps appeared after Rosentia Gallenus spoke the runic word carved on the Daedric Staff while holding it
the four scamps follow Rosentia Gallenus everywhere
Rosentia Gallenus can't compel herself to let go of the Daedric Staff
description:
These stupid scamps are driving me crazy! I'm at my wit's end! I, Rosentia Gallenus, beg you to help me!
The beastly little creatures are nasty, smelly, noisy and wrecking my beautiful house! I must be rid of them! I can't let people know I have scamps in here, or they'll think I've taken to Daedra worship. Try explaining that to the town guard.
I had a feeling buying that Daedric Staff would be trouble. Now I'm paying for it with more than just some gold. A few weeks ago, a spellsword was passing through Leyawiin and heard that I like to buy curiosities. He wanted to sell the staff you see me carrying. I eagerly bought it, knowing the value of Daedric relics. In fact, I was a bit suspicious when he sold it so cheap. His loss, my gain I figured. After examining it for a bit I noticed a small word carved on it in runes. Using a book from my library, I translated it. The word was nonsense. However, when I spoke it and held the staff, four scamps suddenly appeared! I thought I was done for! Strangely, they all just stood there. It didn't take long before I realized they were following me! I couldn't be seen in town with scamps following, so I decided to discard the staff. I can't explain it, but somehow I can't compel myself to actually let it go. This staff is obviously cursed! Now I'm stuck with it.
Oh please, I beg you! Take this staff to Darkfathom Cave and get rid of it and the scamps forever! I can't fight, and who knows what's guarding the shrine? Plus, do you know how dirty caves are? It'll ruin anything I wear!
Do this for me, and I'll reward you with another one of my curios I picked up a few years ago... a valuable ring. Ring of Eidolon's Edge.

You will retrieve this ring for me. Should you manage to do so, I shall consider sending a recommendation to the Arcane University.
The well is locked, so you'll need the key. Deetsan should have a copy of it. Now get moving.

description:
I am Haskill, Chamberlain to the Lord Sheogorath.
You approach the Shivering Isles. Through the door behind me lies the realm of Sheogorath, Prince of Madness, Lord of the Never-There.
My Lord seeks a mortal to act as His Champion. Perhaps the Lord Sheogorath will find a use for you. You'll want to pass through the Gates of Madness. Oh, and mind the Gatekeeper. He dislikes strangers to the Realm.

name: Falling Awake
objective: help Amiable Fanriene to have some sleep
first_tasks: find a safe place to sleep outside

quest_giver.name: Amiable Fanriene
quest_giver.description: an insomniac who is afraid of walls falling on him

tools: NONE
description:
Hello... don't mind me... Amiable Fanriene. I'm a little tired. Can't sleep at home, you know. The walls. They aren't safe.
I need someplace to sleep. I have seen some people sleeping out on the street, but they huddle too close to the walls. I need someplace safe. I can't just sleep anywhere. There're walls and statues and all sorts of things that can fall on me. Can't have that. Nope. But... if you find me a good place to sleep, a safe place -- outside -- I'll reward you!
Remember, walk lightly, and always look up.

name: A Lovely Letter
objective: use a forged letter to resolve a love triangle between Faendal, Sven, and Camilla Valerius
first_tasks: take the forged letter to Camilla Valerius and say that it is from Sven

quest_giver.name: Faendal
quest_giver.description: a worker at the Riverwood mill who dislikes Sven

characters.name: Camilla Valerius
characters.description: an intelligent, beautiful woman

characters.name: Sven
characters.description: a male Nord bard and a worker at the Riverwood mill, who is courting Camilla Valerius

tools: NONE
description:
Sven is a bard, so he says. Occasionally he finds time to do his job here at the mill. Thinks his ballads and sonnets are going to convince Camilla Valerius to marry him. As if she would say "yes".
An intelligent, beautiful woman like her wouldn't fall for that nonsense... I hope. I've been thinking... maybe Camilla needs a little help seeing Sven for what he is. Could you... could you give her this letter, and say it's from Sven? I think I've matched that Nord's lack of cleverness perfectly.
I would appreciate your help. You could take some gold I've saved up from working at the mill.

name: Distant Memories
objective: help Brand-Shei uncover his past
first_tasks: find clues about Brand-Shei's past

quest_giver.name: Brand-Shei
quest_giver.description: an orphaned dark elf who was raised by Argonians in the Black Marsh

groups.name: House Telvanni
groups.description: one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago

locations.name: Morrowind
locations.description: the land of the dark elves

tools: when Brand-Shei was found by his Argonian father, Brand-Shei was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni
description:
I may be dark elf by birth, but I was raised Argonian. Through reasons I'm still trying to discover, I ended up orphaned then taken in by a kindly Argonian family in Black Marsh. I hope one day to find out what happened to me... how I ended up like that.
I know when I was found by my Argonian father, I was wrapped in a blanket bearing the symbol of House Telvanni. It was one of the great houses in Morrowind long ago. Whether that means I was one of them or not, I'm uncertain.
If you come across anything in your travels that might provide me with the answers I'm looking for, I'd be grateful.

name: No Stone Unturned
objective: talk to Vex after collecting the 24 Stones of Barenziah
first_tasks: find the 24 Stones of Barenziah

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

reward.description: Vex buys the whole set of 24 Stones of Barenziah

items.name: Stone of Barenziah, Stones of Barenziah
items.description: gem stones that were pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks

characters.name: Barenziah
characters.description: a legendary queen

tools: the player showed a Stone of Barenziah to Vex for appraisal
description:
Been a while since I've seen one of those. What you've got there is a Stone of Barenziah. The stone was pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks.
I think there were twenty-four in all; supposedly, all of them are in Skyrim. Most people keep them as a curiosity. Some of the Guild members have tried to locate them over the years, but they haven't been successful... well, until now.
I only buy things I can turn around quickly for a profit. And no one wants those stones unless they have the whole set. Tell you what, if you find the rest of them, talk to me again. Otherwise, keep it and maybe it'll bring you luck.

name: Before the Storm
objective: inform Balgruuf about the dragon in Helgen
first_tasks: find Balgruuf

quest_giver.name: Alvor
quest_giver.description: a man who saw a dragon flying down from the south

reward.description: Alvor will be in the player's debt

characters.name: Balgruuf
characters.description: the Jarl of Whiterun

locations.name: Helgen
locations.description: a village that was destroyed by a dragon

tools: the player told Alvor that there was a dragon in Helgen
description:
What? A dragon? In Helgen? That explains what I saw earlier... a dragon flying down from the south... I was hoping I was wrong about what I thought it was... Didn't want to believe my own eyes, is all.
The Jarl needs to know if there's a dragon on the loose. Riverwood is defenseless... We need to get word to Jarl Balgruuf in Whiterun to send whatever soldiers he can. If you'll do that for me, I'll be in your debt.

name: A Crumbling Empire
objective: conquer Solitude, and free Skyrim from the Empire
first_tasks: fight your way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the Imperial legion itself

quest_giver.name: Ulfric
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Stormcloaks

locations.name: Castle Dour
locations.description: the headquarters of the Imperial legion

tools: Ulfric is addressing the player and the player's fellow Stormcloaks: the true sons and daughters of Skyrim
Sovngarde awaits those who die fighting
the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be: full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free
description:
This is it men! It's time to make this city ours!
We come to this moment carried by the sacrifices and the courage of our fellows. Those who have fallen. And those still bearing the shields to our right. On this day, our enemy will know the fullness of our determination, the true depth of our anger, and the exalted righteousness of our cause.
The gods are watching. The spirits of our ancestors are stirring. And the men under suns yet to dawn will be transformed by what we do here today. Fear neither pain, nor darkness. For Sovngarde awaits those who die with weapons in their hands, and courage in their hearts.
We now fight our way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the legion itself! And in that moment, the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be. Full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free!
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the sons and daughters of Skyrim!

name: Painting the Seas Red
objective: assassinate Safia
first_tasks: find Safia

first_task_locations.name: Red Wave
first_task_locations.description: Safia's ship, in the Solitude docks

characters.name: Safia
characters.description: a ruthless female pirate captain who is deadly with a blade

tools: this is Nazir's final, most challenging assassination contract
Safia's crew is loyal and bloodthirsty
description:
I have an assassination contract for you: Safia, a pirate captain. She can be found aboard her ship, the Red Wave. It's currently docked at the Solitude docks.
Safia is a ruthless she-devil, by all accounts. Deadly with a blade. And let's not forget her crew - loyal and bloodthirsty, the lot of them.
This is my final contract, and certainly the most challenging. Be careful with this one, my friend. If you are capable of pulling through this, you've not only earned your payment, but my respect as well. And believe me, friend - that does not come easily.

name: Retaking Thirsk
objective: help Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors retake Thirsk Mead Hall
first_tasks: fight Rieklings with Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors

first_task_locations.name: Thirsk Mead Hall
first_task_locations.description: a mead hall, the home of Bujold the Unworthy and his warriors, up there on the hill

quest_giver.name: Bujold the Unworthy
quest_giver.description: the leader of the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall

enemies.name: Rieklings
enemies.description: tenacious creatures that attack people in large packs

tools: the player asked Bujold the Unworthy what is going on here
description:
What's going on here is that we've been kicked out of our home. The Thirsk Mead Hall, up there on the hill. We were... some Rieklings have taken it over.
Rieklings overcame us with tenacity and numbers. Didn't help that we'd grown a little too comfortable up there. Too much mead. Too many stories. Too few battles.
Are you... offering to help? Some new blood should be enough to rouse these layabouts to actually fight again.

name: The Heist Job
objective: steal an item from a store strongbox
first_tasks: break into a store strongbox

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

tools: NONE
description:
Every now and again, we like to remind the shopkeepers that we're in charge. If that means breaking into their strongboxes and stealing something valuable from them, then so be it.
Feel like doing a bit of shopping... the Guild way? The owner of this shop stiffed us on their last protection payment, but we're taking it anyway.

name: Pantea's Flute
objective: recover Pantea's flute for her
first_tasks: find the flute

reward.description: Pantea Ateia teaches the player magic skills

characters.name: Larina
characters.description: Pantea Ateia's foolish female student

tools: Larina stole Pantea's flute and sold it to a necromancer
description:
That damn fool! I should wring Larina's neck! That fool student of mine stole my flute and sold it to some necromancer in Hob's Fall Cave.
Apparently Larina told him some story about the flute being able to make the dead dance. It's just a flute. A really old and valuable flute, but just a flute. I just got a ransom note for it. That flute has been handed down for seventeen generations!
Well don't just stand there. Go get my flute! I don't have any money to give you. but I can show you a few tricks I learned playing for wizards.

name: A Cultured Gift
objective: bring Rustleif "Night Falls on Sentinel"
first_tasks: find "Night Falls on Sentinel"

characters.name: Seren
characters.description: Rustleif's pregnant Redguard wife

groups.name: Redguards
groups.description: a race of people not from Skyrim

tools: Rustleif runs the forge together with his wife Seren, who is a Redguard
Seren worries how she will pass along her traditions to Rustleif and her child
description:
My wife Seren and I run the forge together. She still smiths even though we found out she is with child.
Our son or daughter isn't going to get much Redguard culture here in Skyrim. I know my wife worries how she will pass along her traditions.
Hey, if you find a book called "Night Falls on Sentinel", could you bring it to me? It's a story from my wife's people. Be good to have.
Don't know what the Redguards see in books, but it would make my Seren happy. Let me show you some tricks around the forge, when you return with the book.

name: Good Fortunes
objective: retrieve Shahvee's amulet for her
first_tasks: find Shahvee's amulet

reward.description: Shahvee would be in the player's debt

characters.name: Zenithar
characters.description: the god of wealth

groups.name: Argonians
groups.description: a people native to Black Marsh, who have not fared well outside their homeland

tools: thieves stole Shahvee's sacred amulet of Zenithar as soon as she bought it
description:
I'm Shahvee.
We Argonians have not fared well outside our native Black Marsh, but we're determined to make the best of things.
I began praying to Zenithar, the god of wealth, to bring us some fortune, but thieves made off with my sacred amulet almost as soon as I bought it.
If you found my Amulet, Shahvee would be in your debt, kind one.

name: Pushing Beliefs
objective: blackmail Raerek into helping the Stormcloaks
first_tasks: find proofs of Raerek's Talos worship in his quarters, and use them to blackmail Raerek

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

groups.name: Stormcloaks
groups.description: rebel forces opposing the Empire in Skyrim

characters.name: Raerek
characters.description: the Jarl's male steward, and a secret Talos worshiper

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the hero-god of humans, whose worship has been banned in the Empire

tools: Raerek is not a true son of Skyrim, as he still supports the Empire
the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Raerek's quarters
description:
Get over to Markarth. Rumor has it the Jarl's Steward, Raerek, is a faithful Talos worshiper, if not a true son of Skyrim - he still supports the Empire, after all.
But, if confronted with proof of his belief, you might be able to 'persuade' him to aid our cause, indirectly of course. Wouldn't want to sully his reputation, would we?
You'll need to be careful with this one. The Jarl's men won't look kindly on you rummaging through the steward's quarters.

name: The Bonds of Matrimony
objective: get married
first_tasks: attend your wedding tomorrow, from dawn until dusk

characters.name: Mara
characters.description: the goddess of love

tools: the player told Maramal that the player wants to get married
these are difficult times
description:
Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples.
You wish to be married to your future spouse? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times. Your wedding will be held tomorrow, from dawn until dusk, in the Temple of Mara.

name: Deadly Research
objective: assassinate Maluril
first_tasks: find Maluril

characters.name: Maluril
characters.description: a dangerous, rogue male Dark Elf mage who studies dwarwen artifacts

tools: the player has done assassination contracts for Nazir before
description:
I have another assassination contract for you: Maluril. He's dangerous. Very dangerous. A rogue Dark Elf mage doing research into dwarven artifacts should be both respected... and feared. Just not by you.
Maluril is doing his research in Mzinchaleft. A Dwarven ruin... what an exotic place for a kill. I hope the elf doesn't give you too much trouble. I once got set on fire by a sorcerer. Nasty business, that. But I digress.

name: Siege on the Dragon Cult
objective: recover the Dragon Cult leader's mask for Captain Valmir
first_tasks: find the Dragon Cult leader's mask

first_task_locations.name: Forelhost
first_task_locations.description: the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult

quest_giver.name: Captain Valmir
quest_giver.description: an officer of the Imperial Legion

reward.description: Captain Valmir will pay the player

groups.name: Dragon Cult
groups.description: cultists who were among the first men to arrive from Atmora, they worshiped certain animals, like dragons, as avatars of the gods

tools: the general sent Captain Valmir to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort
dragons granted terrible power to the Dragon Cult for their bloody sacrifices: they were swept out during the dragon war because of their cruelty
description:
You there! As an officer of the Imperial Legion, I require your assistance to complete my mission.
The General has sent me to obtain a powerful weapon for the war effort. This was the last great bastion of the Dragon Cult, and their leader's mask was reported to be quite powerful.
They were among the first men to arrive from Atmora and they worshiped certain animals as avatars of the Gods; Dragons being foremost. And for their bloody sacrifices, the Dragons gifted their priests with terrible power. But their cruelty was too great for men to bear, and they rose up in what would be called the Dragon War and the Cult swept from the land.
I'll pay for the Dragon Cult leader's mask. Get in there, find the mask, return it to me, and earn your pay.

name: Thane of Winterhold
objective: gain the honorary title of thane of Winterhold
first_tasks: help the people of Winterhold

reward.description: the perks of being a thane

tools: NONE
description:
There is room in my court for a new Thane. It's an honorary title, mainly, but there are a few perks someone like you could make use of.
However, I could only grant the title to someone who is known throughout my Hold.
You help my people, and I'll make you my Thane.

name: Rebuilding the Blades
objective: recruit new members for the Blades
first_tasks: find anyone who would make a good Blades recruit and bring them to Delphine

reward.description: the player should ask Esbern about the dragon lairs his been studying: the Blades recruits will do some dragon hunting with the player

characters.name: Esbern
characters.description: a male scholar, and a member of the Blades

tools: the Thalmor hunted the Blades down, but the Blades have a headquarters of a sort now: it's time to rebuild the Blades
being a Blade is a lifelong commitment
description:
The Thalmor hunted us down. It wasn't exactly great for recruitment. But we have a headquarters of a sort now. We'll rebuild the Blades.
If you find anyone you think would make a good recruit, I can certainly take a look at them. Remember, though, being a Blade is a lifelong commitment. Their loyalty has to be with us once they're in.
After you have recruited enough new Blades, ask Esbern about the dragon lairs he's been studying. We'll have the recruits do some dragon hunting with you.

name: The Forgemaster's Fingers
objective: bring the Forgemaster's Fingers, an enchanted pair on gauntlets, to the chief of the Orcs
first_tasks: find the Forgemaster's Fingers

reward.description: the player will become Blood-Kin to the Orcs: the player will be allowed to enter Orc strongholds

characters.name: Malacath
characters.description: the god of the Orcs

tools: the player is not an Orc or blood-kin to the Orcs: the player is not welcome at the Orc stronghold by the code of Malacath
description:
Halt, outlander. By the Code of Malacath, this stronghold belongs to the Orcs. Your kind are unwelcome. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.
Hmm... there is a way to become Blood-Kin, if you truly insist on entering our stronghold. We've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse.
They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Find them at Stony Creek Cave. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs.

name: Rescue from Fort Neugrad
objective: rescue Stormcloak soldiers from the Imperials, and capture Fort Neugrad
first_tasks: meet some fellow Stormcloaks, and find a way slip into Fort Neugrad

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

tools: NONE
description:
You're going to Fort Neugrad. The Imperials have some of our boys locked up there. But with a little luck, we can turn that to our advantage.
I've sent some men to scout out the area. Meet them near Fort Neugrad, see if you can't find a way to slip in the fort, free our men, and take over the fort. They'll never suspect an attack from the inside. This won't be easy. But that's why I'm sending you.
You got the grit to get this done?

name: Tending the Flames
objective: become a member of the Bards College
first_tasks: retrieve King Olaf's Verse

quest_giver.name: Viarmo
quest_giver.description: the welcoming headmaster of the Bards College

items.name: King Olaf's Verse
items.description: a part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim, a poem dealing with King Olaf

characters.name: Jarl Elisif
characters.description: the local ruler, a noblewoman

characters.name: King Olaf
characters.description: a long-dead king

tools: Jarl Elisif has forbidden the burning of King Olaf, a festival put on by the Bards College: to convince Jarl Elisif change her mind, Viarmo wants to read King Olaf's Verse
description:
Welcome to the Bards College. I am Viarmo, the headmaster here.
Always a pleasure to meet a prospective bard. You should be aware that many apply but we accept very few people. When possible, we ask applicants to perform tasks the college needs completed. In this case, I do have a task befitting an aspiring bard...
Jarl Elisif has forbidden the Burning of King Olaf, a Festival put on by the Bards College. We need to change her mind. To convince her I want to read King Olaf's Verse. A part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim. Unfortunately the poem was lost long ago.
According to our histories keeper, the portion of the Edda dealing with King Olaf might still exist in Dead Men's Respite. I need you to retrieve the poem.

name: Extinguishing the Flames of Rebellion
objective: put an end to the Stormcloak rebellion
first_tasks: fight your way in Ulric's castle, and make Ulfric face justice

quest_giver.name: General Tullius
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Imperial Legion

reward.description: men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the man who leads the Stormcloaks

tools: General Tullius is addressing the player and the player's fellow legionnaires: the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel
description:
All right. It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion. You all have fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point.
Ulfric thinks he can hide behind the walls of his castle. But we will fight our way in and drag him out through the rubble to face justice. Because this is the end for them, the Stormcloaks will fight like cornered rats. They will be fierce and crafty. But they are no match for Legionnaires.
You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating. The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded.
Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion!

name: Trouble in Eastmarch
objective: take care of the bandits troubling farmers
first_tasks: find the bandit stronghold

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the companions

tools: NONE
description:
There's some trouble in Eastmarch. Farmers getting troubled by some bad types who've built up a stronghold in the area.
There's nothing but a bunch of lowly bandits. Cowards, who will take little effort.
Take care of them. Do not spare them your blade.

name: Pieces of the Past
objective: retrieve the scattered pieces of Mehrunes' Razor for Silus Vesuius
first_tasks: find Ghunzul, Drascua, and Jorgen, the owners of the pieces of Mehrunes' Razor

reward.description: Silus Vesuius will pay the player

characters.name: Ghunzul
characters.description: a dangerous marauder

characters.name: Drascua
characters.description: a dangerous marauder

characters.name: Jorgen
characters.description: a man

characters.name: Mehrunes Dagon
characters.description: the evil god of the Mythic Dawn

groups.name: Mythic Dawn
groups.description: an evil cult that wanted to destroy everything during the Oblivion crisis

tools: after the Oblivion crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn: one of the groups found Mehrunes' Razor and split it into three fragments almost 150 years ago
the descendants of the group still have the fragments of Mehrunes' Razor: Silus Vesuius gives the player his notes on the owners
description:
I have a job you look perfect for.
A little history, first. After the Oblivion Crisis, a number of groups cropped up dedicated to wiping out the remnants of the Mythic Dawn. One of these groups found Mehrunes' Razor, the artifact of Mehrunes Dagon. They split it into three fragments and pledged to keep them apart forever. That was almost 150 years ago, and the pieces are still being kept by the descendants of that group. And they're right here, in Skyrim.
At least two of the owners, Ghunzul and Drascua, are dangerous marauders. And the third owner, Jorgen, I only know he lives in Morthal.
Here are my notes about them. I'll gladly pay you for getting the pieces any way you can. No questions asked.

name: Canceled Wedding
objective: find the hidden dowry for yourself
first_tasks: get your prisoner's dowry from a hollowed-out tree stump

quest_giver.description: the player's prisoner, a pompous woman

tools: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner's father hid her dowry
description:
You... you can't do this to me. Do you have any idea who I am? When my father hears about this, he will gut you.
Ah, now I understand. This is about my father's hidden cache, isn't it? The dowry for my wedding? Ha! Well it's safely hidden away, in a hollowed-out tree stump. Just outside Riften, tucked away nice and secure. You'll never find it.
Damn it. I gave it away, didn't I?

name: Lethal Competition
objective: assassinate Beitild
first_tasks: find Beitild

characters.name: Beitild
characters.description: an angry and desperate female mine owner

tools: Beitild and her ex-husband run competing mining operations in Dawnstar
description:
Someone has contracted us to kill Beitild. She separated from her husband several months ago. Now the two run competing mining operations in Dawnstar. I hear the mining business is extremely cutthroat. And those hours... they're murder.
Beitild's angry and desperate. A fighter.

name: A Journal of Regret
objective: retrieve Runil's journal for him
first_tasks: find Runil's journal

quest_giver.name: Runil
quest_giver.description: a priest of Arkay and old, regretful elf

characters.name: Kust
characters.description: Runil's male assistant

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: Runil became a priest of Arkay after the Great War: many died by Runil's magics
Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept Runil as one of their own
description:
I am Runil, a priest of Arkay. I came into Arkay's light after the Great War. So many died by my hands, my magics.
I'm fortunate that Kust and the people of Falkreath have come to accept me as one of their own.
Could you do an old elf a favor? I misplaced my journal in a cave I was exploring. I'll pay for its return.
Blessing of Arkay to you for your help.

name: A Comforting Amulet
objective: bring Torbjorn Shatter-Shield an amulet of Arkay
first_tasks: find an amulet of Arkay

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

characters.name: Tova
characters.description: Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's mourning wife

tools: Tova is not handling the death of her and Torbjorn Shatter-Shield's daughter well
description:
Please forgive my mood. I'm still coming to terms with my daughter's death. Our little girl died recently. I've been shouldering my days with strong mead, but nothing gives my Tova peace.
I've been looking for an Amulet of Arkay to remind my wife that our child is with the gods now, but I can't find one. Would you be willing to give me an Amulet of Arkay, should you find one?
I hope Arkay grants my wife some comfort.

name: Mastering Destruction
objective: learn powerful Destruction magics lost to the ages
first_tasks: read the "Power of the Elements" that Faralda gives you

quest_giver.name: Faralda
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher in Destruction magic

items.name: "Power of the Elements"
items.description: a book that contains clues about powerful Destruction magics

tools: Faralda has taught the player everything she can about Destruction magic
description:
I daresay you've learned all I can teach you about Destruction magic. But... That doesn't mean there isn't more out there.
Over the years I've heard things. Powerful magics lost to the ages, incredible spells that only the most skilled mages can master. This book, "Power of the Elements", is the only thing I've ever found. I think it's better off in your hands.

name: The Affairs of Hagravens
objective: help Melka reclaim her tower by killing Petra
first_tasks: let Melka out of the cage

characters.name: Petra
characters.description: a female Hagraven

groups.name: Hagraven
groups.description: monsters, a horrific cross between an old crone and a bird

tools: the player entered the room where Melka has been imprisoned
description:
Who enters? Will nobody save poor Melka?
You, meat! Come, come. Don't leave poor Melka to die. Pretty, pretty flesh. Let me out!
Petra! Evil Petra put me in a cage, stole my tower. Hate her, chew her bones! Let me out, kind, kind meat.
Ah, I have a pretty staff. Help me find Petra, wring her neck, pluck her eyes. Take my prize staff, I just want my tower back!

name: Lusting After Gold
objective: steal a child-sized gold statue for Degaine
first_tasks: sneak inside the temple and find the gold statue

first_task_locations.name: Temple of Dibella
first_task_locations.description: a temple whose priests are exclusively women

reward.description: Degaine pays the player half of what his man in Riften promised for the gold statue

tools: Degaine doesn't want the Thieves Guild to find out about his plans
description:
You see that Temple? Way up there. All them women, keeping to themselves.
Won't let poor Degaine in, no. Not even for a look. But they've got a treasure in there. Gold statue, size of a child. Who knows what they use it for, but I know what I'll use it for.
Stealing it and selling it for profit. Well let's not put it like that. Wouldn't want the Thieves Guild catching wind of us, eh? Nah, just creep in and have a go at taking it out. I'll be here, and pay you half of what my man in Riften promised for it.
You'll be helping out an old beggar, and the gods smile on that sort of thing.

name: A Reminder
objective: bring a bunch of Rieklings' spears to Hilund
first_tasks: find Rieklings' spears
tools: Rieklings had invaded the Thirsk Mead Hall, but the player helped Hilund and her friends to drive them out: Hilund wants to ring the whole Thirsk Mead Hall with Riekling spears to remember that moment of weakness
description:
To tell you the truth, I've been a little distracted. I've got this... idea.
I want to ring the whole hall with Rieklings' little spears. Mocking us, from the past. Making us work harder. Fight better. The only problem is, I'm going to need a lot of spears. A lot. So, if you could find a bunch of them for me, that would make it easier on me.

name: Durnehviir
objective: learn a dragon shout from Durnehviir
first_tasks: summon Durnehviir by speaking his name to the heavens

quest_giver.name: Durnehviir
quest_giver.description: a dragon, and a reluctant servant of the Ideal Masters

reward.description: Durnehviir will fight as the player's ally and teach the player his shout

groups.name: Ideal Masters
groups.description: the rulers of the Soul Cairn

locations.name: Soul Cairn
locations.description: a terrible dimension that imprisons souls

tools: the player fought against Durnehviir in the past: Durnehviir respects the player
description:
My desire to speak with you was born from the result of our battle. I merely wish to respectfully ask a favor of you.
For countless years I've roamed the Soul Cairn, in unintended service to the Ideal Masters. Before this, I roamed the skies above Tamriel. I desire to return there.
I fear that my time here has taken its toll upon me. I share a bond with this dreaded place. If I ventured far from the Soul Cairn, my strength would begin to wane until I was no more.
I will place my name with you and grant you the right to call my name from Tamriel. Do me this simple honor and I will fight at your side as your Grah-Zeymahzin, your Ally, and teach you my Thu'um.
Simply speak my name to the heavens when you feel the time is right.

name: Prophet
objective: find a way to read Serana's Elder Scroll
first_tasks: ask the wizards about reading Elder Scrolls

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

locations.name: Cyrodiil
locations.description: a province half a continent away from the player and Serana

tools: Serana has a large Elder Scroll on her back: Serana's Elder Scroll will have something that can help the player and Serana stop Serana's father
the moth priests of Cyrodiil are the only people who can read Elder Scrolls
description:
So, in case you didn't notice the giant thing on my back, I have an Elder Scroll with me. Whatever it says, it will have something that can help us stop my father. But of course, neither of us can read it.
The Moth Priests are the only ones I've heard of who can do it. They spend years preparing before they start reading, though. Not that it helps us anyway, because they're all half a continent away in Cyrodiil.
The College of Winterhold was the first place I'd think to go for any kind of magic or historical thing. The wizards there know about all kinds of things that people probably shouldn't know about.

name: Briarheart Necropsy
objective: examine a Briarheart for Neloth so that he can improve his heart stone experiments
first_tasks: find a Briarheart

first_task_locations.description: the hills on the western edge of Skyrim

groups.name: Briarhearts
groups.description: fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes

tools: Briarhearts remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds, putting their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces
description:
I've been having difficulties with my heart stone experiments.
Have you heard of the Briarhearts? They are fierce warriors of the Forsworn tribes. They actually remove their own hearts, and replace them with large briar seeds. It puts their lifesparks in direct connection to the natural forces.
Well, I'm hoping to do something similar... if I could connect a living being to the forces of nature... well... that would be formidable. I've done some experiments in this area, but, well, my test subjects are far too fragile. I'm hoping to learn some of the Briarheart techniques, their methods.
I need you to examine one of them. Just investigate as much as you can. The Forsworn live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim. From there, you're on your own. I'm given to understand that they are not difficult to find, if you gather my inference.

name: Reluctant Steward
objective: tell Varona that Neloth wants apple cabbage stew with some canis root tea
first_tasks: find Varona

quest_giver.name: Neloth
quest_giver.description: a pompous master wizard of Telvanni

characters.name: Varona
characters.description: Neloth's female steward

groups.name: Telvanni
groups.description: a great house of powerful wizards

tools: the player is the hero of Skyrim
description:
Where is that ash sucking steward of mine? Varona! Have you seen Varona? I'm hungry.
Find her. Tell her I want apple cabbage stew, with some canis root tea. After all, I don't make my own tea. I am a master wizard of the house Telvanni. Other people make tea for me.
You are not my servant? Obviously not, or you would have a cup of tea in your hands. I supposed you want to be asked nicely. Very well.
Please, oh hero of Skyrim. Please find Varona. I shall be ever so grateful.

name: Magic Student
objective: help an aspiring wizard learn warding spells
first_tasks: raise your own warding spell and allow the aspiring wizard to cast a spell at it
tools: the aspiring wizard wants to join the College of Winterhold
description:
I've finally found you! I want to join the College of Winterhold. But I need help with my wards. Can you teach me?
So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the 'right' way to do things.

name: Purity
objective: handle Vilkas' personal troubles
first_tasks: help Vilkas give up his beastblood

first_task_locations.name: Tomb of Ysgramor
first_task_locations.description: a tomb where lycanthropy can be cured

quest_giver.name: Vilkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions, and a werewolf

characters.name: Kodlak
characters.description: the dead male leader of the Companions

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied underworld of honorable heroes

groups.name: Glenmoril
groups.description: a coven of witches who cursed the Companions with lycanthropy

tools: Kodlak's final teaching: those with beastblood cannot enter Sovngarde
the player has a head of the Glenmoril that is needed to cure lycanthropy
description:
There is always work for the Companions. But there is more personal task before me.
Kodlak's final teaching is troubling me. I think he was right about beastblood and Sovngarde. I wish to cleanse myself that I might know glory in the afterlife.
Will you help me give up my beasthood? You still bear a head of the Glenmoril betrayers, yes? Then lead on, back to the Tomb of Ysgramor.
My soul is now prepared.

name: Harsh Master
objective: take care of a runaway sailor and his gang of thieves
first_tasks: find the runaway sailor

quest_giver.name: Kjar
quest_giver.description: the harsh captain of the North Wind

tools: NONE
description:
The North Wind is my mistress, and I'm her master. I don't tolerate any disloyalty. You looking for work? Got a sailor who thought running a gang of thieves would be more money than hauling my cargo.
You make an example of that gang, I'll give you a year's worth of pay.  Don't spend it all on mead.

name: A False Front
objective: deliver false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal
first_tasks: convince an innkeeper to help you locate an Imperial runner, get the Imperial orders from the runner, and replace them with forgeries

first_task_locations.description: an inn in Dragon Bridge or Rorikstead

quest_giver.name: Galmar Stone-Fist
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Stormcloaks

tools: NONE
description:
I Need you to deliver some false orders to the Imperial Legate in Morthal. But first we need to get our hands on some Imperial orders to make the forgeries.
The inns at Dragon Bridge and Rorikstead are frequent stops for Imperial runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Talos guide you.

name: Berries for Elmus
objective: retrieve some juniper berries for Elmus
first_tasks: find juniper berries
tools: the player helped Elmus and the others reclaim the Thirsk Mead Hall from monsters
description:
We lost most of the mead batches we had brewing when... before those things were here. One is just ready to take its turn, though, and it's about time to add some of the flavorings.
You can't find them on Solstheim, but if you find yourself back in Skyrim, I wouldn't mind you bringing some juniper berries.
They add a different kind of sweetness. Tart. Makes the flavor more round.

name: The Book of Love
objective: act as the hands of Mara in the world
first_tasks: help Fastred with her fickle love

characters.name: Mara
characters.description: the goddess of love

characters.name: Fastred
characters.description: a young woman

tools: NONE
description:
I am devoted to the Goddess Mara, who gave mortals the gift of love that they might have a hint of eternity. Her blessings are many. To love is to know the true nature of the gods.
Not all can hear the broad echoes of deepest dawn. To receive the touch of Mara, you must first act as her hands in the world. Explore the facets of the infinite jewel. Are you prepared, then, to help bring the light across this land?
The dawn surely opens upon you, child. You must bear its light that all may see. Mara has reflected an image to me. A young woman... almost a girl... her fickle love must resolve itself. The village of Ivarstead. The woman, Fastred. This is the prayer heard by the goddess and relayed to her servants.
Return when Fastred has seen her path. I will entreat Mara on your behalf.

name: Moss Mother Cavern
objective: help Valdr avenge his fallen friends
first_tasks: kill 3 Spriggans with Valdr

characters.name: Ari
characters.description: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a woman

characters.name: Niels
characters.description: Valdr's dead hunter friend, a man

tools: Valdr, Ari and Niels tracked a bear to Moss Mother Cavern: Spriggans appeared and killed Ari and Niels
description:
Name's Valdr. I hunt out of Falkreath.
We tracked a bear to this den, Moss Mother Cavern. Good coin for those pelts. We had the big sow cornered when they showed up. Three of them, out of nowhere. Spriggans.
Niels went down before we even knew to run. Ari died just inside. I never even thought the things were real. But now what? I can't just walk away. Not with my friends' bodies in there, being torn apart by those beasts.
You would help me clear out the Spriggans? You'd do that for a stranger? I don't know what to say. Lead on, I suppose.

name: The Fate of the Skaal
