objective: free the Skaal at the Wind Stone from control
first_tasks: learn the word of power that Miraak learned long ago
use the word of power on the Wind Stone

first_task_locations.name: Wind Stone
first_task_locations.description: a sacred stone of the Skaal

characters.name: Miraak
characters.description: a man

tools: NONE
description:
Our time here is running out. The few of us left free of control cannot protect ourselves for much longer.
You must go to Saering's Watch. Learn there the Word of Power that Miraak learned long ago, and use that knowledge on the Wind Stone.
You may be able to break the hold on our people there, and free them from control.

name: J'zargo's Experiment
objective: help J'zargo test his new spells
first_tasks: use J'zargo's flame cloak scrolls against undead, and report back to J'zargo whether they work

quest_giver.name: J'zargo
quest_giver.description: a fellow mage student who is working hard on new spells

tools: J'zargo gives the player plenty of flame cloak scrolls
description:
Can you... can you possibly help J'zargo? You must be very skilled with magic, yes? J'zargo is working hard, but cannot do it alone.
J'zargo has worked hard on learning new spells, trying new things. This will make J'zargo stand out as a mage. But J'zargo works so hard, there is no time to test these new spells.
If you help with the testing, this will make learning easier. J'zargo will give you scrolls, you will use them and report the results. This is a good plan, no? Let's see... this one, I think. J'zargo has designed it to be an excellent flame cloak, with a twist. It is especially potent against the undead, and should burn them to a crisp in no time. J'zargo gives you plenty of these scrolls, so you try them and return when you can say whether they work.

name: Enchanting Pick-Up
objective: bring an item from a client to Sergius Turrianus
first_tasks: get the item from Sergius Turrianus' client

quest_giver.name: Sergius Turrianus
quest_giver.description: an enchanter at the College of Winterhold

tools: the player is a student at the College of Winterhold
Sergius Turrianus gives the player the name and the location of the client
description:
There's more enchanting to be done. You can acquire whatever it is and bring it back here, and I'll take care of it.
Be quick about it, will you? This is a good way for the College to bring in some money.
Here's the name and location of the client.

name: Supply and Demand
objective: destroy the source of Skooma and report back to Laila Law-Giver
first_tasks: go to the source of Skooma

quest_giver.name: Laila Law-Giver
quest_giver.description: the noblewoman who rules over Riften

reward.description: the player will be on their way to a title in Riften

characters.name: Sarthis
characters.description: a male Skooma dealer

tools: the player raided Sarthis' warehouse and killed him for Laila Law-Giver: the player knows where the source of the Skooma is
description:
It's nice to receive good news for a change. Did you recover anything else from the warehouse worth mentioning?
If you have discovered the source of Skooma, then there's no time to lose. It won't take long for Sarthis's associates to learn of his death. The source of the poison must be destroyed once and for all, otherwise another dealer will simply take his place.
Do this task for me and you'll be well on your way to a title in Riften. Report back to me when your task is complete.

name: Hunting the Monster
objective: destroy a vampire
first_tasks: visit the vampire's contact, and find out where the vampire is hiding
tools: NONE
description:
I've learned of a possible vampire.
And while I do not know its exact whereabouts, I do have information suggesting someone who does.
Pay a visit to the beast's last known contact. Do what you must to find where it's hiding now.
Then root out the monster, and destroy it.

name: The Man Who Cried Wolf
objective: investigate the reports of strange happenings near Wolfskull Cave
first_tasks: clear out the Wolfskull Cave

first_task_locations.name: Wolfskull Cave
first_task_locations.description: a cave that is said to be haunted because of Potema the Wolf Queen's necromantic rituals some 500 years ago

characters.name: Potema the Wolf Queen
characters.description: an infamous, feared, long-dead queen

tools: Falk Firebeard thinks that checking out the Wolfskull Cave is not worth his time with the war going on
description:
There have been reports of weird happenings near Wolfskull Cave. Travelers disappearing, odd lights. I suspect wild animals or perhaps bandits.
The cave has a bad history. Long ago, Potema the Wolf Queen used it for necromantic rituals. That's where it got the name. That was over 500 years ago. Nothing much down there now - but everyone's always convinced the cave is haunted.
I don't think it's worth our time with the war going on, but if you want to clear out the cave, I'll make sure you're repaid for your work.

name: The Whispering Door
objective: find out why Nelkir has become brooding
first_tasks: talk to Nelkir

reward.description: Balgruuf the Greater would be grateful

characters.name: Nelkir
characters.description: Balgruuf the Greater's youngest son, a quiet boy

tools: NONE
description:
My youngest son, Nelkir, is a dark child. I don't know what to do with him.
He was always a quiet lad, but lately... something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent. He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him.
If you could speak to him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful.

name: A Cornered Rat
objective: locate Esbern, and ask where he was on the 30th of Frostfall
first_tasks: talk to Brynjolf about finding Esbern

reward.description: Esbern knows how to stop the dragons

characters.name: Esbern
characters.description: a paranoid man

characters.name: Brynjolf
characters.description: a 'well-connected' man

tools: the Thalmor are also looking for Esbern
description:
We've got to find Esbern in Riften before the Thalmor do. He'll know how to stop the dragons if anybody does. You'd better get to Riften. Talk to Brynjolf. He's... well-connected. A good starting point at least.
Oh, and when you find Esbern... if you think I'm paranoid... you may have some trouble getting him to trust you. Just ask him where he was on the 30th of Frostfall. He'll know what it means.

name: Laid to Rest
objective: investigate Hroggar's house fire
first_tasks: find clues among the ashes

quest_giver.name: Idgrod Ravencrone
quest_giver.description: the noblewoman who rules over Morthal

reward.description: Idgrod Ravencrone will reward the player

characters.name: Hroggar
characters.description: a man who lusts after Alva

characters.name: Alva
characters.description: a woman

tools: Hroggar's wife and daughter died in the fire: Hroggar blames his wife for starting the fire because she spilled bear fat in the fireplace
rumors say that Hroggar started the fire himself so that he could get together with Alva
description:
I want you to look into Hroggar's house fire. He lost his wife and daughter in the blaze. My people believe the house to be cursed now. Who am I to gainsay them?
How the fire started? Hroggar blames his wife for spilling bear fat in the fire. Many folk think he set the fire himself. Lust can make a man do the unthinkable. The ashes were still warm when he pledged himself to to a woman named Alva.
I can't arrest Hroggar on rumor and gossip. But you, a stranger, might find the truth for us. Sift through the ashes at Hroggar's house that others are too fearful to touch. See what they tell you.
Should you prove him guilty or innocent, I will reward you.

name: Hide and Seek
objective: kill a vampire masquerading as a regular citizen without being accused of murder
first_tasks: track down the vampire
tools: NONE
description:
I've located the whereabouts of a vampire masquerading as a common citizen in Solitude. Track him down and dispose of him.
Vampires enjoy stalking their prey. Passing among us undetected emboldens them. Makes them feel powerful, untouchable. But we'll put a swift end to that.
Tread lightly. The vampire can cloud the minds of those he preys upon. It won't be easy to convince anyone he's other than he appears. The law is unaware of the danger and will treat you as a criminal if you are caught. You must be clever. Find a way not to be caught or accused of murder.
We must be vigilant and self sufficient if we are to defeat these monsters.

name: Message to Whiterun
objective: make a delivery for Ulfric
first_tasks: deliver an axe to Balgruuf the Greater

quest_giver.name: Ulfric
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Stormcloaks, a man

characters.name: Balgruuf the Greater
characters.description: the Jarl of Whiterun, a man who has stayed neutral in the war between the Stormcloaks and the Empire

tools: if Balgruuf the Greater keeps the axe, Ulfric will bide his time
if Balgruuf the Greater returns the axe to the player, it means war
description:
I'm glad you're here. I have a message I need delivered to the Jarl of Whiterun. Deliver this axe to Balgruuf the Greater.
Men who understand each other often have no need for words. There are but a few simple truths behind one warrior giving another his axe. Balgruuf will know my meaning.
Give the man my axe. If he keeps it, I will bide my time. If he returns it to you, it means war.

name: Delivery to Calcelmo
objective: deliver a ring to Calcelmo for Kerah
first_tasks: find Calcelmo

characters.name: Calcelmo
characters.description: a male historian

locations.name: Markarth
locations.description: a city of stone and silver

tools: NONE
description:
My family came here centuries ago. We've made a good living smithing the silver that flows through the city. But you probably wanted to know about the fancy carvings and stonework, didn't you? Travelers always do.
Here, I have a delivery I need to make to Calcelmo in Understone Keep. Why don't you take the ring to him? He knows the history of Markarth better than anyone. He can be a bit difficult, but I'm sure he'll appreciate your help.

name: Nimhe, the Poisoned One
objective: kill Nimhe
first_tasks: locate Nimhe

quest_giver.name: Calcelmo
quest_giver.description: a stressful man, and the most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel

reward.description: access to Nchuand-Zel and Calcelmo's Dwemer museum

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct, ancient race of people

tools: the player asked Calcelmo to let the player inside his Dwemer museum: the Dwemer museum is a private place where Calcelmo can catalog his research
description:
You idiot. Do you even know who I am? The most recognized scholar on the Dwemer in all of Tamriel, and you people keep bothering me!
I... I'm sorry I... I got too excited. I'm in the middle of some very... stressful work, and I shouldn't have yelled. How can I help you?
You want to access my Dwemer museum? It's a private place where I can catalog my research. Occasionally, the nobles will come in and have questions, but that's thankfully rare.
I'll let you in if you agree to something for me. There's a giant spider in Nchuand-Zel, my excavation site. My workers call her 'Nimhe', the Poisoned One. If you deal with Nimhe, I'll let you into both the excavation site and my Dwemer Museum. What do you say?

name: A Sharp Heirloom
objective: retrieve Amren's father's sword for Amren
first_tasks: find Amren's father's sword

characters.name: Saffir
characters.description: a woman

tools: Saffir doesn't like that Amren has been spending so much time looking for his father's old sword
description:
I'm Amren, the husband of Saffir.
My Saffir doesn't like that I've been spending so much time looking for my father's old sword. He fed his entire family with the gold he made using that weapon. I'm not about to let it gather dust in some thief's trophy room.
I tracked it to a group of bandits nearby. The place is called Halted Stream Camp. But I'm no fool. I'd need the Whiterun guards or maybe hire some mercenaries to get it. I don't know why I'm saying this, but if you find it out in your travels, I'd be grateful to you.

name: Recipe for Distraction
objective: tell Modyn Veleth the location of a hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine
first_tasks: locate the hidden stash of Emberbrand Wine

first_task_locations.description: not in the Bulwark, one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of Raven Rock

items.name: Emberbrand Wine
items.description: a powerful and addicting alcohol drink

groups.name: Redoran
groups.description: a noble house that rules over Raven Rock

tools: Modyn Veleth's men have been stashing bottles of Emberbrand Wine: it distracts them from their tasks
description:
Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service. Looking for something to lend a hand with? We have problems aplenty in Raven Rock.
Commanding the Redoran Guard can be a difficult task. Even the most experienced warriors can fall prey to petty distractions. They usually didn't amount to much, but they make my job that much harder. Some of my own men have become quite accustomed to a spirit they called 'Emberbrand Wine.' Despise the stuff myself. It's powerful and tremendously addicting... I've seen men fail to finish even a single flask.
If I knew where they were stashing the bottles, I'd put an end to it myself. Could you track down the stash? That would be helpful. I just don't have time to do it myself right now.
They're too smart to have left it in the Bulwark. I'd search one of the abandoned houses on the outskirts of town.

name: Surgery
objective: change your appearance
first_tasks: give 1,000 gold to the flesh sculptor for her services
tools: NONE
description:
Are you interested in my services? I warn you, my skills do not come cheaply.
Hmm, I suppose I can work with your face. After all, the sculptor cannot always choose the finest clay.
Shall I remake your face?  It is no small thing to submit yourself to the flesh sculptor's knife. Just give me 1,000 gold and tell me what you desire - beauty or hideous deformity, nothing is beyond my skill.

name: Hungry Pups
objective: deliver spiced beef to Voada
first_tasks: find Voada

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: a nobleman

characters.name: Voada
characters.description: the Jarl's female dog handler

tools: NONE
description:
My family has been breeding and training dogs for years. You need one out in the wilderness. Don't want to be alone when some bandit comes swinging.
I personally trained a whole litter for the Jarl. That reminds me, I was going to deliver some dog food to the Keep. Spiced beef. Their favorite.
You volunteer to make trip and deliver the food? Well, look at you, thanks. Take it to Voada, she handles all the dogs for the Jarl.

name: Dravynea's Frost Salts
objective: bring frost salts to Dravynea the Stoneweaver
first_tasks: find some frost salts

reward.description: free Alteration training from Dravynea the Stoneweaver

tools: NONE
description:
I was a mage back in Morrowind. I lend my talents to the mines here, helping them keep the tunnels safe. By Azura, it gets hot in there. I use Frost Salts for a potion to keep the heat bearable, but I'm out.
If you want to go to the trouble of getting me some frost salts, feel free. I suppose I could offer you a bit of free Alteration training when you get back.

name: Cleansing Light
objective: destroy the head vampire to scatter its minions
first_tasks: find the head vampire
tools: NONE
description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a vampire lair at Movarth's Lair.
Destroying the head vampire is usually sufficient to scatter its minions, though it's best to destroy every last one of them.
I suspect there's more wherever he came from. We cannot afford to relax.

name: Escaped Criminal
objective: hunt down an escaped criminal
first_tasks: find the escaped criminal

quest_giver.name: Skjor
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Companions

characters.description: escaped criminal, a dangerous man

tools: NONE
description:
You're looking for work? It seems that law-breakers in the Pale have no desire to stay there. I don't blame them.
One of them's escaped, and you're going to find that coward. At this point they don't care what happens to him and neither do I. Best to just kill him and be done with it.
Be careful. This man is known to be dangerous.

name: Dark Ancestor
objective: destroy Vighar
first_tasks: find Vighar

characters.name: Vighar
characters.description: a male vampire

tools: there is an open grave in Falkreath graveyard: Vighar broke free from the grave
Dengeir of Stuhn's family is entrusted with keeping Vighar buried: somebody stole the wardstone that kept Vighar in the grave
description:
You may have seen the open grave in our graveyard. Most of the townsfolk think it's the work of a corpse thief. The truth is less pleasant. It is...was, the grave of Vighar, my own ancestor, dead for centuries now.
Vighar is a vampire. My family is entrusted with keeping him buried, but recently someone stole the wardstone that sealed him in the grave, and Vighar escaped. It's too late for the wardstone. Vighar must be destroyed. If this gets out, my family will suffer great shame.
See that Vighar is destroyed. He will have fled to gather others of his kind at Bloodlet Throne.

name: Heart Stones
objective: bring a Heart Stone to Neloth
first_tasks: find a Heart Stone
tools: every time the Red Mountain belches, more of Heart Stones land on Solstheim: the player may need to pick away at stone to pry the Heart Stone
description:
I'm running low on Heart Stones. If you have any with you, I'll buy one. Otherwise, I can tell you where you might find one.
Every time the Red Mountain belches, more of them land here on Solstheim. Look around for impact craters, exposed rock, that sort of thing. You may need to pick away at it to pry the heart stone itself loose, but you look... strong.
Good luck.

name: Elisif's Tribute
objective: help Elisif the Fair make the offering to Talos to complete her husband's burial
first_tasks: take Torygg's war horn to the shrine

characters.name: Torygg
characters.description: Elisif the Fair's dead husband

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the hero-god of humans

tools: Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire: when they buried Torygg, Elisif the Fair made offerings to all the gods except Talos
description:
There's something... personal... I was hoping you would do for me.
As you may know Talos worship is outlawed in the Empire. When we buried my husband I made offerings to all the gods... except Talos. My husband Torygg would want a proper burial.
I would like you to take an item of his, a war horn handed down from his father, and place it at a Shrine of Talos.
It would mean a lot to me.

name: Darkness Returns
objective: walk the Pilgrim's Path, and return the Skeleton Key to the Ebonmere
first_tasks: find and read the journal of the man who died attempting to walk the Pilgrim's Path

quest_giver.name: Nightingale Sentinel
quest_giver.description: a ghost who is dying, trapped in this chamber

locations.name: Pilgrim's Path
locations.description: a dangerous path to the Ebonmere

locations.name: Ebonmere
locations.description: a portal held open by the Skeleton Key

tools: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
the player has the Skeleton Key: the player has done the Thieves Guild a great deed
description:
The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again.
You've done the Guild a great deed. And although they may not show it, I'm certain they appreciate your sacrifices. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.
Nothing would bring me more pride than to return the Key, but I'm afraid it's impossible. From the moment I arrived here, I've felt myself... well... dying.
I'm afraid you have return the Key alone. I'm weakening, and I can feel myself slipping away. The years without restoration of my power have taken their toll. Whatever damage has been caused can only be corrected by following the Pilgrim's Path to the Ebonmere and replacing the Key.
The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?

name: The Bloodstone Chalice
objective: fill the Bloodstone Chalice for Harkon
first_tasks: follow Garan Marethi to the Bloodstone Chalice

characters.name: Harkon
characters.description: the Lord of the player and Garan Marethi's vampire clan

items.name: Bloodstone Chalice
items.description: a chalice that is able to increase the potency of the player's vampiric powers

tools: the player told Garan Marethi that Harkon wants the Bloodstone Chalice without addressing Harkon properly as Lord Harkon
Harkon has owned the Bloodstone Chalice for a long time
description:
Lord Harkon. Remember your place. Now, he wants the Chalice, then.
You've heard of the Bloodstone Chalice? The Chalice has been in Lord Harkon's possession for quite some time now. It is, when used properly, able to increase the potency of our powers.
Lord Harkon has neglected using the Chalice for ages. If he wants it filled now, then grander things are afoot. This is good.
Follow me. I'll take you to the Bloodstone Chalice.

name: Impatience of a Saint
objective: help Jiub find the first volume of his opus
first_tasks: collect the ten missing pages of Jiub's opus

quest_giver.name: Jiub the Eradicator, Saint Jiub, Jiub
quest_giver.description: a ghost of a man who wants people to know of his achievements in life

tools: NONE
description:
I am Jiub. Some call me Saint Jiub. Others call me Jiub the Eradicator. Perhaps you've heard of me?
If you haven't, I can't say that I am surprised. Until I get my second volume published, no one will ever know of my achievements. In order to write the second volume of my opus, I need the notes from my first volume. Otherwise I need to do all of this from memory.
When I was tossed in here I felt myself falling… and I dropped the pages I had been holding. There were ten of them in all.
Find them for me, please, I beg you!

name: Tolfdir the Absent-Minded
objective: help Tolfdir find his missing alembic
first_tasks: find Tolfdir's alembic
tools: NONE
description:
This is rather embarrassing, but it seems I've misplaced something.
I can't find my Alembic. I need it for some research. I suppose I could use another one, but... well, it sounds silly, but mine has sentimental value.
If you happen to see it, would you mind bringing it to me?

name: Speaking With Silence
objective: catch Karliah
first_tasks: find Karliah with Mercer Frey

quest_giver.name: Mercer Frey
quest_giver.description: the player's guildmaster in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Karliah
characters.description: an intelligent female thief, on the run from the Thieves Guild

tools: the player agreed to meet Mercer Frey outside Snow Veil Sanctum
Mercer Frey found Karliah's horse and killed it
description:
Good, you're finally here. I've scouted the ruins and I'm certain Karliah is still inside.
I did not find her in flesh. No, I found her horse. Don't worry, I've taken care of it... she won't be using it to escape. Let's get moving, I want to catch her inside while she's distracted. Take the lead.
Just make certain you keep your eyes open. Karliah is as sharp as a blade. The last thing I need is you blundering into a trap and warning her that we're here.

name: The Mastermind
objective: infiltrate the Thalmor Embassy, and find out who's behind the dragons
first_tasks: meet Delphine to talk about her plan to get inside the Thalmor Embassy

quest_giver.name: Delphine
quest_giver.description: a paranoid member of the Blades

groups.name: Thalmor
groups.description: a foreign power who knows who is behind the dragons

locations.description: Thalmor Embassy, the center of the Thalmor's operations in Skyrim that is locked up tight

tools: NONE
description:
The first thing we need to do is figure out who's behind the dragons. The Thalmor are our best lead. If they aren't involved, they'll know who is.
If we could get into the Thalmor Embassy... it's the center of their operations in Skyrim... Problem is, that place is locked up tighter than a miser's purse. They could teach me a few things about paranoia...
I have a few ideas about getting inside the Embassy, but I'll need some time to pull things together... Meet me back in Riverwood. If I'm not back when you get there, wait for me. I shouldn't be long.
Keep an eye on the sky. This is only going to get worse.

name: Silenced Tongues
objective: unlock the burial chamber of Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
first_tasks: find the two hidden keys

quest_giver.name: Heddic Volunnar
quest_giver.description: a scholar, giving quest via "Heddic's Volunruud Notes"

items.name: "Heddic's Volunruud Notes"
items.description: notes on Heddic Volunnar's research on Volunruud

items.name: Okin and Eduj
items.description: favored weapons when Tongue Chieftain Kvenel went into battle

characters.name: Tongue Chieftain Kvenel
characters.description: an ancient warrior, and a forefather of Heddic Volunnar

tools: Heddic Volunnar is scouting out Volunruud: the relief not far from the entrance hides Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb
the two hidden keys to Tongue Chieftain Kvenel's tomb are ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj
description:
Heddic's Volunruud Notes
by Heddic Volunnar

I was skeptical, but it's obvious now. The old hymns had truth to them! The relief wasn't far from the entrance, just as they said. I've no doubt now that it hides the entrance to Kvenel's tomb.
The two keys must be hidden somewhere nearby - ceremonial replicas of Okin and Eduj, favored weapons when Kvenel went into battle. I don't dare explore further without hiring bodyguards to accompany me, however. To think - The Tongue Chieftain Kvenel could be entombed behind just a few feet of stone! The ancestor we scarcely believed was real.
Twice damned for planning this foolish scouting trip. I should have hired those sellswords in the first place. Perhaps there's no need. This place is just a tomb, after all, and there are no obvious signs of habitation. It isn't as though the thousand-year dead will mind if I have a look around.

name: The Hunt
objective: send a message to the Dawnguard by killing one of them without drawing attention
first_tasks: kill a Dawnguard spy
tools: NONE
description:
You're going to go kill a Dawnguard spy.
But don't draw attention. Some kills are for fun, some for profit. And others are for sending messages. This one is a message. Don't make a big scene. Don't get caught.
The corpse is to be the message, not the attack. With any luck he'll bleed to death before anyone notices. A cold corpse will say what we want better than a warm one.

name: A Few Words with You
objective: convince Mikael to leave Carlotta Valentia alone
first_tasks: talk to Mikael

characters.name: Mikael
characters.description: a male bard who boasts about conquering Carlotta Valentia

tools: NONE
description:
That bard Mikael is begging for a dagger up against his throat, the way he goes on about me.
I've heard him boasting at the Bannered Mare, saying he'll "conquer me as a true warrior conquers any harsh beast." Hmph.
You could try to convince that lute player to stop chasing me. If you want to try, go right ahead. I don't think anything will get through that thick skull of his, though.
If you do convince Mikael, I'd thank the gods, but I'll settle for thanking you. There'll be some coin for your help.

name: A New Order
objective: recruit Isran's old allies for the Dawnguard
first_tasks: find Sorine Jurard and Gunmar, and recruit them for the Dawnguard

quest_giver.name: Isran
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dawnguard

reward.description: Sorine Jurard and Gunmar as allies

characters.name: Sorine Jurard
characters.description: a smart Breton girl, who is good with tinkering and fascinated with the Dwemer and their weapons
characters.location: Reach, trying to find dwarven ruins

characters.name: Gunmar
characters.description: a big, brutish Nord man, who trains animals, especially trolls

tools: the Dawnguard is fighting against powerful vampires, who have an Elder Scroll
description:
We're up against powerful vampires, unlike anything we've seen before. And they have an Elder Scroll.
There are people I've met and worked with over the years. We need their skills, their talents, if we're going to survive this.
I think we'll want Sorine Jurard. Breton girl, whip-smart and good with tinkering. Fascination with the Dwemer. Weapons in particular. Last I knew, she was out in the Reach, convinced she was about to find the biggest dwarven ruins yet. You'll also want to find Gunmar. Big brute of a Nord, hates vampires almost as much as I do. Got it into his head years back that his experience with animals would help. Trolls in particular, from what I hear.
If you can find them, we might have a chance.

name: Mistwatch
objective: help Christer locate Fjola
first_tasks: look for Fjola

first_task_locations.name: Mistwatch
first_task_locations.description: a tower hosting a bandit hideout

characters.name: Fjola
characters.description: Christer's missing wife

tools: the player stumbled upon Christer while exploring Mistwatch
Christer heard that bandits in Mistwatch ransom captives and thinks that Fjola might be one of them: he managed to sneak in and look for Fjola, but he is not a warrior
Christer gives the player a key that will come in handy
description:
Please, stranger! I need your help! Divine mercy - you aren't one of the bandits. Please, you've got to help me!
It's my wife, Fjola! I think she's being held in this tower. Let me explain. Fjola, my wife, left the farm on errands and never came back. It's been months, and I've been searching for her since. I heard a rumor that these bandits were ransoming captives, so I thought she may be here. I managed to sneak past the guards and get this far, but... I don't think I can go on. I'm no warrior! Please, can you look for her?
I don't have much, but I can give you some coin for the trouble. One of the guards dropped this key while I hid. I wager it will come in handy for you. Please hurry!

name: Fetch Me That Book!
objective: find a book for Urag gro-Shub
first_tasks: read the note
tools: Urag gro-Shub gives the player a note that tells the player the location of the book
description:
If you're feeling adventurous, I'm always looking for someone to procure valuable books from some more... dangerous locations.
Here, I scribbled down the last place I'd heard about. Check it out, but be careful.

name: Discerning the Transmundane
objective: uncover the secrets of the mysterious Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
first_tasks: gather the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer with an extractor Septimus Signus gives you

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct race of crafty elves of superior intelligence

tools: the player looks at the Dwemer lockbox with Septimus Signus
Dwemer blood can unlock the Dwemer lockbox: the blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer, can be used instead
description:
You see this masterwork of the Dwemer. Deep inside their greatest knowings. Septimus is clever among men, but he is but an idiot child compared to the dullest of the Dwemer.
To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. I see it now. The sealing structure interlocks in the tiniest fractals. Dwemer blood can loose the hooks, but none alive remain to bear it. A panoply of their brethren could gather to form a facsimile. A trick. Something they didn't anticipate, no, not even them.
The blood of Altmer, Bosmer, Dunmer, Falmer, and Orsimer. The elves still living provide the key. Bear you hence this extractor. It will drink the fresh blood of elves. Come when its set is complete.

name: A Mammoth Powered Startup
objective: bring Ysolda a mammoth's tusk
first_tasks: find a mammoth's tusk

characters.name: Ma'dran
characters.description: one of the caravan leaders

tools: Ma'dran would help Ysolda start her own business for a mammoth's tusk
description:
I'm Ysolda. Before my ma and da passed, I told them that one day, I'd become the best trader in Skyrim.
I met one of the caravan leaders, Ma'dran. He said he'd help get me started if I could bring him a mammoth's tusk. Easier said than done.
If you find one, I could teach you a thing or two about trading. Help you get a fair bargain in the future.

name: Ringmaker
objective: gather jewelry materials for Madesi
first_tasks: get two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore
tools: Madesi is one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remain in Tamriel
description:
I make my own jewelry. Sadly, I'm one of the few traditional Saxhleel jewelers that remains in Tamriel; it's becoming a lost art. Only trouble is gathering materials has become hazardous. The roads to the mines and to the other cities are thick with bandits... and worse.
Would you be interested in gathering some materials for me? I'd certainly be happy to compensate you. I'm seeking a small list of items to complete my next creation: two flawless sapphires, a mammoth tusk and a chunk of gold ore.

name: Joining the Stormcloaks
objective: prove yourself worthy of becoming a Stormcloak
first_tasks: kill an Ice Wraith

first_task_locations.name: Serpentstone Isle
first_task_locations.description: a strange rock formation that attracts Ice Wraiths

tools: NONE
description:
The Stormcloaks need dedicated men and women who're devoted to the cause and willing to die for it. Before I can put you to use, I need to know how much you can take. I have a little test for you.
I'm sending you to Serpentstone Isle. If you survive, you pass. If you die, well, you weren't going to be much use to me anyway. It's where men have tested their mettle for ages. There's a strange rock formation, built by the ancients. Something about that place attracts the Ice Wraiths.
You kill an Ice Wraith out there, and I'll have all the proof I need about you being Stormcloak material.

name: Materials for Smithing
objective: bring Stalhrim or Ebony to Halbarn Iron-Fur
first_tasks: find Stalhrim or Ebony
tools: the player drove Rieklings away from Halbarn Iron-Fur's forge
description:
Cleaning out the forge was the easy part. But those blasted Rieklings made off with most of my materials. And I can't forge air.
You tend to wander around, don't you? If you come across any Stalhrim or Ebony in your travels, bring them back to old Halbarn. Help each other out.

name: Innocence Lost
objective: do an assassination contract for Aventus Aretino
first_tasks: kill Grelod the Kind, the evil, cruel woman who works as the headmistress

items.name: Black Sacrament
items.description: a dark ritual used to employ the services of the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Grelod the Kind
characters.description: an evil, cruel woman, and the headmistress of Honorhall Orphanage

tools: Aventus Aretino did the Black Sacrament: he thinks that the player is an assassin from the Dark Brotherhood
Aventus Aretino was sent to Honorhall Orphanage after his mother died: he ran away back to Aretino Residence
description:
I did the Black Sacrament, over and over. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood!
It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract. My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament.
And you can kill Grelod the Kind! I have a family heirloom you can have. Supposed to be sort of valuable. I hope that's all right.

name: Totem of Hircine
objective: find a totem of Hircine with Aela the Huntress
first_tasks: go with Aela the Huntress

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a member of the Companions, and a werewolf

characters.name: Harbinger
characters.description: the leader of the Companions

characters.name: Skjor
characters.description: a dead male member of the Companions

characters.name: Kodlak
characters.description: a dead male member of the Companions who wanted to cure his lycanthropy

characters.name: Hircine
characters.description: the god of the werewolves

groups.name: Silver Hand
groups.description: a bandit gang who hate the Companions

tools: the player is the Harbinger of the Companions
Skjor and Kodlak talked about totems of Hircine: simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions
description:
Harbinger, I'd be honored if you joined me in my search.
I had once heard Skjor and Kodlak talking about the totems of Hircine. Simple-looking objects that could channel the powers of the werewolf in new directions.
Once Kodlak began looking for his cure, I'd wager Skjor didn't bring it up again. But I was going through his things and found a book I had never seen before. All about the Totems. I've been talking to my sources around the holds, and think I may have heard where one of them lays.
Want to come along and help me find this totem of Hircine?

name: Dragon's Breath Mead
objective: retrieve the Dragon's Breath Mead and give it to Olda
first_tasks: find Horgeir's stash of drinks

first_task_locations.description: a cave nearby, guarded by wolves

characters.name: Horgeir
characters.description: Olda's husband who promised to give up on the mead

tools: NONE
description:
My husband Horgeir promised me, swore on his ancestors, that he'd give up the mead. And what do I find out?
He's been stashing drink in a cave nearby. He even has some wolves guarding it. I swear, I should just cut out his tongue. That would be the end of it.
You could get Horgeir's stash for me, but I'll keep my dagger sharpened just in case. You can help yourself to any drink you find, but bring me the bottle of Dragon's Breath Mead. It's his favorite, so I know he has one there.

name: The Burglary Job
objective: commit a burglary
first_tasks: break into a house, and steal a specific item

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

tools: the player can't kill anyone who lives in the house or they forfeit the payment
description:
I have a little job for you. Pretty simple. Break into a house, grab a specific item and get out before they realize what's going on.
The catch is you can't kill anyone who lives there or you forfeit the payment. You ready for some good old-fashioned burglary?

name: Kill Me and Be Done with It...
objective: find your prisoner's hidden treasure for yourself
first_tasks: get your prisoner's treasure from a hollowed-out rock

first_task_locations.description: the tundra a bit west of Whiterun

tools: the player is torturing their prisoner: the prisoner wants to die
description:
Please... What is it you want?
Just... just stop. And I'll tell you where I've hidden my treasure. It's... in a hollowed-out rock. In the tundra. A bit west of Whiterun. Now please... please stop.
Oh gods, you've taken everything I have. Just kill me and be done with it...

name: Sovngarde
objective: go over the Whalebone Bridge to the Hall of Valor
first_tasks: complete Tsun's warrior's test

first_task_locations.name: Sovngarde
first_task_locations.description: the storied underworld of heroic souls

quest_giver.name: Tsun
quest_giver.description: Shor's shield-thane, and the guardian of the Whalebone Bridge

reward.description: the player will be allowed to pass the Whalebone Bridge

characters.name: Alduin, World Eater
characters.description: a dragon who is eating the souls of Sovngarde

characters.name: Shor
characters.description: the chief of the gods

tools: Tsun judges which heroic souls are allowed to go to the Hall of Valor
the player pursues Alduin: Shor did not let the heroic, angry souls of Sovngarde to attack Alduin
description:
I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all those souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcome, well earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.
You pursue Alduin, the World Eater. A fateful errand. No few have chafed to face the Worm since first he set his soul-snare here at Sovngarde's threshold. But Shor restrained our wrathful onslaught - perhaps, deep counseled, your doom he foresaw.
Living or dead, by decree of Shor, none may pass this perilous bridge 'till I judge them worthy by the warrior's test.

name: Bleak Falls Barrow
objective: retrieve the Dragonstone for Farengar Secret-Fire
first_tasks: find the Dragonstone in the main chamber of Bleak Falls Barrow

items.name: Dragonstone
items.description: a stone tablet that contains a map of dragon burial sites

tools: NONE
description:
I could use someone to fetch something for me. Well, when I say fetch, I really mean delve into a dangerous ruin in search of an ancient stone tablet that may or may not actually be there.
I, ah, learned of a certain stone tablet said to be housed in Bleak Falls Barrow - a 'Dragonstone,' said to contain a map of dragon burial sites. Go to Bleak Falls Barrow, find this tablet - no doubt interred in the main chamber - and bring it to me. Simplicity itself.

name: Breaching Security
objective: assassinate Gaius Maro, and implicate him in a plot to kill the Emperor
first_tasks: go to Dragon Bridge, observe Gaius Maro's departure, follow him, waylay him in one of the major cities, kill him, and plant the false evidence on his body

quest_giver.name: Gabriella
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: Olava's token as a bonus, if the player does not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road

characters.name: Astrid
characters.description: the player's female guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Gaius Maro
characters.description: the son of Commander Maro, a member of the Penitus Oculatus

characters.name: Olava the Feeble
characters.description: Gabriella's old female friend, and a powerful seer

characters.name: Commander Maro
characters.description: the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus, and handles the Emperor's security

tools: Astrid sent the player to Gabriella
the Emperor will arrive in Skyrim: the Penitus Oculatus will need to begin its preparations immediately
Astrid and Gabriella have devised a plan to break Commander Maro and cripple the Emperor's protection
Gaius Maro is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim
Olava's token is to be given to Olava the Feeble for a reading of the player's future
description:
Dear sibling. I've been waiting for you. Your next contract awaits, as I'm sure Astrid indicated.
With the Emperor's arrival in Skyrim now a certainty, his security service, the Penitus Oculatus, will need to begin its preparations immediately. Security is being handled by a Commander Maro. Astrid and I have devised a plan to break the man, and in doing so, cripple the Emperor's protection.
You are to slay the commander's son, Gaius Maro, and once he is dead, plant false evidence on his body implicating him in a plot to kill the Emperor. He is set to leave the Penitus Oculatus outpost at Dragon Bridge, and inspect the security of each city in Skyrim. Go there now. Observe Gaius Maro's departure, and follow him. Waylay him in one of the cities, and send his soul to Sithis. Once he's dead, plant the incriminating letter on his body, and let fate take care of the rest. Oh, and one final thing...
To earn your bonus, do not kill Gaius Maro in Dragon Bridge, or on the road. Kill him in one of the other major cities he'll be visiting. There, the body will be discovered quickly, as will the letter implicating Gaius Maro in the plot to assassinate the Emperor. Do that, and Astrid has authorized me to grant you a rather unique bonus. It is a special token, to be given to Olava the Feeble, in Whiterun. Olava is an old and dear friend, and a powerful seer. The token entitles you to a reading of your future. It's an opportunity one should not pass up.

name: First Lessons
objective: join the College of Winterhold
first_tasks: cast Mage Light on the seal on the ground

quest_giver.name: Faralda
quest_giver.description: a mage gatekeeping the College of Winterhold

reward.description: membership of the College of Winterhold

tools: NONE
description:
It would seem that the College has what you seek. The question now is what you can offer the College.
Not just anyone is allowed inside. Those wishing to enter must show some degree of skill with magic. A small test, if you will.
The Mage Light spell is useful to any mage, not just those specializing in Alteration. Can you cast one on the seal on the ground?

name: Lost Relic
objective: retrieve the Dawnguard Shield for yourself
first_tasks: kill the Falmer preventing you from getting the Dawnguard Shield

quest_giver.name: Florentius Baenius
quest_giver.description: a follower of Arkay and a fellow Dawnguard member

reward.name: Dawnguard Shield
reward.description: a relic of the Dawnguard of old, a magical shield that when blocked with surrounds its wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: NONE
description:
I've been pouring over some of the tomes left here in the keep. Interesting stories, indeed. Seems the previous incarnation of the Dawnguard had, at one time, some interesting toys.
I have located one of their toys. Arkay and I think it could be a great advantage for us. You should look into retrieving it. It is a magical shield that when blocked with, surrounds its wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead. Might come in handy.
You'll be up against the Falmer of Sightless Pit, if I understand Arkay correctly. Nothing you can't handle.

name: Lifting the Shroud
objective: investigate Shroud Hearth Barrow
first_tasks: go to the barrow

first_task_locations.name: Shroud Hearth Barrow
first_task_locations.description: a haunted barrow on the east side of Ivarstead

characters.name: Wyndelius
characters.description: a male treasure hunter

tools: Wyndelius went into Shroud Hearth Barrow two years ago: Wilhelm warned him not to go in there
Wyndelius was never seen again
description:
If I were you, I'd keep away from the barrow on the east side of town...
There ain't much more to tell... it's haunted and you should stay away. Look, I've seen one of the spirits with my very own eyes. When it glared at me, I swear it burned right through my soul.
Fortunately, the spirits seem to be sticking to the barrow. I think they're guarding it. Certainly isn't helping my business any; who'd want to rent a room anywhere near a haunted barrow?
If you think there's anything you can do, be my guest. About a year or two ago, some fella named Wyndelius came through; said he was some kind of a treasure hunter. I warned him not to go in there, just like I warned you. The very next night we heard screams from the barrow, and that was it. We never saw him again.

name: The White Phial
objective: retrieve the White Phial for Nurelion
first_tasks: reach Curalmil's resting place

first_task_locations.name: Forsaken Cave
first_task_locations.description: a long forsaken cave to the west of Windhelm

characters.name: Curalmil
characters.description: a crafty, long-dead alchemist, and the creator of the White Phial

items.name: White Phial
items.description: a legendary bottle that will replenish whatever fluid is placed inside of it

tools: Nurelion's assistant won't let Nurelion get the White Phial himself
Nurelion gives the player the alchemical mixture that is needed to reach Curalmil's resting place
description:
I've finally derived the location of the White Phial, but my doting busybody of an assistant won't let me get it.
It's buried with its maker, Curalmil, in Forsaken Cave, a long forsaken cave to the west of here. Curalmil was a crafty one, even in death. You would need the skills of a master alchemist to reach his resting place.
Luckily for you, I've already made the required mixture. Here, take it. Please... don't dally. I've wasted enough time arguing with my useless assistant here.

name: Lisbet's Missing Shipment
objective: recover a stolen Dibella Statue for Lisbet
first_tasks: find the Dibella Statue

characters.description: the goddess of beauty, love, and affection

description:
This store would finally be on its feet if I hadn't lost my last shipment to Forsworn attacks. A specially-made Dibella statuette.
You aren't for hire, are you? A sellsword? I'll pay you if you can recover that statuette from the Forsworn at Broken Tower Redoubt.
I'll have a sum of gold waiting for you when you return.

name: Hunt the Hunter
objective: assassinate Anoriath
first_tasks: find Anoriath

characters.name: Anoriath
characters.description: a male Wood Elf hunter who runs a market stall in Whiterun

tools: NONE
description:
There's Anoriath, a Wood Elf, who owns a market stall in the city of Whiterun.
He may run a stall in the city, but he retreats to the plains outside Whiterun to hunt. Kill him there, and no one will bear witness...
The hunter shall come to know the fear of the hunted, hmm? And I shall have your payment waiting for you, my friend.

name: The Black Star
objective: become the champion of Azura
first_tasks: ask around about an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night

first_task_locations.name: Winterhold
first_task_locations.description: a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it

quest_giver.name: Aranea Ienith
quest_giver.location: Azura's shrine, up the steps to the altar

characters.name: Azura
characters.description: the queen of the night sky, a goddess

tools: Azura has given Aranea Ienith the gift of foresight
description:
Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here.
Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted.
You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is cryptic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.

name: The Queen's Sword
objective: retrieve High Queen Freydis' sword for Oengul War-Anvil
first_tasks: find High Queen Freydis' sword

characters.name: High Queen Freydis
characters.description: a queen who ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, had a legendary sword

tools: the player asked Oengul War-Anvil whether he is the castle blacksmith
Oengul War-Anvil is working an a sword: the Jarl of Windhelm wants it to look like High Queen Freydis' sword
description:
Of course I am the castle blacksmith. What do I look like, a tavern wench? Ah, don't let my words cut you too deep. I've just been working the forge too hard. Trying to set this sword right.
Jarl wants it to look like an ancient blade. High Queen Freydis ruled over Windhelm in the Second Era, and her sword was legendary. Getting the real sword would be even better than making a copy, but no one wants to risk getting it from its resting place, Cronvangr Cave.
If you find that sword, traveler, I'd be grateful.

name: Finn's Lute
objective: return Finn's Lute to Inge Six Fingers
first_tasks: find Finn's Lute

reward.description: Inge Six Fingers will teach the player a few tricks

characters.name: Finn
characters.description: a famous male bard

tools: thieves broke into the Bards College and made off with a lot of valuable things: Finn's Lute included
Finn invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today
description:
Hmm? Oh, sorry. My mind wanders sometimes. I was just thinking about Finn's Lute.
Over a year ago, thieves broke into the College and made off with a lot of valuable things. Mostly gold and silver. But they also stole Finn's Lute. We just learned where the bandits fled to, and I very much want that lute back. They are at Stony Creek Cave.
Finn was the bard who invented the eight course lute that is commonplace today. Until he found a way to string the extra courses, bards only had six course lutes. The lute they stole is Finn's original eight course lute. I doubt they even realize its true value.
There is no way I can pay you what this Lute is worth. But I can teach you a few tricks I've learned over the years.

name: Few and Far Between
objective: help Ingun Black-Briar restock rare ingredients
first_tasks: find 20 deathbell, 20 nightshade, and 20 nirnroot

characters.name: Elgrim
characters.description: a male master alchemist

tools: NONE
description:
I'm aspiring to earn the title of an alchemist. However, the road ahead is paved with loose cobbles and deadly pitfalls.
Master Elgrim says I'm a natural; that I have a unique talent. But I fear his approval masks his intolerance for my mistakes. My errant formulas have cost Master Elgrim a fortune in ingredients; some of which are almost irreplaceable.
To restore Master Elgrim's supply I would need 20 deathbell, 20 nightshade and 20 nirnroot. Am I sensing that you may be interested in gathering these rare ingredients for me? That means more time for my experiments and less time in the field. Much appreciated.

name: Onmund's Request
objective: help Onmund get his amulet from Enthir
first_tasks: talk to Enthir about Onmund's amulet

characters.name: Enthir
characters.description: a shady merchant

tools: Onmund traded Enthir his amulet, but now Onmund wants his amulet back
description:
I need your help with something. Something private.
I may have entered into an... agreement with Enthir. He had something I needed, so I traded him something of mine.
It was a mistake, and now I want back what I gave him. It's an amulet that belonged to my family, and I never should've given it to Enthir. But he won't deal with me. Talk to him; see what it'll take to get my amulet back.

name: An Offer
objective: help Calcelmo with his research
first_tasks: bring the Dwemer sword you bough from Warmaiden's to Calcelmo

quest_giver.name: Calcelmo
quest_giver.description: a scholar researching the Dwemer, giving quest via "Letter from Calcelmo"

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: the player

tools: "Letter from Calcelmo" is addressed toward the player
description:
Letter from Calcelmo
by Calcelmo

Dragonborn,
It has come to my attention you may have recently acquired a certain Dwemer sword from Warmaiden's.
I'm not sure how such an object came to find itself resting there... but I've been trying to obtain one for my research.
If you still have it, or if not, find another one, I would be most appreciative if you were to bring it to me here in Markarth. I will pay handsomely.

Sincerely,
Calcelmo

name: A Daedra's Best Friend
objective: settle the disagreement between Barbas and Clavicus Vile
first_tasks: talk to Clavicus Vile at his shrine

first_task_locations.name: Haemar's Shame
first_task_locations.description: a den of cultists worshiping Clavicus Vile

quest_giver.name: Barbas
quest_giver.description: Clavicus Vile's dog who was kicked out by Clavicus Vile

reward.description: the player is rewarded: the player just should not trust any offer Clavicus Vile makes them

characters.name: Clavicus Vile
characters.description: the prince of wishes, a Daedra

tools: Clavicus Vile is weak, since he banished Barbas: Clavicus Vile can only manifest at his shrines
description:
You are exactly what I was looking for. You see, my name is Barbas. And I have a problem I think you can help sort out.
My master and I had a bit of a falling out. We got into an argument and it got rather... heated. He's kicked me out until I find someone who can settle our disagreement. That's where you come in.
My master is Clavicus Vile, the prince of wishes. As you can imagine, he's quite the important person.  Now, since he banished me, Vile's been rather weak. He can't manifest very far from one of his shrines. I know there's a cult that worships him at Haemar's Shame. We should be able to talk to him there.
If this works out, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Just don't trust any offer he makes you... okay?

name: Stoking the Flames
objective: bring 10 fire salts to restore Balimund's forge
first_tasks: find 10 fire salts

items.description: fire salts, strange minerals that burns as hot as lava

tools: Balimund's forge consumes fire salts
description:
Come to see Balimund perform miracles with steel, eh? Smithing's been in my blood for generations.
I owe my success to my forefathers and their recipe for flame. The secret is my forge. It consumes fire salts, a strange mineral that burns as hot as lava.
Sadly, this forge is dying and I've used the last of my fire salts. If I can't feed it soon, it may grow cold. Ten pinches of fire salts should give me all I need to bring this forge back to life.
Could you get the fire salts for me? I know that they are hard to come by, but they would save my business and warm an old smith's heart.

name: The Bedlam Job
objective: steal whatever you can to make an impression
first_tasks: steal from anywhere in Whiterun without anyone seeing you steal

quest_giver.name: Delvin Mallory
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

reward.description: the player gets to keep everything the player steals

tools: NONE
description:
Sometimes we like to remind a city that we mean business, so we hit it hard. Just steal whatever we can until we've made an impression.
Simple right? Almost. The catch is it doesn't count if anyone sees you take it. The message needs to be clear; we work in the shadows.
Steal from anywhere in Whiterun, and you even get to keep everythin' you stole. So, you in?

name: Ancient Technology
objective: retrieve Dwemer schematics for Sorine Jurard
first_tasks: find the Dwemer schematics

quest_giver.name: Sorine Jurard
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Dawnguard, and an avid tinkerer

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct race of people famed for their mechanical constructs

tools: NONE
description:
I want to add some punch to our crossbow capabilities, I've done all I can on my own. I need a little inspiration. I've always been fascinated with Dwemer artifacts. I take them apart, poke around in their guts, and try to figure things out - with mixed results.
But as luck would have it, I've tracked down the location of some actual Dwemer diagram drawings! So, if you'd be a dear and collect those plans for me at Irkngthand?
With the Dwemer diagrams and a little tinkering I should be able to improve the capabilities of our crossbows.

name: Rescue Mission
objective: rescue a kidnapped citizen
first_tasks: find the kidnapped citizen

first_task_locations.name: Faldar's Tooth
first_task_locations.description: a bandit lair in the Rift

quest_giver.name: Vilkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

tools: NONE
description:
We've received a desperate missive. A citizen of the Rift has been kidnapped.
The Companions have been asked for assistance, and we shall answer. Particularly when the pay is as good as this.
Get moving. Find the kidnapped citizen at Faldar's Tooth and save them. I shudder to think what might happen if you're too late.
Bring honor to the Companions and yourself.

name: The Spiced Wine
objective: convince the East Empire Company to release Evette San's shipment of spices, and return back to Evette San for your reward
first_tasks: talk to Vittoria Vici about Evette San's shipment of spices

description:
Hello! I'm the spiced wine merchant Evette San. You wouldn't have a few minutes to run down to the docks would you?
I've got a shipment of spices the East Empire Company is holding up. I need someone to convince them to release it. The person handling shipments is called Vittoria Vici. You should try to talk to her about my shipment.
Get back to me when you're done and I'll give you something for your time. I swear it's a fight with them every shipment.

name: Dampened Spirits
objective: put the Honningbrew Meadery out of business by putting Sabjorn in prison
first_tasks: talk to Mallus Maccius for details

characters.name: Sabjorn
characters.description: the male owner of the Honningbrew Meadery

characters.description: Maven Black-Briar's inside man at the Honningbrew Meadery

tools: NONE
description:
This is an important job. I have a competitor called Honningbrew Meadery that I want to put out of business. I also want to know how they managed to get the place up and running so quickly.
Some layabout named Sabjorn runs the Honningbrew Meadery. Been a thorn in my side for the last few years now. With Sabjorn in prison, his meadery will be forced to close. Then I swoop in and take over the place. No more competition.
Head to the Bannered Mare in Whiterun and look for Mallus Maccius. He'll fill you in on all the details.

name: Dragon Seekers
objective: kill a dragon with Farkas
first_tasks: lead Farkas to the dragon

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

tools: Farkas knows where the player might find the dragon
description:
Travelers have been coming to Whiterun. They tell stories about dragons. I've heard of them, but didn't think they were real.
Rumors also claim that you have defeated dragons before. You are a very brave person worthy of being a Companion. But I already knew that.
Let's go kill a dragon together. That's one way to find out if they're real. I even know where we might find one. Lead on!

name: A Job for Mead
objective: bring Siddgeir some Black-Briar Mead
first_tasks: get Black-Briar Mead

reward.description: Siddgeir gives more important work to the player

tools: NONE
description:
You're here for work? I demand tribute before you can be considered for any real tasks.
How about drink? None of that local piss. Real Black-Briar Mead, fresh from Riften.
You better bring me my mead. I hate people who waste my time.

name: Look Mom, I Made a Dagger!
objective: help a blacksmith
first_tasks: smith an iron dagger
tools: the blacksmith gives the player everything the player needs to make an iron dagger
description: I could use some help around the forge. How about you smith me an iron dagger? Here's everything you need to make one. Go ahead.

characters.description: Idgrod the Younger's brother, a sensitive boy

characters.name: Danica Pure-Spring
characters.description: a priestess

description:
My brother Joric is... sensitive. He has trouble focusing his attention on things.
We were taking him to the Temple of Kynareth in Whiterun, just so the healers could make sure he was in good health, and they say he's fine.
Are you heading to Whiterun? Could you take this letter to the priestess, Danica Pure-Spring? It's a note about Joric's health.

name: The Dainty Sload
objective: frame Captain Volf by planting some contraband
first_tasks: get some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette
plant the Balmora Blue in Captain Volf's footlocker

characters.name: Delvin
characters.description: the player's male superior in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Captain Volf
characters.description: a male sea captain

characters.name: Sabine Nyette
characters.description: the female first mate of the Red Wave

tools: Delvin sent the player to Erikur
Captain Volf neglected to honor a trade agreement between him and Erikur
description:
It's about time you got here. I'm not accustomed to dealing with people who are unreliable. That's why I asked Delvin to send me his best.
Nothing raises my ire more than having an agreement broken. It's bad for business and it wastes time. Captain Volf of the Dainty Sload has decided to test my patience on this matter by neglecting to honor a trade agreement we had established.
I need you to help me show him the error of his ways by sneaking on board the Sload and planting some contraband. You'll need to get your hands on some Balmora Blue from Sabine Nyette down by the docks. She's the first mate on another ship, the Red Wave.
Once you get your hands on it, I want you to plant it in Captain Volf's footlocker. I'll take care of the rest. Captain Volf is ashore right now and I want the authorities waiting for him when he gets back.
Now get going... I don't want to see your face until the job's done.

name: Sealing the Deal
objective: help Talen-Jei complete Keerava's wedding ring
first_tasks: find three flawless amethysts for Keerava's wedding ring

quest_giver.name: Talen-Jei
quest_giver.description: an Argonian man who wants to marry Keerava

characters.name: Keerava
characters.description: a female Argonian

groups.name: Argonians
groups.description: a race of people from Black Marsh

tools: in Black Marsh, tradition dictates Argonians present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent their future bond: Talen-Jei already has a gold band for Keerava's wedding ring
description:
I met Keerava when I wandered into Riften a few years ago. Been smitten with her ever since. In fact, I'm thinking of asking her to marry me.
In Black Marsh, tradition dictates we present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent our future bond. I already have the gold band, but all I need are three flawless amethysts to complete the setting.

name: Season Unending
objective: negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius
first_tasks: ask the Greybeards hold a peace council

first_task_locations.name: High Hrothgar
first_task_locations.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards, and neutral territory to both sides of the war

quest_giver.name: Balgruuf the Greater
quest_giver.description: the nobleman who rules over Whiterun

reward.description: Jarl Balgruuf the Greater will help the player

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the man leading one side of the war

characters.name: General Tullius
characters.description: the man leading the other side of the war

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: the player

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: an order of respected, wise old men

tools: the player asked Balgruuf the Greater to help the player trap a dragon in Whiterun: Ulfric and General Tullius want to capture Whiterun
getting both sides of war to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point
description:
I want to help you, Dragonborn. And I will. But I need your help first.
Ulfric and General Tullius are both just waiting for me to make a wrong move. Do you think they will sit idle while a dragon is slaughtering my men and burning my city? No. I can't risk weakening the city while we are under the threat of enemy attack. I'm sorry.
If only you could negotiate a truce between Ulfric and General Tullius. Then I would be glad to help you with your mad dragon-trapping scheme. But getting both sides to agree to a truce will be difficult at this point. The bitterness has gone too deep. Maybe... hmm... what of the Greybeards? They are respected by everyone. High Hrothgar is neutral territory. If the Greybeards were willing to host a peace council... then maybe Ulfric and Tullius would have to listen.

name: Unbound
objective: escape Imperial custody with Ralof
first_tasks: jump through the roof of the inn on the other side and keep running
tools: the player and Ralof are making their escape together: the player is a Nord
description:
Hey, Nord. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going! Go! I'll follow when I can!

name: Retrieval
objective: retrieve a piece of Wuuthrad
first_tasks: find the group of Silver Hand who have the piece of Wuuthrad

quest_giver.name: Aela the Huntress
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the companions

groups.name: Silver Hand
groups.description: a bandit gang who hate the Companions

tools: NONE
description:
The Silver Hand has been scouring the world for more pieces of Wuuthrad. A group of their members has managed to secure one of the pieces.
They have gone hidden out in Eastmarch, somewhere inside Cragslane Cavern. The piece of Wuuthrad should be there with them.
Get that piece of Wuuthrad back, for the honor of us all.

name: Sating the Steward's Thirst
objective: deliver a bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum to Falk Firebeard
first_tasks: find Falk Firebeard

characters.name: Jarl Elisif the Fair
characters.description: the noblewoman who rules over Solitude, who recently lost her husband, the king

characters.name: Falk Firebeard
characters.description: Jarl Elisif the Fair's male steward

tools: the player asked Sorex Vinius who is in charge of Solitude
description:
Jarl Elisif the Fair is in charge of solitude. Poor woman. Losing her husband and king like that. It was a dark day for us all.
Damn, that reminds me, I have a delivery to make to her steward, Falk Firebeard. He ordered a special bottle of Stros M'Kai Rum.
You could deliver it for me. Save me a lot of trouble. Here. Take it to the Blue Palace.

name: Telrav's Request
objective: help Telrav
first_tasks: escort Telrav back to his camp nearby

quest_giver.name: Telrav
quest_giver.description: a man who was attacked by bandits

tools: NONE
description:
Bandits attacked and ransacked my cart. Can you help me?
My camp is nearby in the ruins of Nilheim. Get me there safely and you'll be rewarded.

name: Ill Met by Moonlight
objective: take the Ring of Hircine back to Hircine
first_tasks: hunt down the beast to draw out Hircine

items.name: Ring of Hircine
items.description: a ring that is supposed to control a werewolf's transformations, a relic of Hircine

characters.name: Hircine, Lord of the Hunt
characters.description: the god of hunting and monsters

tools: Sinding killed a little girl, because he lost control of his transformations
Hircine cursed the Ring of Hircine when Sinding obtained it: it transforms him at the worst of times
Sinding will escape from the prison after giving the quest
description:
Come to gawk at the monster?
A little girl is dead because of me. Believe me, it wasn't anything I ever intended to do. I just... lost control. I tried to tell them, but none of them believe me.
It's all on account of this blasted ring. This is the Ring of Hircine. I was told it could let me control my transformations. Perhaps it used to. But I'll never know. Hircine didn't care for my taking it, and threw a curse on it. I put it on... and the changes just came to me. I could never guess when. It would be at the worst times. Like... with the little girl.
I don't suppose there's a point in keeping the secret if I'm going to die in here anyway. I'm sure you've heard of men who shift to beasts under the influence of the moons. I am one of them. A werewolf. It's my secret, and my shame. That's why I wanted the ring... it was said to give men like me control. Now I may look like a man, but I still feel the animal inside of me, as strong as ever.
You would take the ring back to Hircine? Oh my. You would do this for me? Here, take it. I don't want anything to do with this wretched thing anymore. Seek out the beast. He wanders these woods. Bring him down and... well, the Lord of the Hunt should smile on you and appear before you.
I wish you luck, but should leave here while I still have my skin. Should our paths cross again, I will remember your kindness. Farewell.

name: Dawnguard
objective: join the Dawnguard
first_tasks: speak with Isran about joining the Dawnguard

characters.name: Isran
characters.description: the male leader of the Dawnguard

tools: vampires are becoming a larger threat
description:
I'm Durak of the Dawnguard.
We are vampire hunters. We search out and destroy those bloodsucking scum wherever we find them. We are looking for anyone willing to fight against the growing vampire menace.
Everybody says that they are not interested about joining, right up until they find their throat being ripped out by a pack of hungry vampires.
Want to sign up to the Dawnguard and kill vampires? Go talk to Isran, our leader, at Fort Dawnguard, southeast of Riften. He'll decide if you're Dawnguard material.

name: Proving Honor
objective: complete your trial of claiming a fragment of Wuuthrad
first_tasks: claim another fragment of Wuuthrad with Farkas

quest_giver.name: Skjor
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Companions

reward.description: the player will become a true Companion

characters.name: Farkas
characters.description: a fellow member of the Companions, a man

tools: Farkas will answer the player's questions about the Companions
description:
We have something special for you this time.
Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out in Dustman's Cairn.
This is a simple errand, but the time is right for it to be your Trial. Carry yourself with honor, and you'll become a true Companion. Farkas will be your Shield-Sibling on this venture, whelp. He'll answer any questions you have.
Try not to disappoint. Or to get Farkas killed.

name: Rise in the East
objective: help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
first_tasks: steal Suvaris Atheron's logbook and bring it to Orthus Endario

quest_giver.name: Orthus Endario
quest_giver.description: an employee of the East Empire Company
quest_giver.location: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm

characters.name: Suvaris Atheron
characters.description: a female dark elf, and the meticulous overseer of the Shatter-Shields' shipping operation

groups.name: Shatter-Shields
groups.description: a powerful family in Windhelm that run a private shipping operation at the docks

tools: pirates have been raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell: the East Empire Company's security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in the war
description:
Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started. Pirates, you see. Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell.
Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war. We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.
Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe. They are a very powerful family here in Windhelm. They run a private shipping operation, and would love to have the docks to themselves. Wouldn't surprise me if they were in league with the pirates, somehow.
Not yet, no. But perhaps an intrepid person such as yourself could help with that. They have a dark elf who oversees their operations. Suvaris Atheron. She's meticulous to a fault, and keeps a logbook with every transaction she makes.
If you get me the logbook, I'll have proof of Shatter-Shield's treachery.

name: Deal Like A Steal
objective: secure a merchandise transportation deal for the Thieves Guild
first_tasks: deliver a satchel of Moon Sugar to Ri'saad to secure the deal

quest_giver.name: Tonilia
quest_giver.description: a fence, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

characters.description: the male leader of the caravans that travel across the realm

tools: the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances
description:
Before we get down to business, I've got something I need you to do.
Well, as you know, the Guild's growing and things are looking up around here. The only thing we're lacking is a reliable way to transport our merchandise across the land.
I'm not sure if you've noticed, but there are several caravans that travel across the realm. They're shrewd traders and don't mind getting their hands dirty.
I've bartered with their leader, Ri'saad, on more than one occasion. I want you to bring him something. You see, the caravans are notorious for transporting illegal substances.
Present Ri'saad with this satchel of Moon Sugar, and I bet my last coin he'll make a deal.

name: A Trip to Eternity
objective: assassinate Ma'randru-jo
first_tasks: locate Ma'randru-jo

characters.name: Ma'randru-jo
characters.description: an accomplished male wizard, who travels with the caravans

tools: NONE
description:
Ma'randru-jo is an accomplished wizard, and your assassination target. Locating him may be challenging, as he travels with the caravans.
Those caravaners can be an elusive bunch. Takes a fair bit of stalking to take one down. But then, that's half the fun, isn't it?

name: Lost Knowledge
objective: retrieve a Black Book so that Neloth can make a copy of it
first_tasks: find the Black Book

items.name: Black Books
items.description: books created by Hermaeus Mora, each containing forbidden knowledge

characters.name: Xarxes
characters.description: the god of secrets and hidden knowledge

characters.name: Hermaeus Mora

description:
Have you heard the story of how we came to be werewolves?
The Companions are nearly five thousand years old. This matter of beastblood has only troubled us for a few hundred. One of my predecessors was a good, but short-sighted man. He made a bargain with the witches of Glenmoril Coven. If the Companions would hunt in the name of their lord, Hircine, we would be granted great power.
The Companions of old became werewolves. They did not believe the change would be permanent. The witches offered payment, like anyone else. But we had been deceived. The disease, you see, affects not just our bodies. It seeps into the spirit. Upon death, werewolves are claimed by Hircine for his Hunting Grounds. For some, this is a paradise. They want nothing more than to chase prey with their master for eternity. And that is their choice. But I am still a true Nord. And I wish for Sovngarde as my spirit home.
I've spent my twilight years trying to find a cure myself. And now I've found the answer. The witches' magic ensnared us, and only their magic can release us. They won't give it willingly, but we can extract their foul powers by force. I want you to seek them out. Go to their coven in the wilderness. Strike them down as a true warrior of the wild. And bring me their heads. The seat of their abilities. From there, we may begin to undo centuries of impurity.

description:
Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.
