name: Loud and Clear
objective: teach Aringoth a lesson
first_tasks: burn down three bee hives without burning the whole Goldenglow Estate down, and clear out the safe in the main house of the Goldenglow Estate

quest_giver.name: Brynjolf
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Aringoth
characters.description: an arrogant wood elf man who owns the Goldenglow Estate

characters.name: Maven
characters.description: a powerful woman with criminal connections

characters.name: Mercer
characters.description: the man who leads the Thieves Guild

tools: the Thieves Guild had an arrangement with Maven: the Thieves Guild kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing, and Maven allowed the Thieves Guild to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout
Aringoth stopped sending the Thieves Guild extortion money: Mercer was angry
the player may kill Aringoth, but Maven would prefer him alive
description:
Goldenglow Estate is a bee farm; they raise the wretched little things for honey. It's owned by some smart-mouth wood elf named Aringoth.
We had an arrangement with Maven. We kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing. In return, Maven allowed us to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout.
Goldenglow Estate brought in a mountain of gold for the Guild. You could almost call it our sweetest deal. Then out of the clear blue, Aringoth stops sending us our cut. Mercer was... well, angry to put it kindly.
We need you to teach Aringoth a lesson by burning down three of the estate's hives and clearing out the safe in the main house. The catch is that you can't burn the whole place to the ground. Maven would be furious if you did. She also prefers that Aringoth remains alive, but if he tries to stop you from getting the job done, kill him.
The Guild has a lot riding on this. Don't make me look foolish by mucking it up.

name: That Was Always There
objective: return Viola Giordano's gold ring to her without her knowing
first_tasks: sneak inside the house and place Viola Giordano's gold ring in a dresser

quest_giver.name: Revyn Sadri
quest_giver.description: a merchant dealing in used goods

reward.description: Revyn Sadri will make it worth the player's while

characters.name: Viola Giordano
characters.description: a woman who fancies herself a criminal investigator

tools: the player asked Revyn Sadri whether something in his store is stolen
description:
Of course nothing in here is stolen. Only a careless, shameful, idiotic fetcher would do something as stupid as to buy pilfered goods....
Oh by Azura, I've made a terrible mistake. I bought a gold ring, and Viola Giordano has been missing a ring that looks just like it.
Could you return the ring to her? It's not that easy. She'd go to the guard if she knew I was even remotely involved. You have to get it to her some other way.
Look, it's dangerous, but if you sneak the ring into her house. Put it in a dresser or something. I will make it worth your while.

name: The Savior of Selveni Nethri
objective: help Selveni Nethri escape from Southfringe Sanctum
first_tasks: escort Selveni Nethri outside

first_task_locations.name: Southfringe Sanctum
first_task_locations.description: the home of Bashnag's dangerous coven

characters.name: Bashnag
characters.description: a skilled male necromancer

tools: the player saved Selveni Nethri from a spiders' web
Selveni Nethri was a member of Bashnag's coven, but they chased her out and left her for dead
description:
Thanks for getting me out of that. Bashnag's coven chased me out and left me for dead down here. Nobody lasts too long with the spiders.
Please, will you help me get out of here? If the coast is clear, I'll make a break for it. We - well 'they', Bashnag's circle of mages, live here. They made it pretty clear that I'm no longer welcome. These are no dainty college mages. Bashnag has the skill of a magister and the mind of a warlord.
This is a dangerous bunch. They're good company if you want to study necromancy in peace, though.

name: The Eye of Magnus
objective: force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus
first_tasks: get inside the College of Winterhold with the Staff of Magnus and reach Ancano

quest_giver.name: Tolfdir
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher at the College of Winterhold

items.name: Staff of Magnus
items.description: a powerful staff that can breach magical shields according to the Psijics

characters.name: Ancano
characters.description: a power-hungry male wizard

tools: Tolfdir and the others can't crack Ancano's magical shield around the College of Winterhold
the player got the Staff of Magnus the Labyrinthian
description:
Ancano has sealed himself inside the College! The Eye of Magnus is is growing his power. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself.
I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it. You have the Staff of Magnus, then? Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
You're the one with the staff, my child. If it can help us get inside the College, and reach Ancano, we'll have to hope that there's a way to stop all this.

name: The Straw that Broke
objective: help Narfi get closure about Reyda
first_tasks: talk to Wilhelm about Reyda

characters.name: Reyda
characters.description: Narfi's sister who went missing

characters.name: Wilhelm
characters.description: a man who told Narfi that Reyda will be back

tools: NONE
description:
Reyda was here, then gone. Went to gather plants and never came home... nope, nope. Everyone looked and no one could find her. Wilhelm said she'll be back... told Narfi not to worry... Reyda will come back.
With father I said goodbye... with mother I said goodbye. Reyda leaves and Narfi can't say goodbye. Makes Narfi very, very sad. Narfi needs Reyda to say goodbye.

name: Ash Research
objective: extract a sample from an ash spawn for Neloth's research
first_tasks: kill an ash spawn and harvest a sample from it
tools: NONE
description:
Hmm. I have a new spell I'm working on. I hope to be able to conjure ash spawn.
If I could get a sample of ash from an ash spawn, that would be quite useful. I've made this special tool that will extract... well, you don't need to know the details. Just go harvest a sample.
Of course, the creature will have to be dead first, but I trust that's something you can... bring about. There will be some septims for your troubles.

name: Roggi's Family Shield
objective: retrieve the Knot-Beard shield for Roggi Knot-Beard
first_tasks: find the Knot-Beard shield

reward.description: Roggi Knot-Beard will show the player some shield techniques

characters.name: Lenne
characters.description: a forefather of Roggi Knot-Beard who lost the Knot-Beard shield

tools: Roggi Knot-Beard's clan was one of the first to settle Kynesgrove: Lenne was the first to discover the mines
description:
I'm from from here. I've wandered a bit, but I always come back to Kynesgrove. My clan was one of the first to settle here.
Legend says that my forefather Lenne discovered the mines after he stumbled into a dark cave to relieve himself. Too much mead. Of course, there's another story of Lenne losing the family shield in a different cave, so it depends on who you believe.
According to my grandfather at least, the family shield should be in the cave. He swore that version of the legend was true, even found the cave old Lenne stumbled into: Ansilvund. Hey, if you find it, I could show you some of the clan's favorite fighting moves. They're all shield techniques.

name: Bloody Nose
objective: win the wager against Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
first_tasks: match Hofgrir Horse-Crusher's bet, and beat him in a fistfight

quest_giver.name: Hofgrir Horse-Crusher
quest_giver.description: the man with the the strongest arms in all of Skyrim

tools: rules for the fistfight: no weapons, no tricks, no magic
description:
Bah, I'm not afraid of anything out here. Walls are just a weakling's hiding spot. Now me, I'm no weakling. In fact, I bet I've got the strongest arms in all of Skyrim.
You bet against me? Oh! Sounds like I've got a challenger. Tell you what. How about a friendly wager, just between us. I bet you my entire purse of septims I can beat you in a fistfight. You match the bet and we fight until one of us gives in.
All right, remember... this is a clean fight. No weapons, no tricks. And none of those fancy magic spells, either. Here we go!

name: Unfathomable Depths
objective: take the Lexicon from From-Deepest-Fathoms, and free her from her burden
first_tasks: return the Lexicon back to Avanchnzel

first_task_locations.name: Avanchnzel
first_task_locations.description: a deep ruin in the west

tools: NONE
description:
You. You must take the Lexicon. Free me of my burden.
The memories. I cannot stand them. You must take them away, return them to Avanchnzel.
You must take the Lexicon from me. Please... take it now. You must bring it to Avanchnzel, in the west. Return it to them. It must go back.

name: Grimsever's Return
objective: recover Grimsever for Mjoll the Lioness
first_tasks: find Grimsever

first_task_locations.name: Mzinchaleft
first_task_locations.description: a Dwemer ruin, the home of a dangerous Dwemer colossus

items.name: Grimsever
items.description: Mjoll the Lioness' beloved, lost sword

groups.name: Dwemer
groups.description: an extinct race of people famed for their mechanical constructions

tools: NONE
description:
My blade, the Grimsever, was lost years ago in a Dwemer ruin. Without it, I feel almost as defenseless as a newborn. I don't think I'll ever be able to find a replacement.
I was adventuring in the depths of the ruins when I was attacked by a massive construct... like nothing I had ever seen. When the colossus struck, Grimsever was knocked from my grasp and I was wounded badly. It was only through blind luck that I was able to crawl away from the Dwemer abomination and make my way to the surface.
I couldn't ask you to undertake such a treacherous journey, it would be a fool's errand. But I see that spark in your eye and I know better than to warn you away. Grimsever rests with the Dwemer ruin of Mzinchaleft. Tread carefully, friend... those same ruins almost took my life.

name: Death Incarnate
objective: fulfill Astrid's contract
first_tasks: kill Astrid

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's dying leader in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: the player becomes the new leader of the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Maro
characters.description: the man who leads the Penitus Oculatus

characters.name: Night Mother
characters.description: a female spirit

tools: Astrid betrayed the player by giving the player to the Penitus Oculatus: the Penitus Oculatus destroyed the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid opposed the old ways that guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries unlike the player and the Night Mother
description:
Alive.... You're alive... Thank Sithis...
Ssshhh.... Please. There is much... I have to say. And... not much time... I'm sorry. So very sorry. The Penitus Oculatus... Maro... He said that by giving you to them, he would leave the Dark Brotherhood alone. Forever. By Sithis, I was such a fool. All of this... it's all my fault. You are the best of us, and I nearly killed you... as I've killed everyone else...
I'm saying you were right. The Night Mother was right. The old ways... they guided the Dark Brotherhood for centuries. I was a fool to oppose them. And to prove my... sincerity, I have prayed for a contract. You lead this Family now. I give you the Blade of Woe, so that you can see it through.
You must kill... Me.

name: Dragon Research
objective: help Esbern complete his research on dragons
first_tasks: bring Esbern dragon scales and bones

reward.description: a potion made out of dragon scales and bones

tools: NONE
description:
I need to finish my research on dragons.
While you're out hunting dragons, keep a sharp eye open for any dragon scales and bones you might find. I'd be interested in looking at them.
Have you ever heard of the expression, "the scale of the lizard that bit you?" No, I guess not. Well, the principle applies here. I'll make you a potion, made from those dragon parts.

name: The Throat of the World
objective: receive a lesson from Paarthurnax
first_tasks: hear Paarthurnax's shout, and match it with your own

characters.name: Dovahkiin
characters.description: a mortal with the soul of a dragon

tools: the player is meeting Paarthurnax for the first time: the player is the Dovahkiin
description:
Greetings, traveler. I am Paarthurnax. Who are you? What brings you to my mountain? Forgive me. I gave in to the temptation to prolong our speech. I know you are Dovahkiin.
You have come here to learn from me. Patience. There are formalities that must be observed, at the first meeting of two of the dragons. By long tradition, the elder speaks first. Hear my shout! Feel it in your bones.
Match it, if you are Dovahkiin!

name: Under the Table
objective: make a delivery for Romlyn Dreth
first_tasks: smuggle a small Black-Briar Mead keg to Wilhelm

reward.description: Wilhelm will trade the player something for the Black-Briar Mead keg

characters.name: Wilhelm
characters.description: a male innkeeper

characters.name: Indaryn
characters.description: a male employee of the Black-Briar Meadery

locations.name: Black-Briar Meadery
locations.description: a meadery in Riften that produces Black-Briar Mead

tools: if the player bumps into Indaryn, they should not tell him anything about Romlyn Dreth's dealings
description:
I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Black-Briar Meadery.
If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious. I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork.
Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

name: Shiv
objective: obtain a shiv from Grisvar the Unlucky
first_tasks: bring Duach's bottle of Skooma to Grisvar the Unlucky

characters.name: Duach
characters.description: a male prisoner

locations.name: Skooma
locations.description: a drug made from moon sugar

tools: the player told Grisvar the Unlucky that they want protection
description:
Ah, you want protection? I can get you what you need. Maybe you can do something for me, first?
Duach has a bottle of Skooma. Finest distilled Moon Sugar. I'm shaking just thinking about it.
Get that bottle of Skooma, and I'll have a shiv ready for you. Promise you won't ever use it on me, okay?

name: Black Book
objective: learn the secrets of a Black Book
first_tasks: find the Black Book
tools: NONE
description:
I know things. Hidden things. Things you aren't supposed to know.
I'm not alright! No! That's what I'm trying to say. The secrets. They're in there. In there deep. Can't get them out. They're in my head. They might leak out. Don't want them crawling into your head, too. Like me.
The Black Book taught me the secrets. It shoved them in my head. With black slick fingers. My fingers are too short. I can't get them out. I didn't find the Black Book. It found me. Here. I'll show you. See. Right there, in White Ridge Barrow. But don't go there. You don't want these things in your head. You don't!

name: Rogatus's Letter
objective: deliver a letter to Leontius
first_tasks: find Leontius

first_task_locations.name: Old Hroldan Inn
first_task_locations.description: and old inn to the south

quest_giver.name: Rogatus Salvius
quest_giver.description: a farmer who does not think highly of Leontius

reward.description: the player should make sure that Leontius tips them

characters.name: Leontius
characters.description: Rogatus Salvius' son, a drunk

tools: Rogatus Salvius does no think highly of his son
description:
My boy Leontius lives in Old Hroldan. Old inn to the south.
Damn drunk. The oaf doesn't even bother to visit these days. What am I supposed to do if the dragons burn down the farm?
You're a traveler, right? I have this letter for him. Let him know how much of a failure he is. You make sure the lug tips you when he gets it.

name: Missing In Action
objective: find Thorald
first_tasks: talk to Fralia Gray-Mane privately about the Battle-Borns and their lies

characters.name: Thorald
characters.description: Fralia Gray-Mane's missing son

groups.name: Battle-Borns
groups.description: an influential family that supports the Empire

tools: Fralia Gray-Mane was told that Thorald was killed in the war against the Empire, but she knows that Thorald is alive: the Battle-Borns know that too
description:
All I can think about is my son, my Thorald... they say that he was killed, but I know better. I know my son is alive! Those Battle-Borns... they're in with the Imperials. They know it too, and yet they lie to my very face!
It's not wise to discuss how I know about their lies here. Please, if you truly wish to help, meet me at my home. I'll tell you the whole story.

name: Compelling Tribute
objective: use Anuriel to gain intelligence on the Stormcloaks
first_tasks: find evidence about Anuriel's corrupt activities in her private quarters, and use it to blackmail her

quest_giver.name: Legate Rikke
quest_giver.description: the player's commanding officer in the Imperial Legion

characters.name: Anuriel
characters.description: the Jarl's corrupt female steward who has secret arrangements with the Thieves Guild

tools: the Jarl's men will arrest the player if they find the player in Anuriel's private quarters
description:
You're going to Riften. My spies report the Jarl's Steward, Anuriel, has arrangements with the Thieves Guild that would be rather embarrassing if made public.
I need you to find evidence of her corrupt activities, and use it to gain a measure of her "cooperation."
This will require stealth and discretion. The Jarl's guards won't take kindly to anyone rummaging through the steward's private quarters.

name: Erik the Adventurer
objective: help Erik become an adventurer
first_tasks: convince Mralki buy armor for Erik

characters.name: Mralki
characters.description: Erik's father, an innkeeper in Rorikstead

tools: the player is an adventurer
description:
You look like you've seen your share of adventure. I envy you that. In fact, maybe you can help me with something.
I want to be an adventurer like you, but my father says I can't. He says that he needs me to stay here and work the farm, and even if he did let me be an adventurer, we couldn't afford to buy armor. His name's Mralki, and he's the innkeeper here. I hope you can change my father's mind. He can be a little stubborn.
I can't stand the thought of being trapped in this village for the rest of my days.

name: Who to Poison?
objective: deliver a bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth
first_tasks: find Wuunferth

characters.name: Wuunferth
characters.description: the male court wizard

locations.name: Hollyfrost Farm
locations.description: a farm owned by Hillevi Cruel-Sea's family

tools: Hillevi Cruel-Sea's goods are grown at Hollyfrost Farm
description:
Everything you see is grown at my family's own Hollyfrost Farm. Fresh and filling.
I also do a little herb growing. The court wizard, Wuunferth, pays us to plant a little Nightshade. Who knows what he uses it for? A poison like that?
Hey, could you deliver this bottle of Nightshade extract to Wuunferth?

name: The House of Horrors
objective: investigate the Abandoned House with Tyranus
first_tasks: follow Tyranus inside the Abandoned House

first_task_locations.name: Abandoned House
first_task_locations.description: a house in Markarth that might have been used for Daedra worship

quest_giver.name: Tyranus
quest_giver.description: a member of the Vigil of Stendarr

tools: no one has seen anyone enter or leave the Abandoned House
description:
Excuse me, but do you know anything about this house? Seen anyone enter or leave? Seems no one in this city has.
I'm with the Vigil of Stendarr. We believe this house might have been used for Daedra worship. Evil rites and so forth. I was actually just about to head on inside. Be good to have someone watch my back.
Follow me, and keep your eyes open. Daedra are powerful creatures and tricksters. Never know what you'll find.

name: Andurs' Arkay Amulet
objective: retrieve Andurs' amulet of Arkay
first_tasks: search for Andurs' amulet of Arkay

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of burial and funeral rites

tools: NONE
description:
Perhaps you'll take pity on a humble priest who has lost something precious?
I lost my amulet of Arkay. It's the source of my divine powers and also a sacred badge of office. I misplaced it in the catacombs. I'd look for it, but I've been hearing noises down there. I fear the dead have become... restless. Without that amulet, I'm powerless to confront them.
Would you be willing to search for it? I'll just wait here and make sure nothing foul escapes the catacombs.

name: A Political Murder
objective: assassinate Helvard
first_tasks: locate Helvard

characters.name: Helvard
characters.description: the male housecarl of the Jarl of Falkreath

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Falkreath

tools: NONE
description:
You are going on a little vacation in Falkreath. You'll be able to enjoy the sights, sample the food... and kill the housecarl, Helvard.
You know what that means? He's the bodyguard to the Jarl of Falkreath himself. So be careful. That's sure to throw a branch into Falkreath's well-oiled political machine.

name: Kindred Judgment
objective: kill Harkon
first_tasks: face Harkon with Serana

characters.name: Harkon
characters.description: Serana's father, and the lord of the vampires

tools: Serana thinks that the player can't trust Harkon after they spoke with Serana's mother in the Soul Cairn: the player can't bring the bow to Harkon
description:
I think we both know... it's time to face my father Harkon. If we don't, he'll keep chasing us for the rest of our lives.
Well, before we spoke to my mother in the Soul Cairn, I would have said we bring the bow to my father. But after everything with her... I don't think we can trust him. No. He has to die. We have no choice.
Let's face him together.

name: Chasing Echoes
objective: get information about an Elder Scroll from Valerica
first_tasks: search for clues about Valerica's whereabouts with Serana

first_task_locations.description: a courtyard in Castle Volkihar with Valerica's garden, a peaceful place that Serana's father could not stand

characters.name: Valerica
characters.description: Serana's mother

characters.name: Dexion
characters.description: a male Moth Priest

locations.name: Castle Volkihar
locations.description: a castle, and the home of Serana's family

tools: Dexion said the player and Serana needed two other Elder Scrolls
Valerica told Serana that she'd go somewhere safe, somewhere that Serana's father would never search
description:
That Moth Priest, Dexion. He said we needed two other Elder Scrolls. I think I know where we can start looking. We need to find my mother, Valerica. She'll definitely know where one of the Scrolls is, and if we're lucky, she actually has it herself.
The last time I saw her, she said that she'd go somewhere safe... somewhere that my father would never search. Other than that, she wouldn't tell me anything. But the way she said it... "someplace he would never search." It was cryptic, yet she called attention to it.
Wait... There's a courtyard in Castle Volkihar. I used to help her tend a garden there. All of the ingredients for our potions came from there. She used to say that my father couldn't stand the place. Too... peaceful. I don't think we'll actually trip over her there. But it's worth a look.

name: New Allegiances
objective: turn Valindor into a vampire, and return to Vingalmo
first_tasks: use vampiric seduction on Valindor, embrace him and bite him on the neck

quest_giver.name: Vingalmo
quest_giver.description: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

characters.name: Valindor
characters.description: a knowledgeable man

tools: NONE
description:
I've found a new candidate, ripe for the Gift. I'm sending you to welcome this soul into our family.
Valindor of Riften has his ears in places that we'd love to listening in. Joining our family should increase our possibilities in the south.
Put his mind to rest, allay his fear through vampiric seduction and when he is in a pliant condition, embrace him and bite him on the neck.
When you offer the embrace, do so away from prying eyes. Our new sibling will then likely require rest while his blood undergoes the change. Return to me when your part is done.

name: The Sweep Job
objective: clear out valuables from Atheron Residence
first_tasks: steal three items of value

first_task_locations.name: Atheron Residence
first_task_locations.description: a wealthy house house in Windhelm

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

tools: NONE
description:
One of the quickest ways to make some coin in Skyrim is to clear out some of the wealthier homes of their valuables.
If you're interested, I could point out a good place that could use a little housecleaning by stealing three items of value.
The place in question is the Atheron Residence in Windhelm. The people in this home recently got one of your fellow Guild mates sent to jail.
How about you make them pay for that? Just remember the order: do job first, get drunk second.

name: Salt for Arcadia
objective: deliver some frost salts for Farengar Secret-Fire
first_tasks: give the frost salts to Arcadia, the local alchemist

characters.name: Arcadia
characters.description: a female alchemist

tools: the player asked Farengar Secret-Fire whether he is the only wizard in Whiterun: Farengar Secret-Fire is the only wizard, but Whiterun is also home to a priest, a priestess, and alchemist, and others
description:
I believe I am, yes. Technically speaking, of course. The city is also home to a priest, a priestess, an alchemist, and I'm sure others who practice. Ah, that reminds me. Speaking of alchemists, I have some frost salts for Arcadia. She asked me to obtain them for one of her potions.
Would you be so kind as to deliver the frost salts for me? I'm sure Arcadia will provide some form of recompense…

name: Destroying the Dawnguard
objective: prevent the Dawnguard from becoming a serious threat against the vampires
first_tasks: kill the Dawnguard leaders

first_task_locations.description: an abandoned fort in the Reach

tools: the Dawnguard will become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered
description:
The Dawnguard will, no doubt, soon become even more of a nuisance now that Auriel's Bow has been recovered.
We need to strike a crippling blow against them before they muster more men against us. They've holed up in an abandoned fort in the Reach. The Dawnguard are apparently focused on exterminating vampires, noble and brute alike. Not a serious threat, but we can't leave them completely unchecked or they may become one.
But their time has come to an end. And you will be the one that ends it. Killing their leaders should discourage them from an out and out war with us.

name: The Staff of Magnus
objective: bring the Staff of Magnus to the College of Winterhold
first_tasks: find the Staff of Magnus

quest_giver.name: Mirabelle Ervine
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher in magic at the College of Winterhold

characters.name: Ancano
characters.description: a power-hungry male wizard

characters.name: Savos Aren
characters.description: the male Arch-Mage of the College of Winterhold

items.name: Staff of Magnus
items.description: a mage's staff that can absorb a tremendous amount of power

locations.name: College of Winterhold
locations.description: a school for mages in Skyrim

tools: the player needs the Staff of Magnus to break through Ancano's dangerous magic

the player knows that the Staff of Magnus is in Labyrinthian: Savos Aren gave Mirabelle Ervine something from Labyrinthian before he died, Mirabelle Ervine gives the player this item and Savos Aren's amulet
description:
You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.
I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. If the stories about the staff are true, if it really can absorb a tremendous amount of power, maybe we can break through Ancano's magic.
You know that the staff is in Labyrinthian? Are you... Are you sure? The staff is there? That can't be a coincidence. The Arch-Mage. Before... before he died. He... He gave me something just a little while ago. He told me it was from Labyrinthian, and that I would know what to do with it when the time came. I think... I think he meant this for you, then. I'm not sure why, but there was something very personal about it for him. Also, I think you should take this amulet. It belonged to Savos, but I think would do you the most good now. Take it, and get out of here.
Bring back that staff before Ancano brings the whole College down around us. If we can't stop this, what happens to the rest of Skyrim?

name: Argonian Ale Extraction
objective: bring Brenuin a bottle of Argonian Ale
first_tasks: steal the bottle f Argonian Ale
tools: NONE
description:
I'm drunk only if I can help it. But damn if I ain't almost sober.
Hey. In the Bannered Mare, there's this bottle of Argonian Ale. The good stuff. Get it for me. They won't even know it's gone. Come on...
Argonian Ale! I can almost taste it! I have something for you. This here healing potion. I, er, "found" it in a temple.

name: Smooth Jazbay
objective: collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
first_tasks: find 20 Jazbay Grapes

characters.name: Aduri
characters.description: Avrusa Sarethi's younger sister

tools: Avrusa Sarethi is keeping a a tight rein on Aduri
description:
Sigh. I've got my hands full here. Between the farm chores, cultivating my supply of Nirnroot and keeping a tight rein on my sister Aduri, there's little time for rest.
Could you help me? One of the ingredients I need to cultivate Nirnroot are Jazbay Grapes... the acidic content of the juice is perfect for the soil. I need twenty of them for my current crop.
I'll give you something for your efforts... finding all of them might not be easy... or cheap.

name: Restocking Soul Gems
objective: bring 7 Common Soul Gems to Sergius Turrianus
first_tasks: find 7 Common Soul Gems
tools: NONE
description:
I need some more supplies. Can you help out with that?
I'm running low on Common Soul Gems. Bring me another seven of them, if you can.

name: Noster's Lost Helmet
objective: retrieve Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet for him
first_tasks: find Noster Eagle-Eye's helmet

quest_giver.name: Noster Eagle-Eye
quest_giver.description: a former scout of the Imperial Legion

reward.description: Noster Eagle-Eye will show the player some of his old scouting tricks

tools: Noster Eagle-Eye tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble: he lost his helmet in one of the old caves
description:
I'm Noster Eagle-Eye. I was the finest scout in the Imperial Legion, once. Tracked down all the places in the wilds that were causing people trouble.
Lost my helmet in one of the old caves. My pretty, pretty helmet. Life just got worse after that. Kept losing things. So many things....
Oh, could you find that helmet for me? I sure would love to have it again. Could show you some of my old scouting tricks.

name: The Wolf Queen Awakened
objective: stop Potema from returning to the living
first_tasks: find Potema's skeleton and remove it from the catacombs
bring Potema's skeleton back to be sanctified by Arkay

first_task_locations.name: Potema's Catacombs
first_task_locations.description: catacombs filled with Potema's undead minions

characters.name: Potema, the Wolf Queen
characters.description: a former queen of Solitude, and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: Potema was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago: Styrr has a book about Potema
one of Potema's servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines
the player was there when Potema was summoned in spirit form
Styrr helps the player with Potema's minions
description:
Ah Potema, the Wolf Queen. Former queen of Solitude and one of the most dangerous necromancers in recorded history. She was responsible for the Empire's near collapse almost five hundred years ago. I believe I have a book about her...
And now Potema has been summoned in spirit form. Summoned in spirit form is not raised from the dead. She'll need help before she can return to the living.
For the moment, the Wolf Queen has retreated to a place filled with dead eager to serve her. She has gone to her old Catacombs. A few days ago, one of her servants busted through a wall into the Temple of Divines. We'll need you to go into the Catacombs themselves.
You were there when Potema was summoned. Being at the summoning created a connection to Potema, you are the one to stop her from returning to the living. I can provide you with some help with her minions.
As to Potema herself, find what's left of her body, likely a skeleton. Remove it from the Catacombs and bring it back to be sanctified by Arkay.

name: With Friends Like These...
objective: kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
first_tasks: turn around, and select the person who shall not leave the room alive

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's admirer, and a member of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: the player's debt to the Dark Brotherhood will be paid

characters.name: Aventus Aretino
characters.description: a young boy who wanted Grelod the Kind dead

characters.name: Grelod the Kind
characters.description: a cruel, old female orphanage headmistress, killed by the player

tools: Astrid woke the player up from their sleep
Aventus Aretino was looking for the Dark Brotherhood: Grelod the Kind was a Dark Brotherhood contract, and the player must pay for killing her
description:
Sleep well? Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole. A kill you must repay.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.

name: Repairing the Phial
objective: acquire the materials necessary to repair the White Phial
first_tasks: get unmelting snow
get mammoth tusk powder
get a briar heart

reward.name: White Phial
reward.description: a legendary bottle that will replenish whatever fluid is placed inside of it

characters.name: Nurelion
characters.description: Quintus Navale's master

tools: Quintus Navale has thought about repairing the White Phial
Nurelion was obsessed with the White Phial: his obsession consumed him
description:
I have some thoughts about repairing the White Phial. There are three crucial elements. Some may be easier to find than others.
On the top of the Throat of the World is a patch of unmelting snow. No heat can touch it. Then we need the tusk of a mammoth, ground to a fine powder as only the giants know how. The final step is tricky. It requires the briar heart from a Forsworn of the Reach.
If you can bring me these materials, the Phial can again be made whole. You can keep the White Phial after I have repaired it. I fear keeping the Phial would just remind me of Nurelion's obsession, and how it consumed him.

name: Recipe for Death
objective: assassinate the Gourmet, a famous master chef, and get his Writ of Passage to assume his identity
first_tasks: question Anton Virane to learn the true identity of the Gourmet, and kill Anton Virane

characters.name: Gourmet
characters.description: a famous master chef, whose true identity is not known

characters.name: Astrid
characters.description: the female guildmaster of the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Anton Virane
characters.description: a male cook

tools: Astrid told the player about killing the Gourmet and taking his identity
the player should hide the Gourmet's body if they can
description:
Let's get down to business. Astrid told you about the Gourmet, I hope? That you need to kill him and take on his identity?
But first you'll need to learn who he is. Assuming, of course, that the Gourmet actually is a "he." Could be a woman for all we know. In my, um, investigations, I came upon this. It's a copy of the Gourmet's cookbook. Ah, but not just any copy. It's signed you see! Seems to be a message from the Gourmet to one Anton Virane. I've tracked Virane to the keep in Markarth. It would seem he's the cook.
You are to obtain that information from Virane - who the Gourmet really is, and where he can be found. Oh, and when you're done with Virane, kill him. Loose ends and all that.
As I was saying... You'll need to kill the Gourmet, of course. But what's more, you'll need to get his Writ of Passage, so you can take his place. Oh, and if you can, hide his body. The longer it takes for anyone else to determine his real identity, the better.
Now off with you!

name: Search and Seizure
objective: find evidence of Ogmund the Skald's Talos worship for Ondolemar
first_tasks: break into Ogmund the Skald's home

characters.name: Ogmund the Skald
characters.description: an old, respected man

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: a mortal man who ascended to godhood

characters.name: Jarl
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

groups.name: Thalmor
groups.description: an elven organization that denies the godhood of Talos and tries to root put Talos worship

tools: the player asked Ondolemar what he is doing in Markarth
Ondolemar knows that Ogmund the Skald worships Talos in his home: the Jarl of Markarth refuses to arrest Ogmund the Skald
description:
I was sent here to lead the Thalmor's interests in this corner of the world. It's my mission to root out all Talos worship in this city.
You're awfully inquisitive, aren't you? I like that. Perhaps you'd care to solve a little problem I'm having? Ogmund the Skald. He's old, respected, and I know for a fact that he worships Talos in his home. But the Jarl has been hesitant to call for his arrest. I want you to break in to his home and find evidence.

name: Silver Lining
objective: recover Endon's stolen silver mold for him
first_tasks: find Endon's stolen silver mold

first_task_locations.name: Pinewatch
first_task_locations.description: a small cottage, and a bandit hideout

reward.description: Endon will pay the player well
Endon becomes an ally to the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Rigel Strong-Arm
characters.description: a male bandit

groups.description: a guild of thieves rising in power in Markarth

tools: the player is a member of the Thieves Guild
Endon ordered a silver mold from Valenwood: it was stolen by a group of bandits led by Rigel Strong-Arm
the authorities told Endon that their resources were spread too thin right now
description:
Several months ago I ordered a special silver mold from some artisans in Valenwood. Well, it never arrived. Later I found out that it was robbed by a group of bandits led by someone named Rigel Strong-Arm.
Look, I talked to everyone with an ounce of authority... everyone. They all told me their resources were spread too thin right now. Word on the street says that the Thieves Guild is coming back into its own in Markarth so I figured... ...to send a thief to steal back what was stolen.
Look, this mold is irreplaceable. I'll pay you well for its return and I can also prove to be quite a valuable ally to the Thieves Guild.  The only thing I can tell you is that the mold was taken to the bandit's hideout... a small cottage called Pinewatch.
I'm not sure how many men they have inside, but I trust that won't be an issue for you. Good luck.

name: Sanctity
objective: cure Farkas' lycanthropy
first_tasks: get a special Hagraven's head with Farkas

first_task_locations.description: the place that is already known to the player

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a Nord werewolf, and a fellow member of the Companions

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied underworld of the Nords

characters.name: Kodlak
characters.description: the dead male leader of the Companions, who was cured of lycanthropy

characters.description: a female member of the Companions

tools: Kodlak said that werewolves can't be good Nords
Aela said a Hagraven's head is needed to cure lycanthropy
description:
There is always work. My mind is someplace else, though.
I think that maybe Kodlak was right. As a werewolf, I can't be a good Nord. I want to be clean, like he was, and go to Sovngarde when I finally die.
Aela said we would need a Hagraven's head. I already have one of them, but she said it was a special kind. And that you knew where to get more.
Let's go find one!

name: Hired Muscle
objective: intimidate Erikur into submission without killing him

quest_giver.name: Farkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

characters.description: a man who has been causing trouble to other citizens

description:
We've gotten a letter about Erikur needing some muscle up in Solitude.
I don't know what the fight is about, and that's not our business anyway. I just need you to go out there, look tough, and scare this milk drinker Erikur into submission.
No more than that. I don't want to hear about a killing, understand? Go. Bring honor to yourself, and the Companions.

name: The Break of Dawn
objective: kill Malkoran, and retrieve the Dawnbreaker
first_tasks: enter Kilkreath

quest_giver.name: Meridia
quest_giver.description: the lady of light, a goddess

reward.name: Dawnbreaker
reward.description: Meridia's token, a mighty sword that burns undead

characters.name: Malkoran
characters.description: a necromancer who defiles Kilkreath and traps the souls of the people killed in the ongoing war

tools: NONE
description:
The Necromancer Malkoran defiles my shrine with vile corruptions, trapping lost souls left in the wake of this war to do his bidding. Worse still, he uses the power stored within my own token to fuel his foul deeds.
Mortals call my token Dawnbreaker, for it was forged in a holy light that breaks upon my foes, burning away corruption and false life. You will enter my shrine, destroy Malkoran, and retrieve this mighty blade.
I have brought you here, mortal, to be my champion. You will do this. I have commanded it!

name: The Pale Lady
objective: Find out what happened in Frostmere Crypt
first_tasks: go deeper into Frostmere Crypt

first_task_locations.name: Frostmere Crypt
first_task_locations.description: a crypt that contains a whole forest with a big old monument out in the center

quest_giver.name: Eisa Blackthorn
quest_giver.description: a bandit from Kyr's gang, giving quest via "Eisa's Journal"

characters.name: Kyr
characters.description: a male bandit leader

characters.name: Ra'jirr
characters.description: a tough male bandit

characters.name: Pale Lady
characters.description: a swamp lady who abducts children at night

tools: Kyr's bandit gang dug up Frostmere Crypt: Kyr took the Pale Blade from the monument within
Ra'jirr keeps muttering about a Pale Lady, who is going to kill all of Kyr's bandits if they do not return the Pale Blade
description:
Eisa's Journal
by Eisa Blackthorn

Night shift woke me to say they'd hit something big. Kyr, Ra'jirr, and I went down to take a look. It's huge, like a whole forest was just swallowed up by the earth, with a big old monument out in the center. Kyr took a sword from the monument as a trophy and dubbed it the "Pale Blade", proof his whole plan was finally paying off. For once, he might be right.

Ra'jirr's been having nightmares over the past few days. He keeps muttering about a "Pale Lady" - one of those swamp women who steal children away at night, I think. To think some fool story could turn the toughest bandit I know into a cowering kitten, frightened of his own shadow. I'm just glad none of the others see him like this.

It's getting worse. Ra'jirr can barely sleep at all now, and whenever he dozes off, he wakes up screaming - woke the whole place last night. He says the "Pale Lady" is coming for us - she's down in the forest, we have to return the sword or she'll kill us all. Not a chance - the boss clings to that thing like he was born with it. I've told everyone Ra'jirr just has a fever, but this can't go on. I've pulled a few things together. I'll slip out tonight and never look back.

name: Under Saarthal
objective: look for anything interesting
first_tasks: locate enchanted artifacts for Arniel Gane

quest_giver.name: Tolfdir
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher at the College of Winterhold who likes to lecture on the dangers of magic

characters.name: Arniel Gane
characters.description: one of the scholars of the College of Winterhold, a man

tools: NONE
description:
We are looking for anything at all that might be of interest. That's why I adore Saarthal... we have no idea what we're going to find. And if, along the way, my message about the dangers of magic should happen to sink in for a few students, that would be a happy coincidence.
Hmm. Well, why don't you see if you can assist Arniel Gane? He's one of our scholars, here working on cataloging our finds.
I expect he'd appreciate some help in locating any additional magical artifacts here in the ruins. Any enchanted items will do; the usefulness of the enchantment is irrelevant. If you find anything, the class can look it over.

name: Waking Nightmare
objective: relieve the people of Dawnstar from Vaermina's damaging nightmares
first_tasks: return to Nightcaller Temple with Erandur, and help him end the nightmares

characters.name: Vaermina
characters.description: an evil goddess

locations.name: Nightcaller Temple
locations.description: a temple hosting the root of the nightmare problem, a short walk away from Dawnstar

tools: Vaermina has an awful hunger for people's memories: in return, she leaves behind nightmares
description:
The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.
These dreams are manifestations created by Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares, not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.
I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple. Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard? I've already said too much. If anyone overhears what we're saying, it could start a panic. I would simply ask that you trust me and help me end Dawnstar's nightmares.
Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.

name: Taking Care of Business
objective: send a message that the Thieves Guild is not to be ignored
first_tasks: collect some debts from Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand, and Haelga without killing them

quest_giver.name: Brynjolf
quest_giver.description: a member of the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Keerava
characters.description: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Bersi Honey-Hand
characters.description: a man who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Haelga
characters.description: a woman who has not paid her debts to the Thieves Guild

tools: the player and Brynjolf did a little thievery at the market
description:
Well, well... Color me impressed kid. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!
So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me? They are Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga.
They owe our organization some serious coin and they've decided not to pay. I want you to explain to them the error of their ways. Do this right, and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.
Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is that you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored. A word of warning though... I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business.

name: Unseen Visions
objective: read "Blood"
first_tasks: perform the ritual of the Ancestor Moth to gain the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls

first_task_locations.description: an Ancestor Glade in Skyrim, in the pine forest

items.name: "Blood"
items.description: an Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.description: mysterious scrolls which are fragments of creation from outside time and space

groups.name: Ancestor Moths
groups.description: moths that provide the player with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls

tools: the ritual of the Ancestor Moth: the player must remove the bark from a canticle tree with a draw knife to attract Ancestor Moths to them
description:
Scattered across Tamriel are secluded locations known only as Ancestor Glades. There's one in Skyrim, in the Pine Forest.
Performing the Ritual of the Ancestor Moth within the glade should provide the answers you seek. It involves carefully removing the bark from a Canticle Tree which will in turn attract Ancestor Moths to you.
In keeping with tradition, you must use a specific tool in the Ancestor Glade, an implement known as a Draw Knife. Every Moth Priest is taught this ritual, but few ever get the chance to perform it... you should consider yourself fortunate if it works for you.
Once enough of the moths are following, they'll provide you with the second sight needed to decipher the Elder Scrolls. From what I saw in the vision, the Elder Scroll which foreshadows the defiance of the gods with the blood of mortals is the key to the prophecy.

name: The Shill Job
objective: frame Carlotta Valentia to get her out of the way
first_tasks: place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Carlotta Valentia
characters.description: a woman who pissed off the wrong person

tools: the Thieves Guild gets rid of people without killing them, unlike the Dark Brotherhood
description:
When a client needs us to eliminate another, we don't operate like the Dark Brotherhood. We find alternate means to get them out of the way.
We send you to plant some phony evidence in the mark's house, and then tip off the town guard... the rest takes care of itself. Sound like you can handle it?
Go place an item as evidence inside Carlotta Valentia's home. She must have ticked-off our client badly. The client's impatient and keeps asking if the job's done. Can you get him off my back?

name: Toying With The Dead
objective: retrieve the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals for Vekel the Man
first_tasks: find the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals

reward.description: Vekel the Man would split the reward for the 4 volumes of Arondil's journals with the player

items.description: volumes of Arondil's journals, necromantic ravings

characters.name: Arondil
characters.description: an insane male wizard, and a necromancer performing unspeakable experiments on reanimation

tools: Arondil used to live in Dawnstar: his house was burned down when his necromantic experiments became public knowledge
description:
I have a buyer with a very odd taste in literature, looking for some particular books.
I'm told they're the ravings of a madman, a wizard named Arondil, and his peculiar cravings. It's said to be in four volumes and very hard to come by. My client is offering quite a reward for them, which I'd split with you.
Recently, a woman was found... naked and shivering along the road to Dawnstar. The only information the guard could get from her were tales of strange experiments and Arondil scribbling in his journals.
He used to have a home in Dawnstar until they burned it down. The people say he was doing unspeakable experiments on reanimation... rituals only a necromancer would perform. After he made for Yngvild, he was never heard from again.
In his later years, Arondil moved into some ice caves known as Yngvild. He preferred the solitude in which to perform his, um... experiments.

name: No More Pain
objective: find your prisoner's treasure for yourself
first_tasks: get your prisoner's hidden things from a hollowed-out rock
tools: the player is hurting their prisoner
description:
I'll tell you anything. Anything! Just please stop... hurting me... I just... can't take the pain. Not a second longer.
I'll give you money. Treasure. I have some things hidden away. Take them all. They're yours. Just please... stop. Just north of Windhelm. There's a hollowed-out rock. I have some things hidden in there. Take them! They're yours.
I've told you everything I can. I don't know what else you could want...

name: Bound Until Death
objective: lure Titus Mede II to Skyrim so that the Dark Brotherhood can assassinate him
first_tasks: assassinate Vittoria Vici at her own wedding

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: a significant bonus if the player kills Vittoria Vici while she addresses the wedding guests

characters.name: Titus Mede II
characters.description: the Emperor

characters.name: Vittoria Vici
characters.description: the overseer of the the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude, and the first cousin of the Emperor

characters.name: Night Mother
characters.description: the female spirit who guides the Dark Brotherhood

tools: the Night Mother spoke to the player

Vittoria Vici has Imperial connections, and her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks: their marriage is a step toward reconciliation between the Empire and the Stormcloaks, but a murder at the wedding will stall the peace process and send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire
description:
Splendid. We're ready to begin. Or, more specifically, you're ready to begin. After all, you're the one the Night Mother spoke to.
Now then. I hope you have something nice to wear. Because you're going to a wedding. Well, more like the public reception. It should be a lovely affair. You'll mingle with the guests, eat some cake... stab the bride.
Oh yes. You've got to kill the bride. At her wedding. And they say romance is dead. Your target's name is Vittoria Vici. She oversees the East Empire Company's business holdings in Solitude. The wedding is being held in that city, at the Temple of the Divines. Her death will cause an uproar, which is exactly what we want.
Vittoria Vici is the first cousin to our dear Emperor, Titus Mede II. Vici has obvious Imperial connections. Her husband has ties to the Stormcloaks. Their union is a step toward reconciliation. So if there's a murder at the wedding... Not only will it stall the peace process - it will send shockwaves throughout the entire Empire. The Emperor's hand will be forced. He'll have to travel to Skyrim to deal with the aftermath... and he'll find the Dark Brotherhood waiting.
Vici is likely to address her guests frequently, as is the wedding custom. Kill her when she does that, and I promise you a significant bonus.
Now go. And give the city of Solitude a celebration they're not likely to forget.

name: Rising at Dawn
objective: return to Falion with a filled black soul gem, and he will perform a vampirism cure ritual
first_tasks: get a black soul gem, and fill it by killing someone

quest_giver.name: Falion
quest_giver.description: a great mage who knows many things

reward.description: the player's vampirism will be cured

characters.name: Agni
characters.description: a young girl, and Falion's ward

tools: the player is a vampire
Falion has considered becoming a vampire himself, but that would endanger Agni
description:
I know many things. I have studied things beyond the reach of most humans, traveled the other planes, seen things one should not see.
I have met gods and long-dead races of people and everything in between and I know enough to see a vampire where others would see a man. I met several of your kind during my studies of life-extending magics. I even considered becoming a vampire myself. In the end, vampirism would endanger my ward Agni which would defeat the intended purpose.
It is possible to cure vampirism. I know of a ritual but I've never performed it. It requires a filled black soul gem. You will need to kill someone. When you have a gem and have filled it return to me and I will perform the ritual. I will bring life to your dead body, vampire.

name: A Decisive Message
objective: deliver a sensitive intelligence message for General Tullius
first_tasks: deliver the message to Jarl Baalgruf

quest_giver.name: General Tullius
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Imperial Legion

characters.name: Jarl Baalgruf
characters.description: the nobleman who rules over Whiterun

characters.name: Ulfric
characters.description: the male leader of the Stormcloaks

tools: Ulfric has raised enough men to attack Whiterun, but Jarl Baalgruf refuses the Imperial Legion's support: the message should convince Jarl Baalgruf
description:
I need someone I can trust to deliver a message of great import to Jarl Baalgruf of Whiterun.
We have it on good authority that Ulfric has raised enough men to attack the city of Whiterun. The Jarl, however, refuses the Legion's support. This missive should convince him.
Be aware soldier, these documents contain sensitive intelligence for the Jarl's eyes only.

name: Evil in Waiting
objective: help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
first_tasks: collect the three vessels needed to vanquish Hevnoraak, and bring them to Valdar

quest_giver.name: Valdar
quest_giver.description: a ghostly guardian whose powers are fading

characters.name: Hevnoraak
characters.description: an evil man who has been dead for many generations

tools: Valdar has been holding Hevnoraak in his tomb
Hevnoraak's minions guard the three vessels
description:
Leave, stranger. Evil stirs in this place. I fear for the security of the very land if it should break free.
We stand at the tomb of Hevnoraak, who has been dead for many generations. I fear, however, that his return may be at hand. I have been holding him here. While he regains strength, however, I am fading. By now I can barely contain his power, much less defeat him if he awakens. But with the help of a living champion I may be able to succeed.
Three vessels in the tomb below hold the power to vanquish Hevnoraak. Before anything else, we need those. Bring them to me - but be careful, mortal. They are guarded by Hevnoraak's minions. They will stop at nothing to see their master return.

name: Old Friends
objective: find the person who summoned ash spawns and made them attack Neloth
first_tasks: wear the ring Neloth gave you to find the source of the ash spawns

locations.name: Morrowind
locations.description: a province where Neloth has made many enemies

tools: Neloth gives the player a ring: it will light up the source of the ash spawn attacks when the player gets close to it
description:
I'm under attack. There are too many coincidences. There must be someone behind all of my recent troubles.
I have enemies. Legions of them back in Morrowind. However, in this case I have reason to believe it is someone in Solstheim. First I need to identify the culprit. I've enchanted this ring to find the source of the attacks. Here, take it.
Just wear the ring I gave you. It will light up the source when you get close to it. I enchanted the ring with a bit of ash from the last ash spawn attack. It can follow the magical link back to its summoner.

name: The Ghost of Old Hroldan
objective: put the Ghost of Old Hroldan to rest
first_tasks: find Hjalti's sword ,and give it to the Ghost of Old Hroldan

quest_giver.name: Ghost of Old Hroldan
quest_giver.description: an ancient ghost of a soldier

characters.name: Hjalti
characters.description: Ghost of Old Hroldan's long-dead brother-in-arms

tools: the Ghost of Old Hroldan thinks that the player is Hjalti
description:
You don't remember me, Hjalti? Two campaigns we served together. You saved my life time and time again. You promised me, Hjalti. You promised that when we sacked Hroldan, you would make me your sworn brother.
And I've waited. Even after the enemies' arrows dug into my chest and their hammers crushed my bones. I've waited.
Give me your sword, Hjalti. That we may become brothers as you promised.

name: Reparations
objective: make reparations for breaking the Thieves Guild rules
first_tasks: pay 1,000 gold to Vex for readmittance to the Thieves Guild

quest_giver.name: Vex
quest_giver.description: the player's passive-aggressive superior in the Thieves Guild

reward.description: restored membership of the Thieves Guild

tools: NONE
description:
I'm going to make this short and sweet, because frankly I don't think you deserve another shot. You've broken the rules and now you need to pay... and it's going to cost you quite a bit: 1,000 gold.
You claim to be a thief... act like one. Pick pockets, knock over houses... heck, I don't care if you have to bust into a palace. You do what you have to do to come up with the coin.
Anything you steal, you bring it straight to me. Now get out of here and don't come back until your pockets are full. Only then you're one of us again.

name: New Silence
objective: help Neloth with his silence experiment
first_tasks: let Neloth cast a new kind of silence spell on you

reward.description: Neloth will prepare a version of the silence spell that the player can cast themselves

tools: NONE
description:
You could help me with my research. I believe I've discovered a new form of silence. Some philosophers postulate seven orders of silence, but I believe there's an eighth.
If you allow me, I'd like to envelop you in the eighth form, to study the mental effects. If this works, I'll prepare a version that you can cast yourself, if you ever wish to inflict... er, study silence.

name: A Shield for Igmund
objective: retrieve the shield for Igmund
first_tasks: get Igmund's father's shield back from Hagravens

quest_giver.name: Igmund
quest_giver.description: the nobleman who rules over Markarth

reward.description: Igmund's permission to purchase property in Markarth

groups.name: Forsworn
groups.description: savage people who consort with Hagravens

tools: the player asked more work from Igmund
Igmund's father tried to negotiate with the Forsworn: they took his shield to Hagravens
description:
I do have more work for you. A personal matter. My father died trying to negotiate with the Forsworn, back when that was possible.
They took his shield to Hag's End, to those Hagraven beasts they consort with. I need you to bring it home where it belongs. I warn you, it's dangerous work. No man of mine has ever faced a Hagraven and lived. I'll understand if you decline.
Return my father's shield to me and I'll grant you permission to purchase property in my city.
Divines watch over you.

name: Sanuarach Mine
objective: help Ainethach keep Sanuarach Mine
first_tasks: convince sellswords to leave

sellswords showed up after Forsworn attacked Sanuarach Mine: sellswords won't let anyone work until Ainethach sells it off
description:
The Silver-Bloods are trying to muscle in on my land. Forsworn attack the mines, and suddenly all these sellswords show up in Karthwasten to 'help.' They won't let anyone work until I sell it off.
You can try to convince them to leave, but I'd keep your sword-arm ready if things get ugly.

name: Imperial Spy?

first_tasks: steal Lod's letter

quest_giver.name: Dengeir of Stuhn
quest_giver.description: a paranoid man who hates the Empire

locations.description: a province of the Empire that might break out of the Empire

locations.name: Solitude
locations.description: the capital city of Skyrim, under Imperial rule

tools: Dengeir of Stuhn thinks that Lod wrote a letter to General Tullius
description:
There's a plot. Not against me. Against all of Falkreath. Those Imperial bastards are spying on every one of us.
Last night I saw Lod the blacksmith writing a letter. Probably sending word to Solitude and General Tullius. Are you loyal to Skyrim? Break into Lod's house and get that letter.
The Empire is probably making Lod smith up more swords and armor for them.

name: An Axe to Find
objective: retrieve Glover Mallory's Ancient Nordic Pickaxe
first_tasks: tell Crescius Caerellius give Glover Mallory his Ancient Nordic Pickaxe back

reward.description: Glover Mallory will pay the player

items.name: Ancient Nordic Pickaxe
items.description: a pickaxe, the only tool tough enough to crack stalhrim, becoming rare because forging them is a lost art

characters.name: Crescius Caerellius
characters.description: a foolish old man

tools: NONE
description:
You haven't seen Crescius Caerellius have you? That foolish old man's taken my pickaxe again!
I'm not fussing over a simple pickaxe. No, no, no. This isn't just your run-of-the-mill pickaxe... I'm talking about an Ancient Nordic Pickaxe. They don't exactly grow on trees, you know.
An Ancient Nordic Pickaxe is the only tool tough enough to crack stalhrim, is what it is. Not many of those beauties left in the world... forging them is a lost art.
Look, if you see Crescius, tell him to give me that pickaxe back and I'll pay you for the trouble.

name: The Horn of Jurgen Windcaller
objective: retrieve the horn of Jurgen Windcaller
first_tasks: find the horn of Jurgen Windcaller in his tomb

characters.name: Jurgen Windcaller
characters.description: the man who founded Greybeards

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: the masters of the way of the voice

tools: this is the player's last trial
description:
You are now ready for your last trial. Retrieve the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, our founder, from his tomb in the ancient fane of Ustengrav.
Remain true to the Way of the Voice, and you will return. Then it is time for us to recognize you formally as Dragonborn.

name: A Ring Worthy of Alchemists
objective: retrieve the Ring of Pure Mixtures for Frida
first_tasks: find the Ring of Pure Mixtures

items.name: Ring of Pure Mixtures
items.description: a ring that boosts an alchemist's talents

tools: Frida's husband died while searching for the Ring of Pure Mixtures
description:
I'm Frida, the oldest woman in Dawnstar.
I picked up the herb trade from my husband. We used to go out in the wilds and collect ingredients together. He used to call me his "pretty Juniper." It's quite romantic, if you're an alchemist. Frost took the old fool a few seasons back, while he was looking for the Ring of Pure Mixtures.
I found the ring's resting place, Shrouded Grove, after he died, but I'm far too old to go exploring some cave, now. I'd be happy to give you some alchemy training in exchange for the ring, if you bring it to me.

name: Hitting the Books
objective: find the books needed to identify the artifact you found
first_tasks: talk to Orthorn

characters.name: Orthorn
characters.description: an ex-student of the College of Winterhold

tools: Orthorn stole books from Urag gro-Shub and left to join the summoners at Fellglow Keep
description:
I know what you want. Word travels fast around here. Discovered some big mystery, huh? Well you don't even need to ask. No, I don't have anything for you. Not anymore, anyway.
Orthorn stole a number of books when he ran off to Fellglow Keep to join those Summoners. Some kind of peace offering. I think one of those volumes may have had some relevant information. If you want them, you'll have to talk to Orthorn.

name: Infiltration
objective: help Stalleo to take back Treva's Watch from bandits
first_tasks: use the mine entrance behind Stalleo and his men, and open the front gate

first_task_locations.name: Treva's Watch
first_task_locations.description: Stalleo's home fortress, overrun by bandits

quest_giver.description: a man who is expecting reinforcements
