characters.description: a man who has been at odds with Stalleo since the king's death

tools: Stalleo and his men left to help with the war: meanwhile Brurid and his bandits seized Treva's Watch and kidnapped Stalleo's family
description:
Are you here to help? Finally, reinforcements have arrived. I was expecting more though, you'd better be good.
We left to help with the war and these filth bags swooped in and seized the place. I suspect Brurid planned this, there's been bad blood between us since the king's death. But to invade my home, kidnap my family...
The front gate is locked so you'll need to use the mine entrance behind us. Open the front gate and we'll try and give you some support. My family is everything to me. Clear the fort and on top of the posted reward you can have whatever items you'd like.

name: Protecting the Bloodline
objective: destroy a vampire before it turns its bandit allies into vampires
first_tasks: kill the vampire bandit
tools: NONE
description:
A feral-blooded has holed up with a group of bandits. Likely wants to create a nest of broodlings.
We don't need competition for blood, and we don't want the mortals getting up in arms making things difficult for us. Go destroy the feral beast before this becomes a problem.

name: Lessons on Defense
objective: bring Captain Aldis a copy of "The Mirror"
first_tasks: find a copy of "The Mirror"

quest_giver.name: Captain Aldis
quest_giver.description: a captain of the Imperial Legion

tools: Captain Aldis trains recruits: he thought about asking some training books from the general
description:
I'm with the Imperial Legion. Train the recruits. Turn boys into men. That sort of thing.
Thinking of asking the General for some training books. Give the soldiers something to do while they're on rest. Something besides drinking. Ever seen a book called "The Mirror"? We used to hand it out to boys looking to learn basic shield work.
If you find a copy of "The Mirror", I'd be glad to have it. Then I'll see if I can get some copies made for the men.

name: The Heart of Dibella
objective: find a new Sybil for the Temple of Dibella
first_tasks: retrieve the new Sybil, a young girl

first_task_locations.name: Karthwasten
first_task_locations.description: a small village pressed against the stone, to the north

characters.name: Sybil
characters.description: a mortal woman who proclaims the will of Dibella

characters.name: Dibella
characters.description: the goddess of love and passion

items.name: Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
items.description: a secret ceremony known to the priestesses of Dibella, which is used to find a new Sybil after the death of the previous one

locations.description: Temple of Dibella, a temple for Dibella

tools: the player breached the inner sanctum of the Temple of Dibella and interrupted the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil
description:
You have committed a breach, and must pay the penalty. Normally, a quick death would be required. Luckily for you, there are more pressing matters.
The ceremony you so rudely interrupted was the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil. I don't expect you to know what that means. Suffice to say that our Sybil was recently lost to us. Through the ceremony, we have seen the home of the next Sybil, to the north, in a small village pressed against the stone.
If you can travel there, and retrieve our young Sybil, your transgression will be forgiven. We believe the place in our vision to be Karthwasten. Now move quickly. The girl must be brought to the temple as soon as possible.
You, my dear, can earn the blessing of Dibella as your reward.

name: The World-Eater's Eyrie
objective: fly to Skuldafn on Odahviing and face Alduin
first_tasks: free Odahviing

characters.name: Alduin, World-Eater
characters.description: a male dragon, likes devouring the souls of mortals

locations.name: Skuldafn
locations.description: Alduin's door to Sovngarde, an ancient fane high in the eastern mountains filled with Alduin's remaining forces

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied underworld where the souls of mortal heroes end up in

tools: the player lured Odahviing to Dragonsreach and took him prisoner: the player distrust Odahviing
description:
It was you that lured me here and took me prisoner... I have done nothing to earn your distrust.
Wisdom sees the doorway. It would be wise to recognize when you only have one choice. You can trust me. I am not treacherous. Alduin has proven himself unworthy to rule. I go my own way now. He has traveled to Sovngarde to regain his strength, devouring the souls of the mortal dead. A privilege he jealously guards... His door to Sovngarde is at Skuldafn, one of his ancient fanes high in the eastern mountains. I surely do not need to warn you that all his remaining strength is marshaled there.
Free me, and I will carry you to Skuldafn so that you can face Alduin in battle. I warn you, once you've flown the skies, your envy of the dragons will only increase.

name: Family Heirloom
objective: retrieve a stolen family heirloom from a group of wizards
first_tasks: find the family heirloom

quest_giver.name: Vilkas
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Companions

tools: NONE
description:
We have a bit of a sensitive matter this time. A wealthy family has... misplaced one of their heirlooms.
Of course, it's a group of wizards they're pointing their fingers at. Who knows what they want it for, but we want it back.
Move quickly so we can have this over and done with. These aren't the most glorious jobs, but they pay well.

name: Dominion and Humiliation
objective: help Molag Bal take revenge upon a priest of Boethiah who desecrated Molag Bal's shrine
first_tasks: save the priest of Boethiah from imprisonment

characters.name: Boethiah
characters.description: the goddess of destruction, Molag Bal's rival

tools: the player tried to take the mace on Molag Bal's shrine: Molag Bal imprisoned the player with sharp spikes
description:
Fool! Did you think Molag Bal, the Lord of Domination, would so easily reward you? What do you see from that little cage? Speak.
You definitely see the spikes of your cage. Sharp, aren't they? This was the last thing many saw before they were sacrificed in my name. But even a god has his enemies, and my rival Boethiah had her priest desecrate it. So long since it's tasted blood. Until you came.
I want submission. I want the priest who did this to bend his knee and give me his soul. He comes by to perform Boethiah's insulting rites at my altar, but he's been missing. Captured and bound. Left to rot.
You'll get the freedom your kind enjoys so much. Save the priest. Let him perform his rite one more time. And when he does, we will be waiting for him.
Then you will be finally rewarded. The Mace of Molag Bal! I give you its true power, mortal. When your enemies lie broken and bloody before you, know that I will be watching.

name: Rescue
objective: rescue Farkas from a group of necromancers
first_tasks: kill the vampire leading the group of necromancers

characters.name: Farkas
characters.description: a man, and the player's friend

characters.name: Arkay
characters.description: the god of life and death

tools: NONE
description:
Arkay has some grave news, friend. Your friend, Farkas, kidnapped! A vicious night stalker rules over a group of necromancers - seeks to gain leverage over the righteous.
Arkay's never clear on life and death. Is he still alive? There's always hope... Go to Morvunskar, kill the vampire, and try to save Farkas.

name: Diplomatic Immunity
objective: infiltrate the party at the Thalmor Embassy, and find Elenwen's secret files
first_tasks: talk to Malborn
meet Delphine

quest_giver.name: Delphine
quest_giver.description: a paranoid member of the Blades

locations.description: Thalmor Embassy, the embassy of the Thalmor

characters.name: Elenwen
characters.description: the female Thalmor ambassador

characters.name: Malborn
characters.description: a male wood elf who is Delphine's trusty contact inside the Thalmor Embassy

tools: Elenwen regularly throws parties: while the player is talking with Malborn, Delphine gets the player an invitation to one of Elenwen's parties
description:
The Thalmor ambassador, Elenwen, regularly throws parties where the rich and connected cozy up to the Thalmor.
I can get you into one of those parties. Once you're inside the Embassy, you get away and find Elenwen's secret files. I have a contact inside the Embassy. He's not up for this kind of high-risk mission, but he can help you. His name's Malborn. Wood elf, plenty of reason to hate the Thalmor. You can trust him.
I'll get word for him to meet you in Solitude, at the Winking Skeever -- you know it? While you're doing that, I'll work on getting you an invitation to Elenwen's little party.
Meet me at the Solitude stables after you've arranged things with Malborn.

name: Drowned Sorrows
objective: find Isabelle Rolaine
first_tasks: talk to Vex about Isabelle Rolaine

characters.name: Isabelle Rolaine
characters.description: a young, beautiful woman, and Ranmir's lost love

characters.name: Ranmir
characters.description: a male drunk who used to be happy with Isabelle Rolaine

characters.name: Vex
characters.description: a woman

tools: Ranmir is sure that Isabelle Rolaine ran away with Vex
description:
I'm Dagur, an innkeeper.
I wondered if I could ask a favor of you. It's about Ranmir. Don't get me wrong, I don't have a problem with him being in my inn all the time. He mostly keeps to himself, and so far he's been able to pay. I just hate to see what's happened to him. He hasn't always been like this, you know. Drunk, I mean.
He was a different person. Happy, outgoing... Like anyone who's in love. See, Ranmir was involved with a pretty young woman named Isabelle Rolaine. The two of them were very happy together, I thought. One day, she just disappeared. Ranmir was convinced she'd run off with someone else, leaving him behind. He turned to drinking, and what's left of him is what you see here every day.
I hoped that maybe if she could be found, if he had some sort of explanation, that maybe he could put himself back together. I'm in no position to go searching for her, but perhaps you could. Ranmir seemed convinced that Isabelle'd run off to Riften with someone named Vex. That's all I remember.

name: Your Will Be Done
objective: learn powerful, new conjuration spells
first_tasks: summon an unbound Dremora, prove that you are in control, and order the Dremora bring you a sigil stone from an Oblivion gate

first_task_locations.description: the top of the Hall of Attainment

quest_giver.name: Phinis Gestor
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher in conjuration magic

reward.description: Phinis Gestor inscribes powerful, new conjuration spells for the player

characters.name: Dremora
characters.description: a humanoid creature from the planes of Oblivion

tools: the player has advanced quickly in their conjuration studies
Phinis Gestor will teach the player the spell to summon the Dremora, but it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event
description:
How quickly you've advanced. Most impressive. There are spells yet to be learned, powerful spells that can more closely and more permanently bind creatures to your will. These spells are difficult, even for one as skilled as I. To even begin to inscribe them, I need something very special. A sigil stone from an Oblivion gate.
I do not have one in my possession. Nor do you, I'm sure. So we require a Dremora to retrieve one for us. You will summon one, and order it to bring a sigil stone to you. I will then inscribe the spells for you.
But there are risks. There are always risks. You must summon and command an unbound Dremora. Summoning an Unbound Dremora is not like other Conjuration spells. It will not simply do your bidding. You must first prove you are in control.
I will teach you the spell to summon the Dremora, but know that it will only work in a place properly prepared for the event. Here is the spell you need. Go to the top of the Hall of Attainment; I have prepared a place for you there.

name: The Gift
objective: turn your wife into a vampire
first_tasks: use vampiric seduction on your wife, embrace her and bite her neck

quest_giver.name: Vingalmo
quest_giver.description: a fellow vampire, who speaks elegantly

characters.description: the player's wife

tools: the player is married: it presents difficulties for vampires
vampirism is the greatest gift that vampires can bestow to their loved ones
description:
It's come to my inescapable attention that you, my dear friend, are married. Marriage is a fine institution, however, one that does present certain difficulties for such as like ourselves.
May I strongly suggest that you make a visit to this spouse of yours and "invite" her to the family by offering her the Gift of Vampirism. Put her mind to rest, allay her fear through vampiric seduction and when she is in a pliant condition, embrace her and bite her on the neck.
It is the greatest token we can bestow upon those we love and wish to see protected.

name: Boethiah's Calling
objective: get a glimpse of Boethiah
first_tasks: gain someone's trust, lead him to the shrine above, instruct him to touch the pillar of sacrifice to trap him, and kill him with the ceremonial blade

reward.description: Boethiah will appear before the player

characters.name: Boethiah
characters.description: the lady of plots and the dark warrior, an evil goddess

tools: NONE
description:
We are forged by Boethiah's example. We carve our will upon the world through our tongues and our blades. You? You are nothing. An empty vapor, dispersed by the slightest breeze.
If you desire a glimpse of Boethiah, our Dark Mistress, then this is what you must do. First, prove your tongue can wield a lie. Find someone. Gain his trust. Lead him to the shrine above. Next, instruct your thrall to touch the Pillar of Sacrifice. Its magic will ensnare him, rendering him helpless. Then, girded with certitude, plant the ceremonial blade deeply, so that the waters of his heart wash over you.
If your will is strong enough, it will stir Boethiah in her Dark Mansion, and she will appear before us.

name: The Words of Power
objective: find a lost word of power
first_tasks: get to the location marked on your map

first_task_locations.name: Skyrim
first_task_locations.description: a province with many words of power

reward.description: the player learns a new word of power

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: a mortal blessed with the blood and soul of a dragon, masters of the Thu'um

tools: the player is the Dragonborn
description:
You have learned so much already, Dragonborn. Growing your gift too quickly would be dangerous.
But there are many Words of Power in Skyrim, carved in the Dragon tongue. Even from here, we can feel the Thu'um resonate from them. Finding these lost Words would be a sufficient test, to temper your abilities with experience.
We have felt the whisper of a Word. Give me your map, and I will show you where its echo can be found.

name: Mine or Yours
objective: help Filnjar by clearing out spiders from the Redbelly Mine
first_tasks: kill the spiders

characters.name: Grogmar
characters.description: a male miner

tools: the spiders of Redbelly Mine almost killed Grogmar and Filnjar
description:
Sorry, the Redbelly Mine's dry right now. What's wrong with the mine, you might ask. It's full of spiders, that's what's wrong with it!
Almost killed Grogmar and me when they showed up. I'm worried that they'll come out of the mine looking for food soon... then we're in even bigger trouble.
You'd  clear them out for us? Tell you what. Keep to your word, and I'll line your pockets with as much as I can scrape up.

name: Alduin's Wall
objective: locate Alduin's Wall in Sky Haven Temple
first_tasks: find the entrance to Sky Haven Temple with Esbern

reward.description: Alduin's Wall tells the player how to stop Alduin and avert the end of the world

characters.name: Alduin
characters.description: an evil dragon

characters.name: Dragonborn
characters.description: a person who can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world

locations.name: Sky Haven Temple
locations.description: an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach

tools: the player is the Dragonborn
description:
Only a Dragonborn can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world!
But... I don't yet know how you can stop him. But Alduin's Wall does. I hope. It's in Sky Haven Temple, an ancient Blades sanctuary, hidden deep in the crags of the Reach.
Ah, yes. The entrance to Sky Haven Temple seems to be near what's now known as the Karthspire. We'll have to see what we find when we arrive there.
We should be careful. There's no telling what traps and wards the ancient Blades may have set.

name: Lights Out!
objective: help run the Icerunner aground
first_tasks: put out the lighthouse fire
meet Jaree-Ra

characters.name: Deeja
characters.description: Jaree-Ra's sister, a female treasure hunter

tools: Jaree-Ra and Deeja collect things nobody misses
with the war, many more ships come through Solitude Docks loaded with weapons and pay, but few people
description:
It's easy to find things to sell. Things nobody will miss. Things from underground, or just left lying around in someone's house. I bet the two of us, we're very alike. So why not take the next step? We can help each other.
My sister Deeja and I are treasure hunters. You could be too. We like to collect things. We are not thieves. We just take what will not be missed. What no one needs anymore. Maybe we take some weapons and stop a few deaths. Who would call that thievery?
With the war, many more ships come through these docks. Loaded with weapons and pay, but few people. And they pass through dangerous waters. We have an interest in one of those boats, the Icerunner. The Solitude Lighthouse will be guiding it in... but if its fire were to go out, the Icerunner would run aground.
If someone were to put out the lighthouse fire and then meet me on the docks afterwards... I could certainly direct them to that loot. That someone could be you.

name: No News Is Good News
objective: find out information about Fura from Captain Aldis
first_tasks: talk to Captain Aldis

characters.name: Fura
characters.description: Angeline Morrard's daughter

characters.name: Captain Aldis
characters.description: a male officer of the Imperial army

tools: Fura was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial army
description:
You're a traveler, correct? Have you been to Whiterun?
My daughter, Fura, was assigned to Whiterun after she joined the Imperial Army. I was hoping you might have met her. I haven't heard from her lately. I've tried talking to Captain Aldis but he hasn't been any help.
It would be very sweet of you to get more information about my daughter. Anything you can find out from Captain Aldis would be welcome news.

name: Prophet of the Night
objective: locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon
first_tasks: speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers and travelers about the rumors of a Moth Priest in Skyrim

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

characters.name: Moth Priest
characters.description: a priest who has dedicated his whole life to reading and deciphering Elder Scrolls

tools: Lord Harkon is giving a speech to the player and their fellow vampires: the player and the other vampires will dominate over the sun itself, and forge a realm of eternal darkness
Lord Harkon has reclaimed one of his Elder Scrolls and needs a Moth Priest to read it
description:
Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit.
Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!

name: An Ill Meeting
objective: make incense with Kesh the Clean
first_tasks: gather a deathbell flower, one silver ingot, a flawless ruby, and some vampire dust for making the incense

reward.description: the player will be able to speak with Peryite

characters.name: Peryite
characters.description: the god of infection and pestilence

tools: the player asked Kesh the Clean about speaking with Peryite
deathbell grow in the frozen tundra
the player might find the ruby and silver in a mine
vampire dust comes from vampires
description:
Not everyone has the stomach required to entreat my Lord. He is the pus in the wound. Oh, proper ones curl their noses, but it's pus that drinks foul humors and restores the blood. But Kesh likes you, friend.

How to gather the ingredients? This one would try a shop. You might prefer the direct route, hm? Deathbell grow in the frozen tundra. You might nip into a mine for the ruby and silver. Vampire Dust is tricky. Vampires, you know.

quest_giver.description: a historian, giving quest via "Daynas Valen's Notes"

reward.description: a powerful amulet that belonged to Archmage Gauldur

characters.description: a man revered throughout the north for his wisdom, wealth, honor, and power, who lived during the first era

characters.description: a tough male wizard

tools: the Gauldur name wiped out from the annals of history
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis lusted after Archmage Gauldur's power and prestige: they discovered Archmage Gauldur's source of power, the Gauldur Amulet
Archmage Gauldur was murdered by his sons Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis: they split the Gauldur Amulet between them
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis laid waste to surrounding villages: the high king sent Archmage Geirmund and his battlemages after Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis
description:
Daynas Valen's Notes
by Daynas Valen

How to summarize a lifetime of research? So little of what I have learned matters now - the petty politics of ancient times, the age-long campaign to wipe out all mention of the Gauldur name.
In the opening days of the First Era, the Archmage Gauldur was revered throughout the north. Wisdom, wealth, honor, and power were his, and even the legendary heros' heirs sought his counsel.
Smothered by his shadow, Gauldur's three sons grew cruel and resentful. They lusted after their father's power and prestige, and eventually Jyrik, the eldest, discovered its source: a mysterious amulet, from which he never parted. Together, they conspired to murder their father in his sleep and divide his amulet between them. And so it was done.
Consumed by their newfound power, the brothers laid waste to the surrounding villages. So great was the carnage that the High King himself intervened, sending a company of battlemages led by the Archmage Geirmund to subdue the brothers. And after a devastating battle, the three fled the field.
Mikrul, the youngest, was run to ground in Folgunthur, the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude. Geirmund pursued Jyrik to the shattered crypts of Saarthal, half-buried even then. And at last, Sigdis was cornered in the southernmost reaches of land and later entombed in Geirmund's Hall.

first_tasks: talk to Roggi

characters.name: Roggi

Roggi has been in Kynesgrove forever. Great storyteller. Keeps everyone's spirits up. Owes me a lot of coin for drinks. I keep telling him not to worry about it, but he's got the stubborn Nord blood.
Damn fool doesn't have the coin to pay me back, so he just beats himself up over it, and then he gets thirsty, and it cycles all over again. If you could convince him that I don't care about his tab, it'd certainly make me feel better.
Roggi pawned a few of his things back when he still had things to pawn. Take them as your reward.

My parents live there. I usually make the journey to bring them gifts and to just say hello, but I haven't been well lately.
I've written some letters and placed them in a satchel. Perhaps you wouldn't mind delivering it to them on my behalf? I would insist on rewarding you for your time.
Here, take my satchel and give it to my father, Verner. He'll likely have something for you to bring back.

name: Delayed Burial

description:
Poor Cicero is stuck. Can't you see? I was transporting my dear, sweet mother. Well, not her. Her corpse! She's quite dead. I'm taking mother to a new home. A new crypt. But... aggh! Wagon wheel! Damnedest wagon wheel! It broke! Don't you see?
Oh. Oh yes! Yes, the kindly stranger can certainly help! Go to the farm - the Loreius Farm. Just over there, off the road. Talk to Loreius. He has tools! He can help me! But he won't! He refuses! Convince Loreius to fix my wheel! Do that, and poor Cicero will reward you. With coin! Gleamy, shiny coin!

name: Rjorn's Drum
objective: retrieve the Rjorn' drum for  Giraud Gemane
first_tasks: find the drum

quest_giver.name: Giraud Gemane
quest_giver.description: a bard of the Bards College, and a former soldier

characters.name: Halldir
characters.description: a long-dead male ruler

description:
They found it! They actually found Rjorn's drum!
You don't know who Rjorn is? You're joking, right? Rjorn? Only the most famous battle drummer of the second age. Well, famous among bards at least. That drum has been in half a dozen famous battles. It's a priceless artifact.
Nobody knows where he died, and therefore where his drum might be. Halldir was the missing link. Rjorn was always looking for new stories to tell. It seems he was writing a lay about Halldir when he vanished. Rjorn entered Halldir's Cairn in secret, and presumably died there.
Now all I need to do is find someone to get it. Wait. You. You could do it. I need you to get me that drum. The college treasury is a bit thin right now. But I can show you some tricks I learned from my days with the army.

first_tasks: speak to Filnjar to get the ore sample

characters.description: an absent-minded male alchemist who runs an alchemy shop

characters.name: Filnjar
characters.description: a male miner

In fact, I need to arrange for someone to pick up an ore sample for me in Shor's Stone... goodness knows Elgrim won't lift a finger to do it.
You would do this for me? Oh, that would be wonderful. Speak to Filnjar in Shor's Stone. He's got some sort of ore sample he wants us to identify and was willing to pay us well for it.
The job pays well, so I hope I can make arrangements soon. We could really use the gold. I'll have Elgrim make some potions for you for all that travel.

The Nightgate and Candlehearth inns are frequent stops for Stormcloak runners. See if you can't "convince" one of those innkeepers to help you. One way or another, get me those documents.
Show the rebels the futility of their cause.

Perhaps the College of Winterhold. What learning there is in Skyrim is gathered there. One of the mages there may be able to put you on the trail of this Elder Scroll.
This Elder Scroll might be able to show you the past in some way, and let you learn the Dragonrend shout.

first_tasks: find the Fine-Cut Void Salts
tools: Captain Wayfinder's mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house
Captain Wayfinder's sailors lost their last trade, Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold, after getting drunk
description:
I am a sea captain by inheritance, as my men are fond of saying. Can't blame them, my mother ran the Sea Squall as strictly as she ran the house.
I've been trying to find new areas of business, trying to win the sailors' respect, but I keep having problems. Take the last trade we did. Some Fine-Cut Void Salts from the College of Winterhold. Plenty of coin if you know who to sell it to.
What happened to the Salts? Sailors are what happened to them. They got drunk and ended up losing the merchandise in some cave. If you're not afraid of little exploring, I'll pay good gold to get those Salts.

name: Lost to the Ages
objective: search for the Aetherium Forge with Katria
first_tasks: find Katria's journal, which contains her notes about the Aetherium Forge

items.name: "The Aetherium Wars"
items.description: a book written by Katria's male apprentice, contains Katria's research on the Aetherium Forge

tools: the player read "The Aetherium Wars"
description:
The name's Katria. I am - was - an adventurer. Raided ruins like this for nigh on twenty years. I was on the trail of something big. It led me here, and... I didn't make it.
Oh. You read the book, didn't you? "The Aetherium Wars"? It was my theory, you know. My research. My life's work. All of it, lost! Stolen by my own damn apprentice! That's how I ended up here. I can't rest. Not until I find the Aetherium Forge, until I can prove that it was my discovery. Mine, not his!
Hmm... well, you can pick up where I left off. My notes should still be in my journal, if you can read it. We still have to find the Forge itself. I had a lead on that, too.

name: Spread the Love
objective: distribute all religious missives to the citizens of Riften
first_tasks: speak to the citizens

characters.name: Mara
characters.description: the goddess of love

tools: keep away from the keep and the city guards: they won't accept the missives
description:
Riften is drowning in a sea of sin and wickedness and it's my personal mission to let everyone know that the warmth of Mara can see them through.
All I need is a messenger to bring Her words to these poor souls by distributing these missives. Lady Mara would be so pleased, if you could distribute the missives! Let me give you the missives. Here you are. Now make sure you give out every single one, we can't afford to let even one lost soul stray from Her warmth.
Almost anyone in Riften is in dire need of those missives. Speak to them, child. You will know who will listen and who will sin. A word of advice, keep away from the Keep and the city guards. They follow their own path and have already forsaken Her.
Allow me to give you Mara's gift as a reward... a true blessing to aid you in times of need. Despair not, her warmth will protect you always!

name: The Taste of Death
objective: find your place as a follower of Namira
first_tasks: meet Eola and fight your way through the undead with her

characters.name: Namira, Lady of Decay
characters.description: the goddess of cannibals

tools: Eola assumes that the player is a cannibal
Eola has been eating the dead people of Markarth
description:
You were young when you first tasted human flesh, weren't you? A brother or sister had died? An accident, of course.
Then the hunger set in. Curiosity. What's the harm in just one bite? It's okay, now. You've found a friend who understands you. You can let go of your guilt.
A lot of our kind block out the memory of their first meal. The shame is too much. But you don't need to hide anymore. Namira, the Lady of Decay, accepts you for what you are.
She has a place for us, where we can sate our appetites without judgment. It's inside Reachcliff Cave. But the dead have stirred from their slumber recently, and I was forced here. Meet me there. We will fight our way to Namira's embrace together.
Until then, tell the people of Markarth that their dead won't be disturbed, anymore. We have bigger plans ahead.

characters.description: a immensely powerful male mage in the first era

description:
Have you ever heard of Shalidor? Immensely powerful mage, back in the First Era. Had an understanding of magic few have ever matched. He holed himself up in Labyrinthian, and devoted all of his time to research and study. Wrote more than you would imagine possible.
Since then, his writings have been scattered all over Skyrim, but are little use to anyone who can't translate them. I'm one of the few who can. I'm always trying to find more of Shalidor's writings.
I've heard whispers of more of his work having turned up. If you can track it down, it may prove useful to all of us.

I'm on the verge of incredible wealth, but my cowardly work force ran at the first sign of danger. We were excavating this old tomb when we opened a chamber full of corpses. The team took one look, turned tail, and ran.
Legend says this tomb holds a treasure that bestows great power on the one who discovers it. Beyond that, not much more is known. Obviously, this treasure will fetch a good deal of gold, and I'm willing to let you share in the reward when we find it.
I'll tell you what. You help me get the treasure and I'll split it with you. First, I need you to clear the main chamber of those restless dead. I'll stay here until you're finished, planning our next move.
With my brains and your brawn, that treasure will soon be mine... uh, ours.

A little Wheat and Blisterwort makes a healing potion, if you didn't know. There's plenty of ingredients for sale, too.

The rings increase the abilities of your vampiric powers. Some say Molag Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
You'll be able to keep the rings. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.

Please, snatch the bottle for me. I'll be waiting for it. Then, let me show you a thing or two about not attracting attention to yourself.

Hmm.... We have something of a vampire problem. Bodies have been found with blood drained. I know of a den nearby you can wipe out as a precaution. Pinemoon Cave. I don't expect you to be capable of even that. Vampires are clever hunters. More clever than you, definitely.
I suppose I could show you a little about Illusion magic for free, couldn't I?

Someone's got to head out there and take care of the beasts. Get it taken care of right away. Nobody wants a hungry animal left roaming along the roads.

Take an enchanted weapon or piece of armor, then use the Arcane Enchanter to learn its secrets. The item is destroyed in the process, so be wary. Once you know an enchantment, you'll need a filled soul gem, and something to enchant. You'll use the Arcane Enchanter for that, too.
Of course I have everything you need for sale, if you have the coin.

name: Caught Red Handed
objective: help Svana Far-Shield embarrass Haelga

characters.name: Haelga

characters.description: the goddess of love and passion

characters.name: Bolli, Hofgrir, Indaryn
characters.description: the three men Haelga slept with

items.name: Mark of Dibella, Marks of Dibella

tools: when Haelga sleeps with a man, Haelga gives the man a Mark of Dibella
description:
I hate Haelga! It's everything about her. She's disgusting. I think she takes her worship of Dibella a bit too seriously.
Do you know she's slept with three different men in the last month alone? What kind of a woman would do such a thing? Just for once, I'd like to see her squirm... to rub her nose in it.
Actually, there is a way to do this, but I don't think I could get away with doing it. She'd kill me if she found out. You see, I happen to know after she makes love, she gives her partner a token of her affection called a Mark of Dibella. If you confront her with three of the Marks of Dibella, she'd be so embarrassed... well, I don't know what she'd do!
Oh, this is going to be great! You need to get the Marks of Dibella from Bolli, Hofgrir and Indaryn. Not sure how you're going to do that, but try your best. Then just confront Haelga with them and the rest works itself out.

name: Song of the Alchemists

first_tasks: find "Song of the Alchemists"

reward.description: Lami teaches the player things about herbs

tools: NONE
description:
I'm Lami, an alchemist. I picked up the alchemy trade when I was a girl. One of the temple healers staying here on a pilgrimage showed me the basics.
She had a book with her, "Song of the Alchemists", that I used to read over and over. I miss having a copy.
Could you find that book for me? I'd be happy to show you a bit about herbs if you find the book.

name: Keeping Up the Appearances

Pinch that staff for me. I'll be waiting for it. Once I have it, I'll show you a few tricks I've learned about buttering up royalty.

name: Striking the Heart

Assassinate their leader and the rest should go hiding. Run fast, my friend.

I can't help but notice that you're doing quite well for yourself, rising through the ranks and all.

Just... Just bring me some Dwemer Cogs. I need to examine them for the methods used in forging them. Ten of them should be enough for me to get a better understanding of how they were crafted. That's all I need, all right?

first_tasks: deliver a purchase agreement to Kleppr

characters.name: Kleppr

I'm Bolli, a fisherman.
I sell my catch across a good portion of Skyrim... it's worth its weight in gold to me. The only untapped market left is Markarth. However, I just got word that Kleppr at The Silver Blood Inn might be interested.
If you're headed that way, I would appreciate you delivering a purchase agreement for me. You'd be paid, of course. Kleppr will pay you as soon as you arrive with the letter. Here you are.

name: In My Time of Need
objective: help Alik'r Warriors locate Saadia
first_tasks: find Saadia
bring information about Saadia to the Alik'r Warriors

reward.description: Alik'r Warriors will pay good money for information

characters.name: Saadia
characters.description: a Redguard woman, a fugitive from Hammerfell

tools: NONE
description:
You there. We are looking for someone in Whiterun, and will pay good money for information.
We're looking for a fugitive who comes from Hammerfell. A woman -- a foreigner in these lands. Redguard, like us. She is likely not using her true name. She may be somewhere in this city. We will pay for any information regarding her location. We are not welcome here in Whiterun, so we will be in Rorikstead if you learn anything.
Our reasons are none of your concern. All you need to know is that we're paying for information. If that doesn't interest you, feel free to walk away.

name: March of the Dead
objective: stop the ash spawn attacks on Raven Rock
first_tasks: search for clues about where the ash spawn come from

quest_giver.name: Captain Veleth
quest_giver.description: the commander of the Redoran Guard

locations.name: Raven Rock
locations.description: a town ruled by the Redoran

the ash spawn have been coming from this direction to Raven Rock

Thanks... I wasn't sure I'd make it off this farm alive. I wish I could have said the same for my man here.
Some of the Redoran Guard have taken to calling them "ash spawn". Me? I don't care what they're called... all I know is they're a danger to Raven Rock and they need to be stopped.
I was going to search for clues that might lead me to wherever they're coming from. I know it isn't the best place to start, but we know they've been coming from this direction.
Could you lend me a hand? We were searching the farm when the ash spawn ambushed us. Have a look around and see if you can turn up anything useful.

name: Paid in Full
objective: recover the bonemold formula for Glover Mallory
first_tasks: find the bonemold formula

quest_giver.name: Glover Mallory
quest_giver.description: a Breton man, and a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

characters.name: Esmond Tyne
characters.description: a Breton man

tools: Esmond Tyne stole Glover Mallory's bonemold formula
Esmond Tyne talked about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag
description:
Eager to make some coin, eh? That's the spirit. I'll tell you what. The Guild's got a problem out here that I've been trying to deal with for years, but haven't been able to handle.
A fellow Breton who went by the name Esmond Tyne showed up on my doorstep about a fortnight ago. He stole something from me: my own formula for improved bonemold. Took me years to perfect.
Before he ran off, he was talking some nonsense about trying to fence goods to the Rieklings at Castle Karstaag. I told him he was crazy to even think about talking to those vicious little buggers, but he wouldn't listen. I'd bet a fat purse of coin that he's either dead or hiding out up there.

name: Bloodline
objective: become a vampire, or be banished from Castle Volkihar
first_tasks: decide whether you want to become a vampire or remain mortal

reward.description: the player becomes a vampire, or Harkon spares the player's mortal life this time

tools: the player is meeting Harkon for the first time: Harkon and his family are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim
the player returned Harkon's daughter and her Elder Scroll to him
description:
I am Harkon, lord of this court. By now, my daughter will have told you what we are. We are among the oldest and most powerful vampires in Skyrim.
You have done me a great service, and now you must be rewarded. There is but one gift I can give that is equal in value to the Elder Scroll and my daughter.
I offer you my blood. Take it, and you will walk as a lion among sheep. Men will tremble at your approach, and you will never fear death again.
However, if you refuse my gift you will be prey, like all mortals. I will spare your life this once, but you will be banished from this hall.
I await your decision.

name: Revealing the Unseen
objective: learn the location of the Staff of Magnus
first_tasks: find the members of the Synod
tools: the Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim: the Synod will not be cooperative
description:
The Synod seemed convinced the Staff of Magnus was somewhere in Skyrim. They inquired about the ruins of Mzulft, but that's all I remember.
It sounded like they were heading there, though they were rather secretive about why. I suppose if you're intent on looking for the staff, there's a chance they might be in Mzulft yet. Just don't expect them to be cooperative.

name: The Way of the Voice
objective: answer the summons of the Greybeards
first_tasks: reach High Hrothgar

first_task_locations.description: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World

reward.description: the Greybeards can teach the player how to use their gift

groups.name: Greybeards
groups.description: masters of the way of the voice

locations.name: High Hrothgar
locations.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards

tools: the player killed a dragon for Balgruuf the Greater and absorbed some kind of power from it
the Greybeards think that the player is a Dragonborn: a Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the voice - the ability to focus the player's vital essence into a Thu'um, or shout
description:
So when the dragon died, you absorbed some kind of power from it. So it's true. The Greybeards really were summoning you. They are masters of the Way of the Voice. They live in seclusion high on the slopes of the Throat of the World.
Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it. If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue?
The Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the Voice - the ability to focus your vital essence into a Thu'um, or Shout. If you really are Dragonborn, they can teach you how to use your gift.
You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor.

name: The Mind of Madness
objective: gain access to the Pelagius Wing, and find Dervenin's master
first_tasks: talk to Una or Erdi about entering the Pelagius Wing

first_task_locations.name: Blue Palace
first_task_locations.description: the large palace of the local ruler

quest_giver.name: Dervenin
quest_giver.description: a man who has been abandoned by his master

reward.description: Dervenin's master will repay the player: it will be worth any inconveniences

characters.name: Una
characters.description: a maid

characters.name: Erdi
characters.description: a maid

locations.name: Pelagius Wing
locations.description: a forbidden wing of the Blue Palace

tools: Dervenin's master says that Dervenin is interrupting his vacation
without Dervenin's master's guidance, Dervenin's homeland is falling apart
Dervenin's master went into the Pelagius Wing to talk with an old friend
Dervenin gives the player a hip bone: the player can't enter Pelagius Wing without it
description:
My master has abandoned me! Abandoned his people. And nothing I say can change his mind. Now he refuses to even see me. He says I interrupt his vacation! It's been so many years... Won't you please help?
Without his guidance, our homeland is falling apart. North wages war against the south! We need his return. Oh, but... I'm sure he'll repay you when he comes to his senses! His favor is a powerful, powerful thing. And so very worth any... inconveniences.
Last I saw him, he was visiting a friend in the Blue Palace. But no one as mundane as the local ruler. No, no... such people are below him. No, he went into the forbidden wing of the palace, to speak with an old friend. Said it had been ages since they had last had tea. Oh and you'll need the hip bone... it's very important. No entering Pelagius Wing without that.
The doors to the Pelagius Wing are locked. But I hear the maids, Una and Erdi, know how to enter it for cleaning. Surely they can help for such an important matter?

name: No One Escapes Cidhna Mine
objective: discover how widespread the injustice of Markarth is
first_tasks: talk to Braig: tell him that Madanach sent you, and ask him why he is in Cidhna Mine

quest_giver.name: Madanach
quest_giver.description: a Forsworn man, and a prisoner who tried to have the player killed in the past

reward.description: Madanach will help the player escape

characters.name: Braig
characters.description: a man who has been in Cidhna Mine the longest beside Madanach

groups.name: Forsworn
groups.description: an organization that opposes the current rulers of Markarth

tools: the player has been imprisoned in Cidhna Mine without any reason
description:
Well, well. Look at you. The authorities of Markarth have turned you into an animal. A wild beast caged up and left to go mad.
So, my fellow beast, what do you want? Answers about the Forsworn? Revenge for trying to have you killed? You're one of us now, you see? A slave. The boot of the false, unjust law stepping on your throat. Maybe if you understood that, I could help you.
There's a man named Braig inside these mines. Besides me, he's been here the longest. Tell him I sent you. Ask him why he's here. I want you to know how widespread the injustice of Markarth is. Then, we might discuss about an early pardon.

name: Amulet of the Moon
objective: bring Kharjo's Moon Amulet back to him
first_tasks: find Kharjo's Moon Amulet

quest_giver.name: Kharjo
quest_giver.description: a caravaner from a warm land

tools: NONE
description:
A few days ago, our caravan was ambushed. A nuisance, really, but many of the marauders had quick fingers.
One of them stole my Moon Amulet, given to me by my mother when I was just a cub. It is my only memory of home in this cold land.
You offer to get my amulet back? We believe the bandits are a part of a group headquartered in Faldar's Tooth. Be careful. I miss my amulet, but a life cannot be replaced as easily.

name: Helping Hand
objective: help Wujeeta cure her Skooma addiction
first_tasks: give Wujeeta a healing potion

quest_giver.name: Wujeeta
quest_giver.description: a worker at the Riften Fishery, and a Skooma addict

characters.name: Bolli
characters.description: the man who owns the Riften Fishery

tools: Bolli will fire Wujeeta if she shows up for work under the influence of Skooma
description:
My job at the Riften Fishery is in danger. The owner, Bolli, said that if I show up for work in this condition one more time, then I'm out.
I don't mean to do this to myself, but I can't help it. I tried some Skooma a year ago, and ever since then, I can't stop! If you could give me a healing potion, I could cleanse this poison from my body and get back to my life.

name: Ice Cold
objective: bring five ice wraith teeth to Marise Aravel
first_tasks: find five ice wraith teeth
tools: the player asked Marise Aravel how she keeps the food she sells so fresh
description:
I picked up a trick from a master butcher. He showed me a way to grind up ice wraith teeth and use it as a preservative. Keeps everything cold and fresh, but only for a limited time.
I'm always looking to replenish my supply, so if you ever come across five of them, I'd be more than happy to take them off your hands. The last traveler that traded me some said he found them at a place called Ancient's Ascent.
Careful though, rumor has it a dragon makes its home there.

name: Fit for a Jarl
objective: promote the Radiant Raiment to Jarl Elisif
first_tasks: wear one of the Radiant Raiment's outfits, and speak to Elisif about it

reward.description: the player gets to keep the Radiant Raiment outfit, and Taarie pays the player

characters.name: Elisif
characters.description: the female Jarl of Solitude

tools: the player told Taarie that the player is going to the Blue Palace
description:
You're really going to the Blue Palace? That presents an opportunity.
If you were willing to wear one of Radiant Raiment's outfits and speak to the Jarl I would not only pay you but let you keep the outfit.
Here's the outfit. Try to get Jarl Elisif's opinion on it and if she likes it mention it's from Radiant Raiment.

name: Filial Bonds
objective: find Torkild
first_tasks: see if Torkild is with the werebears of the glacier

quest_giver.name: Wulf Wild-Blood
quest_giver.description: a hunter, and a worried brother

characters.name: Torkild
characters.description: Wulf Wild-Blood's brother, a wild man and a fearsome warrior

tools: Torkild may have become a werebear: a bear-like cursed creature
description:
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Torkild had a wild gleam in his eye, more than most. In my darkest times, I fear he fell in among the werebears of the glacier.
Werebears are twisted, cursed beasts. True bears are noble and great creatures of the wild. I've heard tell of men who, by curse or by heart's desire, become transformed into one of those vile things. It is a pitiable fate. And one that I fear has fallen to my brother.
If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.

name: Whispers in the Dark
objective: spy on Cicero and the person he is talking with
first_tasks: hide inside the Night Mother's coffin to eavesdrop on the meeting between Cicero and a mystery person

first_task_locations.description: Night Mother's Chamber in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's leader in the Dark Brotherhood

characters.name: Cicero
characters.description: an insane male member of the Dark Brotherhood, and the Night Mother's Keeper

characters.name: Night Mother
characters.description: the corpse of the spiritual female leader of the Dark Brotherhood

tools: Cicero has been concerning Astrid ever since he arrived at the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary: Astrid thinks that Cicero is plotting to overtake the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary and restore the Old Ways
description:
Cicero concerns me. Ever since he arrived, his behavior's been... Well, erratic would be an understatement. I do believe he is truly mad. But it's worse than that.
Cicero's taken to locking himself in the Night Mother's chamber, and talking. To someone. In hushed, but frantic tones. Who is he speaking with? What are they planning? I fear treachery. As the Night Mother's Keeper, he believes he's entitled to the rule of this Sanctuary. Cicero will cite our independence as the need to revert to the Old Ways. He'll claim we're undisciplined, unruly. Heretical, even. Ironically, the Night Mother could prove to be just as much a victim. The queen in a fool's twisted game of chess.
I need you to steal into that chamber, and eavesdrop on their meeting. It'll be no use clinging to the shadows. They'll see you for sure. No, you need a hiding place. Somewhere they'd never think to look. Like inside the Night Mother's coffin.

name: Kill the Bandits
objective: slay bandits for Siddgeir
first_tasks: find all bandits, and kill them

quest_giver.name: Siddgeir
quest_giver.description: a corrupt nobleman who rules over Falkreath

tools: the player has proven themselves to Siddgeir
description:
You've proven reliable. There's a group of bandits in my hold that I... may have had a few discreet dealings with.
The cut they were giving me was good at first, but now it's time to clean things up. Go to Embershard Mine and take care of them. Teach them to stop paying me. Execute every last bandit. Spare no one.

name: Bolstering the Ranks
objective: find Florentius and recruit him into the Dawnguard
first_tasks: ask Isran whether he knows where Florentius is

quest_giver.name: Sorine Jurard
quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Dawnguard

tools: Gunmar and Sorine Jurard think that the Dawnguard are going to need Florentius to help against the vampires
Florentius had regular contact with the Vigilants: Isran has kept track of the Vigilants
description:
These vampires are a new threat, and a truly deadly one. Gunmar and I agree that we're going to need Florentius to help.
Gunmar and I have a lot of work to do here, so we were hoping that maybe you could track him down. He's a priest of Arkay. Well, he was. It's... it's complicated. Florentius's a little eccentric, but we can trust him and we could definitely use his skills.
Here's the thing. We don't know where Florentius is. Haven't seen him in years. I think he had regular contact with the Vigilants, and I know Isran kept track of them... So maybe you could ask Isran if he knows anything?
Just keep in mind that Isran... well, he might not like the idea. The two of them just never got along.

name: A Blade in the Dark
objective: help Delphine stop dragons from coming back to life
first_tasks: go to an ancient dragon burial with Delphine, and kill a dragon

reward.description: Delphine will tell the player everything she knows

tools: the Blades killed the dragons off centuries ago
description:
Dragons aren't just coming back, they're coming back to life. They weren't gone somewhere for all these years. They were dead, killed off centuries ago by my predecessors. Now something's happening to bring them back to life. And I need you to help me stop it.
I've visited their ancient burial mounds and found them empty. And I've figured out where the next one will come back to life. We're going to go there, and you're going to kill that dragon. If we succeed, I'll tell you anything you want to know.
We are going to Kynesgrove. There's an ancient dragon burial near there. If we can get there before the dragon comes back, maybe we'll learn how to stop it.

name: To Kill an Empire
objective: assassinate Titus Mede II while disguised as the Gourmet
first_tasks: present the Gourmet's writ of passage to Commander Maro to gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and poison Titus Mede II's meal with Jarrin Root

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the leader of the Dark Brotherhood

items.name: Jarrin Root
items.description: a powerful poison that kills immediately after one bite

characters.name: Gourmet
characters.description: a famous male chef

characters.name: Commander Maro
characters.description: the male officer in charge of Titus Mede II's security

characters.name: Titus Mede II
characters.description: the Emperor

tools: the player killed the Gourmet for Astrid: the player is the Listener of the Dark Brotherhood
Astrid gives the player Jarrin Root
after assassination, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge: Astrid has "arranged" for it to be unguarded
description:
So it's done. You've killed the Gourmet. And now Titus Mede II is as good as dead.
I've decided you will have the honor of killing the Emperor. Go now to Castle Dour in Solitude. Present the Gourmet's Writ of Passage to the officer in charge, Commander Maro.
You'll gain unrestricted access to the kitchens, and then the Emperor. You're posing as a chef, so you'll be able to poison his meal rather easily. Here, take this - it's called jarrin root. All it takes is one taste, and the effects are quite immediate. The Emperor will be serving Sithis before he even knows he's dead. Once Mede has been killed, escape through the upper door, and across the bridge. I've "arranged" for it to be unguarded once the alarm is sounded.
Now go, my friend. Go, and fulfill your destiny as Listener.

name: Kill the Giant
objective: slay a giant
first_tasks: find a giant

quest_giver.name: Skald the Elder
quest_giver.description: the nobleman who rules over the Pale

locations.name: Dawnstar
locations.description: the capital city of the Pale

tools: the Empire demanded Skald the Elder to leave giants be, but the Imperial authority does not apply here anymore
description:
Giants are a common problem in the Pale. The Empire always demanded I leave them be, but the Empire isn't here now.
Go and slay one of the beasts. It should let them know that Dawnstar is not to be trifled with. I'm counting on you.

name: A Tragedy at Frostflow
objective: uncover the tragic events inside Frostflow Lighthouse
first_tasks: investigate the cellar

first_task_locations.name: Frostflow Lighthouse
first_task_locations.description: an old lighthouse on an icy coast

quest_giver.name: Habd
quest_giver.description: a retired sailor, giving quest via "Habd's Journal"

characters.name: Ramati
characters.description: Habd's wife, a former sailor

characters.name: Sudi
characters.description: a woman, Ramati and Habd's daughter

characters.name: Mani
characters.description: a man, Ramati and Habd's son

tools: Habd and Ramati sailed for years from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back: Habd and Ramati bought Frostflow Lighthouse to settle down with Mani and Sudi
things went missing from the cellar and strange noises came from there as well

Habd went away from Frostflow Lighthouse to buy some traps: after returning home, he found out that Ramati was killed by a bug-like creature; Habd killed the creature and went into the cellar to save his family, locking the door behind him
description:
Habd's Journal
by Habd

After years of sailing from Hammerfell to Solstheim and back, Ramati and I have finally saved enough money to buy that old light house we spotted on the coast and we are moving in next month.
These northerners really know how to live. It may be cold, but you can't beat the tranquility of the watching icebergs to live out your silver years. Ramati loves the place too, despite the occasional leaky ceiling. Mani and Sudi, unfortunately, seem miserable here; I know the kids are old enough to strike out on their own, but I hope they'll grow to love the peace and quiet here as I have.
Mani and Sudi continue to bicker and harass each other and they seem to have started in on their mother as well. Ramati keeps finding things missing from the cellar. Sudi said she heard a noise down there but Mani just thinks their mother is going mad from isolation. The very thought of it is ridiculous, she's always wanted to retire here!
Sudi keeps saying that she hears scratching coming from the cellar at night. I think she's just trying to get her mother's goat, but I'd better head into town to get a few traps just in case it's rats. Should only take a couple days. I just hope those two go easy on Ramati while I'm gone.
Oh gods. Oh gods why? I returned home to find my beautiful Ramati killed and this thing, this horrible bug-like creature ransacking our home. I managed to kill the damned thing, I think it might be a demon! I've never seen anything like it! Oh gods poor Ramati. It must have come out of the cellar. I'm going down there and locking the door behind me to make sure they don't escape. I don't know if I'll make it out, but I have to save my family!

name: Locate the Assassin of Old
objective: go on an adventure
first_tasks: find the final resting place of the assassin of old

first_task_locations.name: Hag's End
first_task_locations.description: a ruin far to the northeast of Deepwood Redoubt

reward.description: the earthly possessions of the assassin of old

tools: the player came to Olava the Feeble for a reading
description:
Come to Olava for a reading, did you? Hmph. Yes. Yes, I surely can give you a reading.
It's not something I do lightly, mind you, and it's not as specific as you might want. But yes. I will do this for you. Please, relax. Free your mind. Yes, that's it...
A potential for adventure, and wealth. It is a ruin, ripe for the plunder. Deepwood Redoubt. Far to the northwest... Through there is... Hag's End. The last resting place of an assassin of old. A dark brother, who bequeaths his ancient earthly possessions... to you.
No... no, that is all. Now... now please. I find myself very weary all of sudden.

name: Undead to Plain Dead
objective: assassinate Hern
first_tasks: find Hern

first_task_locations.name: Half-Moon Mill
first_task_locations.description: a mill ran by Hern and Hert

characters.name: Hern
characters.description: a male vampire who has blended into the human society

characters.name: Hert
characters.description: a female vampire, Hern's companion

tools: Hert is always near Hern
description:
You are going to assassinate Hern. He's a vampire, and has blended into human society for years. He's never far from his female companion, Hert. Also a vampire.
The contract is for the male, Hern. But you'll probably have to contend with the female, too. They both live in Half-Moon Mill. So for Sithis' sake, watch yourself.
Face a vampire, and live to tell the tale!

name: Repentance
objective: help Illia prevent her mother from transforming into a Hagraven
first_tasks: follow Illia to the top of the tower

first_task_locations.name: Darklight Tower
first_task_locations.description: a tower filled with witches and Hagravens, and Illia's former home

quest_giver.name: Illia
quest_giver.description: a repenting mage who has never killed an innocent person

tools: Illia just killed a female witch in front of the player
Illia and the witch were supposed to find a human sacrifice: the witch attacked Illia because Illia could not do it
description:
By the gods! I know this looks bad. Let me explain...
I called Darklight Tower home, now I know that was a mistake. I am, or was part of a coven serving the Hagravens that live there. So was she.
We were supposed to find a sacrifice. Human sacrifice. I told her I couldn't do it and she attacked me. I've done horrible things living here, but never taken an innocent life. I couldn't just find some person for them to kill. We needed a sacrifice for the Initiation. My mother is going to become one of those things, Hagravens. I can't be a part of that. Gods, I can't run away from this.
I'm going up there to stop her. This cycle must end. I don't know what brought you here, but I could use your help, if you're willing. Follow me. We have to fight our way up the Tower. I don't think anyone else here is about to have a change of heart.

name: Feeding the Addiction
objective: convince Geldis to let Bralsa Drel drink at The Retching Netch
first_tasks: talk to Geldis about Bralsa Drel

quest_giver.name: Bralsa Drel
quest_giver.description: a former great miner who lost her job when the mine dried up

reward.description: the player gets what's coming to them

characters.name: Geldis
characters.description: a male barkeeper who owns the The Retching Netch

tools: NONE
description:
Doesn't everyone pity the hopeless? Look at me... I'm no better than a beggar.
I used to be a miner, a good one too. I made more gold digging up ore in a month than some people earn in a lifetime. When the mine dried up, I was lost. I have no other trade, so I spend my time drinking my fortune away at the Retching Netch... or I used to anyway.
That fetcher Geldis won't even allow me inside. Said I was bad for business. If I want to spend my last bag of coins getting drunk, that's my business. What does he care?
If you can get that stubborn mule to let me into the Netch, I'll make sure you get what's coming to you.

name: From the Ashes
objective: help Talvas Fathryon by killing an Ash Guardian
first_tasks: kill the Ash Guardian

characters.name: Neloth
characters.description: a powerful male wizard

tools: Talvas Fathryon conjured an Ash Guardian without Neloth's approval: the Ash Guardian is not under Talvas Fathryon's control
description:
You've got to help me! I conjured an Ash Guardian and now it's running amok in Tel Mithryn.
Master Neloth refused to teach me the Ash Guardian spell. So I read his spell book on my own and learned it. Something went wrong when I cast it. The creature is attacking everything in sight.
I need to keep Master Neloth distracted so he doesn't find out what I did. There is no telling what he would do to me. While you are taking care of the creature, I'll try to figure out what went wrong.
I don't have any gold to pay you with, but I can give you this staff.

name: Deceiving the Herd
objective: frame the Dawnguard for murder
first_tasks: murder someone influential in public while wearing Dawnguard armor and plant a note on the victim
tools: Feran Sadri gives the player Dawnguard armor, and a note for framing the Dawnguard
description:
The Dawnguard have increased their operations and have been aggressively recruiting in Whiterun.
We need to put a damper on their efforts and give those trouble makers something to worry about other than harassing our interests.
You are to make a public show of murdering someone. Do it in the streets for all to see. The higher the profile the better. Someone attached to the court, a merchant, a bard, a priest, someone with stature. Make it seem you are a member of the Dawnguard, thus sowing confusion among the herd. Wear this armor and plant this note on the victim.
The people will put pressure on the Dawnguard who are apparently murdering their fellows without provocation. Their focus will be shifted from us, giving us one less nuisance to deal with.

name: The Final Descent
objective: find out what happened to Gratian Caerellius
first_tasks: find and unlock the locked off section of the mine

first_task_locations.name: Raven Rock Mine
first_task_locations.description: a worthless and tainted mine in Raven Rock

characters.name: Gratian Caerellius

tools: the East Empire Company swept something big under the rug two centuries ago: it killed Gratian Caerellius and ruined the Raven Rock Mine

description:
Who in the blazes are you?! Can't you see I'm busy? Or, perhaps you could help me. Hmph, maybe. Been difficult trusting people lately, they think I'm crazy.
Mark my words, these mines hold a secret that could put Raven Rock back on the map. A secret the East Empire Company swept under the rug two centuries ago. It killed my great-grandfather, Gratian Caerellius, and left Raven Rock with a worthless and tainted mine.
East Empire Company called it "a terrible accident", claiming that he was lost in a rockfall, but I know better. My wife and I were cleaning out our home, and we came across some of my great-grandfather's things locked in an old chest. I found an unsent letter he'd written to the East Empire Company, and a key.
The letter describes a discovery that was made in the mine by some of the diggers. They wanted Gratian to take a closer look. The East Empire Company must have felt it was of great value, as they locked that section of the mine off from everyone else. I assume the key unlocks that section of the mine. I haven't been able to find the entrance.
I'm telling you... there's something big down there, something that the East Empire Company wanted to hide from everyone.

description:
Midden Incident Report
by Anonymous

The missing students were found in the Midden this morning. Dead, as expected. None of us bothered keeping a detect life charm for the search at this point.
The bodies were found together, each suffering the same deformities; peeled and bubbling skin on the arms and face. Conjurer's burn, as it's commonly referred to around the College. There's little doubt they were attempting a summoning ritual well beyond their capabilities.
The relic nearby put any doubt in this theory to rest. I admit that I've never seen one like it - a large, segmented sculpture of a gauntlet, the Daedric sigil 'O' emblazoned upon the palm. Attempts to move it were in vain. I must show it to the Archmage during his upcoming visit. Perhaps he will know more.
While we couldn't move the relic, I was able to pry four "rings" from it. I'm sure there's a connection between them and the ritual the students were attempting.
I'll store these in the Arcanaeum until we can consult with a conjuration master to learn more.
